Look ye on Vishnu's works whereby the Friend of Indra,
 close allied,
 Hath let his holy ways be seen.
meaning: म॒ही द्यौः॑ पृथि॒वी च॑ न इ॒मं य॒ज्ञं मि॑मिक्षताम् । पि॑पृ॒तां नो॒ भरी॑मभिः ।।

text:
Firm art thou, a sustainer. Hence engendered, forth from
 these wombs at first came Jâtavedas.
 By Gâyatrî, by Trishtup, by Anushtup, may he who knows
 bear to the Gods oblation.
meaning: विष्णोः॒ कर्मा॑णि पश्यत॒ यतो॑ व्र॒तानि॑ पस्प॒शे । इन्द्र॑स्य॒ युज्यः॒ सखा॑ ।।

text:
Take thou thine ease for food, for store of riches, for might
 in splendour, and for strength and offspring.
 Thou art all-ruling, independent Ruler: both fountains of
 Sarasvatî protect thee!
meaning: ध्रु॒वासि॑ ध॒रुणे॒तो ज॑ज्ञे प्रथ॒ममे॒भ्यो योनि॑भ्यो॒ अधि॑ जा॒तवे॑दः । स गा॑य॒त्र्या त्रि॒ष्टुभा॑नु॒ष्टुभा॑ च दे॒वेभ्यो॑ ह॒व्यं व॑हतु प्रजा॒नन् ।।

text:
O radiant Agni, harness thou thy steeds which are most excellent!
 They bear thee as thy spirit wills.
meaning: इ॒षे रा॒ये र॑मस्व॒ सह॑से द्यु॒म्न ऊ॒र्जे अप॑त्याय । स॒म्राड॑सि स्व॒राड॑सि सारस्वतौ॒ त्वोत्सौ॒ प्राव॑ताम् ।।

text:
Yoke, Agni, as a charioteer, thy steeds who best invoke the
 Gods:
 As ancient Hotar take thy seat.
meaning: अग्ने॑ यु॒क्ष्वा हि ये तवाश्वा॑सो देव सा॒धवः॑ । अरं॒ वह॑न्ति म॒न्यवे॑ ।।

text:
Like rivers our libations flow together, cleansing themselves
 in inmost heart and spirit.
 I look upon the flowing streams of butter: the golden reed
 is in the midst of Agni.
meaning: यु॒क्ष्वा हि दे॑व॒हूत॑माँ॒ अश्वाँ॑ अग्ने र॒थीरि॑व । नि होता॑ पू॒र्व्यः स॑दः ।।

text:
Thee for the praise-verse, thee for sheen, thee for bright
 splendour, thee for light.
 This hath become the energetic spirit of all the world and of
 Vaisvânara Agni.
meaning: स॒म्यक्स्र॑वन्ति स॒रितो॒ न धेना॑ अ॒न्तर्हृ॒दा मन॑सा पू॒यमा॑नाः । घृ॒तस्य॒ धारा॑ अ॒भि चा॑कशीमि हिर॒ण्ययो॑ वेत॒सो मध्ये॑ अ॒ग्नेः ।।

text:
Agni, all-luminous with light, splendid with splendour, golden
 One.
 Giver of thousands art thou: for a thousand thee.
meaning: ऋ॒चे त्वा॑ रु॒चे त्वा॑ भा॒से त्वा॒ ज्योति॑षे त्वा । अभू॑दि॒दं विश्व॑स्य॒ भुव॑नस्य॒ वाजि॑नम॒ग्नेर्वै॑श्वान॒रस्य॑ च ।।

text:
Balm thou with milk the unborn babe Âditya, wearing all
 forms, creator of a thousand.
 Spare, him with heat, nor plot against him: give him a
 hundred years of life while thou art building.
meaning: अ॒ग्निर्ज्योति॑षा॒ ज्योति॑ष्मान्रु॒क्मो वर्च॑सा॒ वर्च॑स्वान् । स॑हस्र॒दा अ॑सि स॒हस्रा॑य त्वा ।।

text:
The wind's impetuous rush, Varuna's navel! the horse that
 springs to life amid the waters!
 The rivers’ tawny child, based on the mountain, harm not,
 O Agni, in the loftiest region.
meaning: आ॑दि॒त्यं गर्भं॒ पय॑सा॒ सम॑ङ्धि स॒हस्र॑स्य प्रति॒मां वि॒श्वरू॑पम् । परि॑ वृङ्धि॒ हर॑सा॒ माभि मँ॑स्थाः श॒तायु॑षं कृणुहि ची॒यमा॑नः ।।

text:
Unwasting Drop, red, eager, pressing forward, Agni I worship
 with repeated homage.
 Forming thyself with joints in proper order, harm not the
 Cow, Aditi widely ruling!
meaning: वा॒तस्य॑ जू॒तिं वरु॑णस्य॒ नाभि॒मश्वं॑ जज्ञा॒नँ स॑रि॒रस्य॒ मध्ये॑ । शिशुं॑ न॒दीनाँ॒ हरि॒मद्रि॑बुध्न॒मग्ने॒ मा हिँ॑सीः पर॒मे व्यो॑मन् ।।

text:
Her who is Tvashtar's guardian, Varuna's navel, the Ewe
 brought forth from out the loftiest region,
 The Asura's mighty thousandfold contrivance, injure not in
 the highest sphere, O Agni.
meaning: अज॑स्र॒मिन्दु॑मरु॒षं भु॑र॒ण्युम॒ग्निमी॑डे पू॒र्वचि॑त्ति॒ नमो॑भिः । स पर्व॑भिरृतु॒शः कल्प॑मानो॒ गां मा हिँ॑सी॒रदि॑तिं वि॒राज॑म् ।।

text:
The Agni who from Agni had his being, from heat of Earth
 or also heat of Heaven,
 Whereby the Omnific One engendered creatures, him may
 thy fierce displeasure spare, O Agni.
meaning: वरू॑त्रीं॒ त्वष्टु॒र्वरु॑णस्य॒ नाभि॒मविं॑ जज्ञा॒नाँ रज॑सः॒ पर॑स्मात् । म॒हीँ सा॑ह॒स्रीमसु॑रस्य मा॒यामग्ने॒ मा हिँ॑सीः प॒र्मे व्यो॑मन् ।।

text:
The brilliant presence of the Gods hath risen, the eye of
 Mitra, Varuna, and Agni.
 The soul of all that moveth not or moveth, the Sun hath
 filled the air, and earth and heaven.
meaning: यो ग्निर॒ग्नेरधि॒यजा॑यत॒ शोका॑त्पृथि॒व्या उ॒त वा॑ दि॒वस्परि॑ । येन॑ प्र॒जा वि॒श्वक॑र्मा ज॒जान॒ तम॑ग्ने॒ हेडः॒ परि॑ ते वृणक्तु ।।

text:
Injure not, thousand-eyed, while thou art building for sacrifice,
 this animal, the biped.

Accept as pith man's counterfeit the victim, Agni: therewith
 building thy forms, be settled.
 Let thy flame reach man's counterfeit: let thy flame reach
 the man we hate.
meaning: चि॒त्रं दे॒वाना॒मुद॑गा॒दनी॑कं॒ चक्षु॑र्मि॒त्रस्य॒ वरु॑णस्या॒ग्नेः । आप्रा॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी अ॒न्तरि॑क्षँ॒ सूर्य॑ आ॒त्मा जग॑तस्त॒स्थुष॑श्च ।।

text:
Harm not this animal whose hooves are solid, the courser
 neighing in the midst of coursers.
 I dedicate to thee the forest Gaura: building thy bodies up
 with him be settled.
 Let thy flame reach the Gaura, let thy flame reach him whom
 we detest.
meaning: इ॒मं मा हिँ॑सीर्द्वि॒पादं॑ प॒शुँ स॑हस्रा॒क्षो मेधा॑य ची॒यमा॑नः । म॒युं प॒शुं मेध॑मग्ने जुषस्व॒ तेन॑ चिन्वा॒नस्त॒न्वो॒ नि षी॑द । म॒युं ते॒ शुगृ॑च्छतु॒ यं द्वि॒ष्मस्तं ते॒ शुगृ॑च्छतु ।।

text:
Thousandfold, with a hundred streams, this fountain,
 expanded in the middle of the waters,
 Infinite, yielding butter for the people, harm not, O Agni,
 in the highest region.
 This wild bull of the forest I assign thee: building thy
 bodies up therewith be settled.
 Let thy flame reach the wild hull, etc. (as in 48).
meaning: इ॒मं मा हिँ॑सी॒रेक॑शपं प॒शुं क॑निक्र॒दं वा॒जिनं॒ वाजि॑नेषु । गौ॒रमा॑र॒ण्यमनु॑ ते दिशामि॒ तेन॑ चिन्वा॒नस्त॒न्वो॒ नि षी॑द । गौ॒रं ते॒ शुगृ॑च्छतु॒ यं द्वि॒ष्मस्तं ते॒ शुगृ॑च्छतु ।।

text:
This creature clothed in wool, Varuna's navel, the skin of
 animals quadruped and biped,
 The first that was produced of Tvashtar's creatures, O Agni,
 harm not in the highest region.
 The forest buffalo do I assign thee: building, etc., as above

mutato mutando
.
meaning: इ॒मँ सा॑ह॒स्रँ श॒तधा॑र॒मुत्सं॑ व्य॒च्यमा॑नँ सरि॒रस्य॒ मध्ये॑ । घृ॒तं दुहा॑ना॒मदि॑तिं॒ जना॒याग्ने॒ मा हिँ॑सीः पर॒मे व्यो॑मन् । ग॑व॒यमा॑र॒ण्यमनु॑ ते दिशामि॒ तेन॑ चिन्वा॒नस्त॒न्वो॒ नि षी॑द । ग॑व॒यं ते॒ शुगृ॑च्छतु॒ यं द्वि॒ष्मस्तं ते॒ शुगृ॑च्छतु ।।

text:
From Agni's warmth the he-goat had his being: he looked
 at first upon his generator.
 Thereby the Gods at first attained to Godhead: those meet
 for worship to the height ascended.
 The forest Sarabha do I assign thee: building, etc.
meaning: इ॒ममू॑र्णा॒युं वरु॑णस्य॒ नाभिं॒ त्वचं॑ पशू॒नां द्वि॒पदां॒चतु॑ष्पदाम् । त्वष्टुः॑ प्र॒जानां॑ प्रथ॒मं ज॒नित्र॒मग्ने॒ मा हिँ॑सीः पर॒मे व्यो॑मन् । उष्ट्र॑मार॒ण्यमनु॑ ते दिशामि॒ तेन॑ चिन्वा॒नस्त॒न्वो॒ नि षी॑द । उष्ट्रं॑ ते॒ शुगृ॑च्छतु॒ यं द्वि॒ष्मस्तं ते॒ शुगृ॑च्छतु ।।

text:
Do thou, Most Youthful God, protect the men who offer,
 hear their songs,
 Protect his offspring and himself.
meaning: अ॒जो ह्य॒ग्नेरज॑निष्ट॒ शोका॒त्सो अ॑पश्यज्जनि॒तार॒मग्रे॑ । तेन॑ दे॒वा दे॒वता॒मग्र॑मायँ॒स्तेन॒ रोह॑माय॒न्नुप॒ मेध्या॑सः । श॑र॒भमा॑र॒ण्यमनु॑ ते दिशामि॒ तेन॑ चिन्वा॒नस्त॒न्वो॒ नि षी॑द । श॑र॒भं ते॒ शुगृ॑च्छतु॒ यं द्वि॒ष्मस्तं ते॒ शुगृ॑च्छतु ।।

text:
I set thee in the passage of the waters. I set thee in the
 swelling of the waters. I set thee in the ashes of the
 waters. I set thee in the lustre of the waters. I set
 thee in the way which waters travel. I set thee in the
 flood, the place to test in. I set thee in the sea, the place
 to rest in. I set thee in the stream, the place to rest in.
 I set thee in the water's habitation. I set thee in the
 resting-place of waters. I set thee in the station of the
 waters. I set thee in the meeting-place of waters. I set
 thee in the birthplace of the waters. I set thee in the
 refuse of the waters. I set thee in the residence of waters.
 I settle thee with the Gâyatrî metre. I settle thee with
 the Trishtup metre. I settle thee with the Jagatî metre.
 I settle thee with the Anushtup metre. I settle thee
 with the Pankti metre.
meaning: त्वं य॑विष्ठ दा॒शुषो॒ नॄँः पा॑हि शृणु॒धी गिरः॑ । रक्षा॑ तो॒कमु॒त त्मना॑ ।।

text:
This, in front, is Bhuva. His offspring, Breath, is Bhauvâyana.
 Spring is Prânâyana. The Gâyatrî is the daughter
 of Spring. From the Gâyatrî comes the Gâyatra tune.
 From the Gâyatra the Upâmsu. From the Upâmsu the
 Trivrit. From the Trivrit the Rathantara. The Rishi
 Vasishtha. By thee, taken by Prajâpati, I take vital
 breath for creatures.
meaning: अ॒पां त्वेम॑न्त्सादयामि । अ॒पां त्वोद्म॑न्त्सादयामि । अ॒पां त्वा॒ भस्म॑न्त्सादयामि । अ॒पां त्वा॒ ज्योति॑षि सादयामि । अ॒पां त्वाय॑ने सादयामि । अ॑र्ण॒वे त्वा॒ सद॑ने सादयामि । स॑मु॒द्रे त्वा॒ सद॑ने सादयामि । स॑रि॒रे त्वा॒ सद॑ने सादयामि । अ॒पां त्वा॒ क्षये॑ सादयामि । अ॒पां त्वा॒ सधि॑षि सादयामि । अ॒पां त्वा॒ सद॑ने सादयामि । अ॒पां त्वा॑ स॒धस्थे॑ सादयामि । अ॒पां त्वा॒ योनौ॑ सादयामि । अ॒पां त्वा॒ पुरी॑षे सादयामि । अ॒पां त्वा॒ पाथ॑सि सादयामि । गा॑य॒त्रेण॑ त्वा॒ छन्द॑सा सादयामि । त्रै॑ष्टुभेन त्वा॒ छन्द॑सा सादयामि । जाग॑तेन त्वा॒ छन्द॑सा सादयामि । आनु॑ष्टुभेन त्वा॒ छन्द॑सा सादयामि । पाङ्क्ते॑न त्वा॒ छन्द॑सा सादयामि ।।

text:
This on the right, the Omnific. His, the Omnific's offspring,
 Mind. Summer sprang from Mind. The Trishtup is the
 daughter of Summer. From the Trishtup came the Svâra
 song. From the Svâra the Antaryâma. From the
 Antaryâma the Pañchadasa. From the Pañchadasa the
 Brihat. The Rishi Bharadvâja. By thee, taken by
 Prajâpati, I take Mind for creatures.
meaning: अ॒यं पु॒रो भुवः॑ । तस्य॑ प्रा॒णो भौ॑वना॒यः । व॑स॒न्तः प्रा॑ण्य॒नः । गा॑य॒त्री वा॑स॒न्ती । गा॑यत्र्यै गाय॒त्रम् । गा॑य॒त्रादु॑पाँ॒शुः । उ॑पाँ॒शोस्त्रि॒वृत् । त्रि॒वृतो॑ रथन्त॒रम् । वसि॑ष्ठ॒ ऋषिः॑ । प्र॒जाप॑तिगृहीतया॒ त्वया॑ प्रा॒णं गृ॑ह्णामि प्र॒जाभ्यः॑ ।।

text:
This on the western side, the All-Embracer. His, the
 All-Embracer's offspring, the Eye. The Rains sprang from
 the Eye. The Jagatî is the daughter of the Rains.
 From the Jagatî came the Riksama. From the Riksama
 the Sukra. From the Sukra the Saptadasa. From the
 Saptadasa the Vairûpa. The Rishi Jamadagni. By thee,
 taken by Prajâpati, I take the Eye for creatures.
meaning: अ॒यं द॑क्षि॒णा वि॒श्वक॑र्मा । तस्य॒ मनो॑ वैश्वकर्म॒णम् । ग्री॒ष्मो मा॑न॒सः । त्रि॒ष्टुब्ग्रै॒ष्मी । त्रि॒ष्टुभः॑ स्वा॒रम् । स्वा॒राद॑न्तर्या॒मः । अ॑न्तर्या॒मात्प॑ञ्चद॒शः । प॑ञ्चद॒शाद्बृ॒हत् । भ॒रद्वा॑ज॒ ऋषिः॑ । प्र॒जाप॑तिगृहीतया॒ त्वया॒ मनो॑ गृह्णामि प्र॒जाभ्यः॑ ।।

text:
This on the north side, heaven. This, heaven's offspring,
 the Ear. Autumn, the daughter of the Ear. The Anushtup
 sprang from Autumn. From the Anushtup came the
 Aida. From the Aida the Manthin. From the Manthin
 the Ekavimsa. From the Ekavimsa the Vairâja. The
 Rishi Visvâmitra. By thee, taken by Prajâpati, I take
 the Ear for creatures.
meaning: अ॒यं प॒श्चाद्वि॒श्वव्य॑चाः । तस्य॒ चक्षु॑र्वैश्वव्यच॒सम् । व॒र्षाश्चाक्षु॑ष्यः । जग॑ती वा॒र्षी । जग॑त्या॒ ऋक्स॑मम् । ऋक्स॑माच्छु॒क्रः । शु॒क्रात्स॑प्तद॒शः । स॑प्तद॒शाद्वै॑रू॒पम् । ज॒मद॑ग्नि॒रृषिः॑ । प्र॒जाप॑तिगृहीतया॒ त्वया॒ चक्षु॑र्गृह्णामि प्र॒जाभ्यः॑ ।।

text:
This above, Intellect. Its, Intellect's offspring, Speech.
 Winter the offspring of Speech. Pankti sprang from
 Winter. From Pankti the Nidhanavat. From the
 Nidhanavat came the Âgrayana. From the Âgrayana the
 Trinava and the Trayastrimsa. From the Trinava and
 the Trayastrimsa the Sâkvara and the Raivata. The
 Rishi Visvakarman. By thee, taken by Visvakarman,
 I take Speech for people.
 Fill up the room, etc. The dappled kine, etc. All sacred
 songs, etc., three texts repeated from XII. 54-56.
meaning: इ॒दं उ॑त्त॒रात्स्वः॑ । तस्य॒ शोत्रँ॑ सौ॒वम् । श॒रच्छ्रौ॒त्री । अ॑नु॒ष्टुप्शा॑र॒दी । अ॑नु॒ष्टुभ॑ ऐ॒डम् । अै॒डान्म॒न्थी । म॒न्थिन॑ एकविँ॒शः । ए॑कविँ॒शाद्वै॑रा॒जम् । वि॒श्वामि॑त्र॒ ऋषिः॑ । प्र॒जाप॑तिगृहीतया॒ त्वया॒ श्रोत्रं॑ गृह्णामि प्र॒जाभ्यः॑ ।।

text:
WITH stedfast site and birthplace thou art stedfast: settle
 thou duly in thy stedfast birthplace, rejoicing in the
 Ukhya's first appearance.
 Here let the Asvins, the Adhvaryus, seat thee.
meaning: ध्रु॒वक्षि॑तिर्ध्रु॒वयो॑निर्ध्रु॒वासि॑ ध्रु॒वं योनि॒मा सी॑द साधु॒या । उख्य॑स्य के॒तुं प्र॑थ॒मं जु॑षा॒णा । अ॒श्विना॑ध्व॒र्यू सा॑दयतामि॒ह त्वा॑ ।।

text:
Nesting, intelligent, dripping with butter, in the auspicious
 seat of earth be seated.
 Let Rudras, Vasus welcome thee with praises: fill full these
 prayers for our propitious fortune.
 Here let the Asvins, the Adhvaryus, seat thee.
meaning: कु॑ला॒यिनी॑ घृ॒तव॑ती॒ पुरं॑धिः स्यो॒ने सी॑द॒ सद॑ने पृथि॒व्याः । अ॒भि त्वा॑ रु॒द्रा वस॑वो गृणन्त्वि॒मा ब्रह्म॑ पीपिहि सौभगाय । अ॒श्विना॑ध्व॒र्यू सा॑दयतामि॒ह त्वा॑ ।।

text:
Here, Guard of Strength, with thine own powers be seated
 for the Gods’ happiness and great enjoyment.
 Even as a father to his son, be friendly: with easy entrance
 enter with thy body. Here let the Asvins, the Adhvaryus
 seat thee:
meaning: स्वै॒र्दक्षै॒र्दक्ष॑पिते॒ह सी॑द दे॒वानाँ॑ सु॒म्ने बृ॑ह॒ते रणा॑य । पि॒तेवै॑धि सू॒नव॒ आ सु॒शेवा॑ स्वावे॒शा त॒न्वा॒ सं वि॑शस्व । अ॒श्विना॑ध्व॒र्यू सा॑दयतामि॒ह त्वा॑ ।।

text:
Thou art the filling-stuff of earth called Apsas. May all the
 Gods celebrate thee with praises.
 Enriched with songs of praise, Prishthas and butter, sit here
 and give us wealth with store of children.
 Here let the Asvins, etc.
meaning: पृ॑थि॒व्याः पुरी॑षम॒स्यप्सो॒ नाम॒ तां त्वा॒ विश्वे॑ अ॒भि गृ॑णन्तु दे॒वाः । स्तोम॑पृष्ठा घृ॒तव॑ती॒ह सी॑द प्र॒जाव॑द॒स्मे द॑र्वि॒णा य॑जस्व । अ॒श्विना॑ध्व॒र्यू सा॑दयतामि॒ह त्वा॑ ।।

text:
Upon the back of Aditi I lay thee the sky's supporter, pillar
 of the Quarters,
 Queen over creatures. Wave and drop of waters art thou;
 and Visvakarman is thy Rishi.
meaning: अदि॑त्यास्त्वा पृ॒ष्ठे सा॑दयाम्य॒न्तरि॑क्षस्य ध॒र्त्रीं वि॒ष्टम्भ॑नीं दि॒शामधि॑पत्नीं॒ भुव॑नानामू॒र्मिर्द्र॒प्सो अ॒पाम॑सि वि॒श्वक॑र्मा त॒ ऋषिः॑ । अ॒श्विना॑ध्व॒र्यू सा॑दयतामि॒ह त्वा॑ ।।

text:
Sukra and Suchi, seasons, both, of summer—thou art the
 innermost cement of Agni.
 May Heaven and Earth, may Waters, Plants and Agnis help,
 separate, accordant, my precedence.

Let all the Agnis ’twixt the earth and heaven gather together
 round these summer seasons, as the Gods gather in their
 hosts round Indra,
 Firm, with that Deity, Angiras-like, be seated.
meaning: शु॒क्रश्च॒ शुचि॑श्च ग्रैष्मावृ॒तू अ॒ग्नेर॑न्तःश्ले॒षो॑ सि॒ कल्पे॑तां॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी कल्प॑न्ता॒माप॒ ओष॑धयः॒ कल्प॑न्ताम॒ग्नयः॒ पृथ॒ङ्नम ज्यैष्ठ्याय॒ सव्र॑ताः । ये अ॒ग्नयः॒ सम॑नसो न्त॒रा द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी इ॒मे ग्रै॒ष्मावृ॒तू अ॑भि॒कल्प॑माना॒ इन्द्र॑मिव दे॒वा अ॑भि॒सं वि॑शन्तु॒ तया॑ दे॒वत॑याङ्गिर॒स्वद्ध्रु॒वे सी॑दतम् ।।

text:
Associate with the Seasons, with the Modes with the Gods,
 with the health-establishing Gods—may the Asvins the
 Adhvaryus settle thee here for Agni Vaisvânara.
 Associate.............with the Vasus, etc.
 Associate.............with the Rudras, etc.
 Associate.............with the Âdityas, etc.
 Associate.............with the Visvedevas, etc.
meaning: स॒जूरृ॒तुभिः॑ स॒जूर्वि॒धाभिः॑ स॒जूर्देवैः स॒जूर्देवैर्वयोनाधैर॒ग्नये॑ त्वा वैश्वान॒राया॒�॒र्यू सा॑दयतामि॒ह त्वा॑ । स॒जूरृ॒तुभिः॑ स॒जूर्वि॒धाभिः॑ स॒जूर्वसु॑भिः स॒जूर्देवैर्वयोनाधैर॒ग्नये॑ त्वा वैश्वान॒राय�॒र्यू सा॑दयतामि॒ह त्वा॑ । स॒जूरृ॒तुभिः॑ स॒जूर्वि॒धाभिः॑ स॒जू रुद्रैः स॒जूर्देवैर्वयोनाधैर॒ग्नये॑ त्वा वैश्वान॒राया॒॒र्यू सा॑दयतामि॒ह त्वा॑ । स॒जूरृ॒तुभिः॑ स॒जूर्वि॒धाभिः॑ स॒जूरा॑दित्यैः स॒जूर्देवैर्वयोनाधैर॒ग्नये॑ त्वा वैश्वान॒रा�॒र्यू सा॑दयतामि॒ह त्वा॑ । स॒जूरृ॒तुभिः॑ स॒जूर्वि॒धाभिः॑ स॒जूर्विश्वै॑र्देवैः स॒जूर्देवैर्वयोनाधैर॒ग्नये॑ त्वा वैश्वान॒राया॒श्विना॑ध्व॒र्यू सा॑दयतामि॒ह त्वा॑ ।।

text:
Guard thou my breath. Guard my out-breathing. Guard
 my through-breathing. Illume mine eye with far-reaching
 vision. Give power of hearing to mine ear. Pour
 forth waters. Quicken plants. Protect bipeds. Protect
 quadrupeds. Send rain from heaven.
meaning: प्रा॒णं मे॑ पाहि । अ॑पा॒नं मे॑ पाहि । व्या॒नं मे॑ पाहि । चक्षु॑र्म उ॒र्व्या वि भा॑हि । श्रोत्रं॑ मे श्लोकय । अ॒पः पि॑न्व । ओष॑धीर्जिन्व । द्वि॒पाद॑व । चतु॑ष्पात्पाहि । दि॒वो वृष्टि॒मेर॑य ।।

text:
The head is vital vigour. Prajâpati became the metre.
 Royalty is vital vigour, health-giving metre. The Supporter
 is vital vigour, the Sovran Lord the metre. Visvakarman
 is vital vigour, Parameshthin the metre. The he-goat is
 vital vigour, excellent the metre. The bull is vital vigour,
 extensive the metre. Man is vital vigour, languid the
 metre. The tiger is vital vigour, invincible the metre. The
 lion is vital vigour, covering the metre. The four-year
 bull is vital vigour, Brihatî the metre. The ox is vital
 vigour, Kakup the metre. The steer is vital vigour,
 Satobrihatî the metre.
meaning: मू॒र्धा वयः॑ प्र॒जाप॑ति॒श्छन्दः॑ । क्ष॒त्रं वयो॒ मयं॑दं॒ छन्दः॑ । वि॑ष्ट॒म्भो वयो धि॑पति॒श्छन्दः॑ । वि॒श्वक॑र्मा॒ वयः॑ परमे॒ष्ठी छन्दः॑ । व॒स्तो वयो॑ विव॒लं छन्दः॑ । वृष्णि॒र्वयो॑ विशा॒लं छन्दः॑ । पुरु॑षो॒ वय॑स्त॒न्द्रं छन्दः॑ । व्या॒घ्रो वयो ना॑धृष्टं॒ छन्दः॑ । सिँ॒हो वय॑श्छ॒दिश्छन्दः॑ । प॑ष्ठ॒वाड्वयो॑ बृह॒ती छन्दः॑ । उ॒क्षा वयः॑ क॒कुप्छन्दः॑ । ऋ॑ष॒भो वयः॑ स॒तोबृ॑हती॒ छन्दः॑ ।।

text:
The bullock is vital vigour, Pankti the metre. The milch-cow
 is vital vigour, Jagatî the metre. The eighteen-month
 calf is vital vigour, Trishtup the metre. The two
 year old steer is vital vigour, Virâj the metre. The
 thirty-month old ewe is vital vigour, Gâyatrî the metre. The
 three year old steer is vital vigour, Ushnih the metre.
 The four year old ox is vital vigour, Anushtup the metre.
 Fill up the room, etc. The dappled kine, etc. All sacred
 songs, etc. are three texts repeated from XII. 54-56.
 See also XIII. 58.
meaning: अ॑न॒ड्वान्वयः॑ प॒ङ्क्तिश्छन्दः॑ । धे॒नुर्वयो॒ जग॑ती॒ छन्दः॑ । त्र्यवि॒र्वय॑स्त्रि॒ष्टुप्छन्दः॑ । दि॑त्य॒वाड्वयो॑ वि॒राट्छन्दः॑ । पञ्चा॑वि॒र्वयो॑ गाय॒त्री छन्दः॑ । त्रि॑व॒त्सो वय॑ उ॒ष्णिक्छन्दः॑ । तु॑र्य॒वाड्वयो॑ नु॒ष्टुप्छन्दः॑ । लो॒कं पृ॑ण छि॒द्रं पृ॒णाथो॑ सीद ध्रु॒वा त्वम् । इ॑न्द्रा॒ग्नी त्वा॒ बृह॒स्पति॑र॒स्मिन्योना॑वसीषदन् । ता अ॑स्य॒ सूद॑दोहसः॒ सोमँ॑ श्रीणन्ति॒ पृश्न॑यः । जन्म॑न्दे॒वानां॒ विश॑स्त्रि॒ष्वा रो॑च॒ने दि॒वः । इन्द्रं॒ विश्वा॑ अवीवृधन्त्समु॒द्रव्य॑चसं॒ गिरः॑ । र॒थीत॑मँ र॒थीनां॒ वाजा॑नाँ॒ सत्प॑तिं॒ पति॑म् ।।

text:
Indra and Agni, in its place securely set the unshaking brick.
 Thou with thy back sunderest heaven and the broad earth
 and firmament.
meaning: इन्द्रा॑ग्नी॒ अव्य॑थमाना॒मिष्ट॑कां दृँहतं यु॒वम् । पृ॒ष्ठेन॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी अ॒न्तरि॑क्षं च॒ विबा॑धसे ।।

text:
On the air's back let Visvakarman set thee, thee the capacious,
 thee the far-extended.
 Control the air, fix firm the air, do thou the air no injury.
 For all breath, out-breath, through-breath, upward breathing,
 for high position, for prescribed observance,
 May Vâyu keep thee safe with great well-being, with securest
 shelter. In the manner of Angiras, with that Deity
 lie steady.
meaning: वि॒श्वक॑र्मा त्वा सादयत्व॒न्तरि॑क्च्५अ॑स्य पृ॒ष्ठे व्यच॑स्वतीं॒ प्रथ॑स्वतीम॒न्तरि॑क्षं यच्छा॒न्तरि॑क्षं दृँहा॒न्तरि॑क्षं॒ मा हिँ॑सीः । विश्व॑स्मै प्रा॒णाया॑पा॒नाय॑ व्या॒नायो॑दा॒नाय॑ प्रति॒ष्ठायै॑ च॒रित्रा॑य । वा॒युष्ट्वा॒भि पा॑तु म॒ह्या स्व॒स्त्या छ॒र्दिषा॒ शंत॑मेन॒ तया॑ दे॒वत॑याङ्गिर॒स्वद्ध्रु॒वा सी॑द ।।

text:
Queen art thou, Quarter of the East. Wide-ruler, Quarter
 of the South. West Quarter, thou art Sovran. Thou
 Autocrat, Quarter of the North.
 Queen Paramount art thou, the Lofty Point.
meaning: राज्ञ्य॑सि॒ प्राची॒ दिक् । वि॒राड॑सि॒ दक्षि॑णा॒ दिक् । स॒म्राड॑सि प्र॒तिची॒ दिक् । स्व॒राड॒स्युदी॑ची॒ दिक् । अधि॑पत्न्यसि बृह॒ती दिक् ।।

text:
On the air's back may Visvakarman set thee luminous.
 Control all light for all breath, for out-breath, up-breath,
 through-breath.
 Thy Lord is Vâyu, with that Deity, Angiras-like, lie firm.
meaning: वि॒श्वक॑र्मा त्वा सादयत्व॒न्तरि॑क्च्५अ॑स्य पृ॒ष्ठे ज्योति॑ष्मतीम् । विश्व॑स्मै प्रा॒णाया॑पा॒नाय॑ व्या॒नाय॒ विश्वं॒ ज्योति॑र्यच्छ । वा॒युष्टे धि॑पति॒स्तया॑ दे॒वत॑याङ्गिर॒स्वद्ध्रु॒वा सी॑द ।।

text:
Two Rainy Seasons, Nabhas and Nabhasya—thou art the
 innermost cement of Agni, etc. (as in XIII. 25).
meaning: नभ॑श्च नभ॒स्य॑श्च॒ वार्षि॑कावृ॒तू अ॒ग्नेर॑न्तःश्ले॒षो॑ सि॒ कल्पे॑तां॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी कल्प॑न्ता॒माप॒ ओष॑धयः॒ कल्प॑न्ताम॒ग्नयः॒ पृथ॒ङ्नम ज्यैष्ठ्याय॒ सव्र॑ताः । ये अ॒ग्नयः॒ सम॑नसो न्त॒रा द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी इ॒मे वार्षि॑कावृ॒तू अ॑भि॒कल्प॑माना॒ इन्द्र॑मिव दे॒वा अ॑भि॒सं वि॑शन्तु॒ तया॑ दे॒वत॑याङ्गिर॒स्वद्ध्रु॒वे सी॑दतम् ।।

text:
Isha and Ûrja, two Autumnal Seasons—thou art the innermost
 cement of Agni, etc.
meaning: इ॒षश्चो॒र्जश्च॑ शार॒दावृ॒तू अ॒ग्नेर॑न्तःश्ले॒षो॑ सि॒ कल्पे॑तां॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी कल्प॑न्ता॒प॒ ओष॑धयः॒ कल्प॑न्ताम॒ग्नयः॒ पृथ॒ङ्नम ज्यैष्ठ्याय॒ सव्र॑ताः । ये अ॒ग्नयः॒ सम॑नसो न्त॒रा द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी इ॒मे शा॑र॒दावृ॒तू अ॑भि॒कल्प॑माना॒ इन्द्र॑मिव दे॒वा अ॑भि॒सं वि॑शन्तु॒ तया॑ दे॒वत॑याङ्गिर॒स्वद्ध्रु॒वे सी॑दतम् ।।

text:
Preserve my life. Preserve my breath. Guard mine
 out-breath. Preserve mine eyes. Preserve mine ears.
 Strengthen my voice. Quicken my mind. Preserve my
 self. Vouchsafe me light.
meaning: आयु॑र्मे पाहि । प्रा॒णं मे॑ पाहि । अ॑पा॒नं मे॑ पाहि । व्या॒नं मे॑ पाहि । चक्षु॑र्मे पाहि । श्रोत्रं॑ मे पाहि । वाचं॑ मे पिन्व । मनो॑ मे जिन्व । आ॒त्मानं॑ मे पाहि । ज्योति॑र्मे यच्छ ।।

text:
Mâ metre. Pramâ metre. Pratimâ metre. Âsrivayas metre.
 Pankti metre. Ushnih metre. Brihatî metre. Anushtup
 metre. Virâj metre. Gâyatrî metre, Trishtup metre.
 Jagatî metre.
meaning: मा छन्दः॑ । प्र॒मा छन्दः॑ । प्र॑ति॒मा छन्दः॑ । अ॑म्री॒वय॒श्छन्दः॑ । प॒ङ्क्तिश्छन्दः॑ । उ॒ष्णिक्छन्दः॑ । बृ॑ह॒ती छन्दः॑ । अ॑नु॒ष्टुप्छन्दः॑ । वि॒राट्छन्दः॑ । गा॑य॒त्री छन्दः॑ । त्रि॒ष्टुप्छन्दः॑ । जग॑ती॒ छन्दः॑ ।।

text:
Earth metre. Sky metre. Heaven metre. Years metre.
 Nakshatras metre. Vâk metre. Mind metre. Husbandry
 metre. Gold metre. Cow metre. She-goat metre. Horse
 metre.
meaning: पृ॑थि॒वी छन्दः॑ । अ॒न्तरि॑क्षं॒ छन्दः॑ । द्यौ॒श्छन्दः॑ । समा॒श्छन्दः॑ । नक्ष॑त्राणि॒ छन्दः॑ । वाक्छन्दः॑ । मन॒श्छन्दः॑ । कृ॒षिश्छन्दः॑ । हिर॑ण्यं॒ छन्दः॑ । गौ॒श्छन्दः॑ । अ॒जा छन्दः॑ । अश्व॒श्छन्दः॑ ।।

text:
The Deity Agni. The Deity Vita. The Deity Sûrya. The
 Deity Moon. The Deity Vasus. The Deity Rudras. The
 Deity Âdityas The Deity Maruts. The Deity Visvedevas.
 The Deity Brihaspati. The Deity Indra. The Deity
 Varuna.
meaning: अ॒ग्निर्दे॒वता॑ । वातो॑ दे॒वता॑ । सूर्यो॑ दे॒वता॑ । च॒न्द्रमा॑ दे॒वता॑ । वस॑वो दे॒वता॑ । रु॒द्रा दे॒वता॑ । आ॑दि॒त्या दे॒वता॑ । म॒रुतो॑ दे॒वता॑ । विश्वे॑ दे॒वा दे॒वता॑ । बृह॒स्पति॑र्दे॒वता॑ । इन्द्रो॑ दे॒वता॑ । वरु॑णो दे॒वता॑ ।।

text:
Chief art thou, bright, supporting, firm, thou art the great
 sustainer, Earth.
 Thee for life, thee for lustre, thee for tillage, thee for peace
 and rest.
meaning: मू॒र्धासि॒ राड्ध्रु॒वासि॑ ध॒रुणा॑ ध॒र्त्र्य॑सि॒ धर॑णी । आयु॑षे त्वा॒ वर्च॑से त्वा कृष्यै त्वा॒ क्षेमा॑य त्वा ।।

text:
Controller, brilliant art thou, managing controller, firm
 sustainer. For strength, for energy thee, for riches thee,
 for prosperity thee.
 Fill up the room, etc. The dappled kine, etc. All sacred
 songs, etc. (as in 10).
meaning: यन्त्री॒ राड्य॒न्त्र्य॑सि॒ यम॑नी ध्रु॒वासि॒ धरि॑त्री । इ॒षे त्वो॒र्जे त्वा॑ रय्यै त्वा॒ पोषा॑य त्वा । लो॒कं पृ॑ण छि॒द्रं पृ॒णाथो॑ सीद ध्रु॒वा त्वम् । इ॑न्द्रा॒ग्नी त्वा॒ बृह॒स्पति॑र॒स्मिन्योना॑वसीषदन् । ता अ॑स्य॒ सूद॑दोहसः॒ सोमँ॑ श्रीणन्ति॒ पृश्न॑यः । जन्म॑न्दे॒वानां॒ विश॑स्त्रि॒ष्वा रो॑च॒ने दि॒वः । इन्द्रं॒ विश्वा॑ अवीवृधन्त्समु॒द्रव्य॑चसं॒ गिरः॑ । र॒थीत॑मँ र॒थीनां॒ वाजा॑नाँ॒ सत्प॑तिं॒ पति॑म् ।।

text:
This Swift, the triple praise-song. The Shining, the
 Pañchadasa hymn. Heaven, the Saptadasa. The Supporter, the
 Ekavimsa. Speed, the Ashtâdasa. Ardour, the Navadasa.
 Triumphant Onset, Savimsa, Vigour, Dvâvimsa. Maintenance,
 Trayovimsa. Womb, Chaturvimsa. Embryos,
 Pañchavimsa. Energy, the Trinava. Intention, the Ekatrimsa.
 The Basis, the Trayastrimsa. The Bright One's
 Station, the Chatustrimsa. The Vault of Heaven, the
 Shattrimsa. The Revolving One, the Ashtâchatvârimsa.
 The Support, the Four-divisioned praise-song.
meaning: आ॒शुर्त्रि॒वृत् । भा॒न्तः प॑ञ्चद॒शः । व्यो॑मा सप्तद॒शः । धरु॑ण एकविँ॒शः । प्रतू॑र्तिरष्टाद॒शः । तपो॑ नवद॒शः । अ॑भीव॒र्तः स॑विँ॒शः । वर्चो॑ द्वाविँ॒शः । सं॒भर॑णस्त्रयोविँ॒शः । योनि॑श्चतुर्विँ॒शः । गर्भाः॑ पञ्चविँ॒शः । ओज॑स्त्रिण॒वः । क्रतु॑रेकत्रिँ॒शः । प्र॑ति॒ष्ठा त्र॑यस्त्रिँ॒शः । ब्र॒ध्नस्य॑ वि॒ष्टपं॑ चतुस्त्रिँ॒शः । नाकः॑ षट्त्रिँ॒शः । वि॑व॒र्तो॑ ष्टाचत्वारिँशः । ध॒र्त्रं च॑तुष्टो॒मः ।।

text:
Thou art the portion of Agni, chief control of Consecration.
 The Priesthood is saved; the Trivrit Stoma.
 Thou art the portion of Indra, the sovranty of Vishnu. The
 Nobility is saved; the Pañchadasa Stoma.
 Thou art the share of the Man-beholders; the supremacy of
 the Creator; the birthplace is saved; the Saptadasa Stoma.
 Thou art the share of Mitra, the sovranty of Varuna. Rain
 of heaven and wind are saved; the Ekavimsa Stoma.
meaning: अ॒ग्नेर्भा॒गो॑ सि दी॒क्षाया॒ आधि॑पत्यं॒ ब्रह्म॑ स्पृ॒तं त्रि॒वृत्स्तोमः॑ । इन्द्र॑स्य भा॒गो॑ सि॒ विष्णो॒राधि॑पत्यं क्स॒त्रँ स्पृ॒तं प॑ञ्चद॒शः स्तोमः॑ । नृ॒चक्ष॑सां भा॒गो॑ सि धा॒तुराधि॑पत्यं ज॒नित्रँ॑ स्पृ॒तँ स॑प्तद॒शः स्तोमः॑ । मि॒त्रस्य॑ भा॒गो॑ सि॒ वरु॑ण॒स्याधि॑पत्यं दि॒वो वृष्टि॒र्वात॑ स्पृ॒त ए॑कविँ॒श स्तोमः॑ ।।

text:
Thou art the share of the Vasus, the sovranty of the Rudras.
 Quadrupeds are saved; the Chaturvimsa Stoma.
 Thou art the share of the Âdityas; the sovranty of the Maruts.
 The Embryos are saved; the
Pañchavimsa
 Stoma.
 Thou art the share of Aditi; the sovranty of Pûshan.
 Strength is saved; the Trinava Stoma.
 Thou art the share of God Savitar; the sovranty of Brihaspati.
 The universal Quarters are saved; the Chatushtoma
 Stoma.
meaning: वसू॑नां भा॒गो॑ सि रु॒द्राणा॒माधि॑पत्यं॒ चतु॑ष्पात्स्पृ॒तं च॑तुर्विँ॒श स्तोमः॑ । आ॑दि॒त्यानां॑ भा॒गो॑ सि म॒रुता॒माधि॑पत्यं॒ गर्भा॑ स्पृ॒ताः प॑ञ्चविँश॒ स्तोमः॑ । अदि॑त्यै भा॒गो॑ सि पू॒ष्ण आधि॑पत्य॒मोज॑ स्पृ॒तं त्रि॑ण॒व स्तोमः॑ । दे॒वस्य॑ सवि॒तुर्भा॒गो॑ सि॒ बृह॒स्पते॒राधि॑पत्यँ स॒मीची॒र्दिश॑ स्पृ॒ताश्च॑तुष्टो॒म स्तोमः॑ ।।

text:
Thou art the share of the Yavas; the sovranty of the Ayavas.
 Creatures are saved; the Chatuschatvârimsa Stoma.
 Thou art the share of the Ribhus; the sovranty of the
 Visvedevas. The Being is saved; the Trayastrimsa Stoma.
meaning: यवा॑नां भा॒गो॒ स्यय॑वाना॒माधि॑पत्यं प्र॒जा स्पृ॒ताश्च॑तुश्चत्वारिँ॒श स्तोमः॑ । ऋ॑भू॒णां भा॒गो॑ सि॒ विश्वे॑षां दे॒वाना॒माधि॑पत्यं भू॒तँ स्पृ॒तं त्र॑यस्त्रिँ॒श स्तोमः॑ ।।

text:
Sahas, Sahasya, the two Winter Seasons—thou art the innermost
 cement of Agni, etc. (as in XIII. 25).
meaning: सह॑श्च सह॒स्य॑श्च हैमन्तिकावृ॒तू अ॒ग्नेर॑न्तःश्ले॒षो॑ सि॒ कल्पे॑तां॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी कल्प॑न्ता॒माप॒ ओष॑धयः॒ कल्प॑न्ताम॒ग्नयः॒ पृथ॒ङ्नम ज्यैष्ठ्याय॒ सव्र॑ताः । ये अ॒ग्नयः॒ सम॑नसो न्त॒रा द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी इ॒मे है॑मन्तिकावृ॒तू अ॑भि॒कल्प॑माना॒ इन्द्र॑मिव दे॒वा अ॑भि॒सं वि॑शन्तु॒ तया॑ दे॒वत॑याङ्गिर॒स्वद्ध्रु॒वे सी॑दतम् ।।

text:
With one they praised; creatures were produced. Prajâpati
 was over-lord.
 With three they praised; the Priesthood was created. Brihaspati
 was over-lord.

With five they praised; beings were created. The Lord of
 Beings was over-lord.
 With seven they praised; the Seven Rishis were created.
 Dhâtar was over-lord.
meaning: एक॑यास्तुवत प्र॒जा अ॑धीयन्त प्र॒जाप॑ति॒रधि॑पतिरासीत् । ति॒सृभि॑रस्तुवत॒ ब्रह्मा॑सृज्यत॒ ब्रह्म॑ण॒स्पति॒रधि॑पतिरासीत् । प॒ञ्चभि॑रस्तुवत भू॒तान्य॑सृज्यन्त भू॒तानां॒ पति॒रधि॑पतिरासीत् । स॒प्तभि॑रस्तुवत सप्त ऋ॒षयो॑ सृज्यन्त धा॒ताधि॑पतिरासीत् ।।

text:
With nine they praised; the Fathers were created. Aditi
 was Sovran Lady.
 With eleven they praised; the Seasons were created. The
 Season-Lords were over-lords.
 With thirteen they praised; the Months were created. The
 Year was over-lord.
 With fifteen they praised; the Nobility was created. Indra
 was over-lord.
 With seventeen they praised; domestic animals were created.
 Brihaspati was over-lord.
meaning: न॒वभि॑रस्तुवत पि॒तरो॑ सृज्य॒न्तादि॑ति॒रध्नि॑पत्न्यासीत् । ए॑काद॒शभि॑रस्तुवत ऋ॒तवो॑ सृज्यन्तार्त॒वा अधि॑पतय आसन् । त्र॑योद॒शभि॑रस्तुवत॒ मासा॑ असृज्यन्त संवत्स॒रो धि॑पतिरासीत् । प॑ञ्चद॒शभि॑रस्तुवत क्ष॒त्रम॑सृज्य॒तेन्द्रो॑ धिपतिरासीत् । स॑प्तद॒शभि॑रस्तुवत ग्रा॒म्याः प॒शवो॑ सृज्यन्त॒ बृह॒स्पति॒रधि॑पतिरासीत् ।।

text:
With nineteen they praised; Sûdra and Arya were created.
 Day and Night were Sovran Ladies.
 With twenty-one they praised; solid-hoofed animals were
 created. Varuna was over-lord.
 With twenty-three they praised; small animals were created.
 Pûshan was over-lord.
 With twenty-five they praised; forest animals were created.
 Vâyu was over-lord.
 With twenty-seven they praised; earth and heaven came
 apart. Vasus, Rudras, Âdityas followed separately, so
 they were over-lords.
meaning: न॑वद॒शभि॑रस्तुवत शूद्रा॒र्याव॑सृज्येतामहोरा॒त्रे अधि॑पत्नी आस्ताम् । एक॑विँशत्यास्तुवतैकशपाः प॒शवो॑ सृज्यन्त॒ वरु॑णो धिपतिरासीत् । त्रयो॑विँशत्यास्तुवत क्षु॒द्रां प॒शवो॑ सृज्यन्त पू॒षाधि॑पतिरासीत् । पञ्च॑विँशत्यास्तुवतार॒ण्याः प॒शवो॑ सृज्यन्त वा॒युरधि॑पतिरासीत् । स॒प्तविँ॑शत्यास्तुवत॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी व्यै॑तां॒ वस॑वो रु॒द्रा आ॑दि॒त्या अ॑नु॒व्या॑यँ॒स्त ए॒वाधि॑पतय आसन् ।।

text:
With twenty-nine they praised; Trees were created. Soma
 was over-lord.
 With thirty-one they praised; creatures were created. The
 Yavas and the Ayavas were over-lords.
 With thirty-three they praised; living beings. were happy.
 Prajâpati, the Supreme in Place, was over-lord.
 Fill up the room, etc. The dappled kine, etc. All sacred
 songs, etc. Repeated from XII. 14-16.
meaning: नव॑सिँशत्यास्तुवत॒ वन॒स्पत॑यो सृज्यन्त॒ सोमो धि॑पतिरासीत् । एक॑त्रिँशतास्तुवत प्र॒जा अ॑सृज्यन्त॒ यवा॒श्चाय॑वा॒श्चाधि॑पतय आसन् । त्रय॑स्त्रिँशतास्तुवत भू॒तान्य॑शाम्यन्प्र॒जाप॑तिः परमे॒ष्ठ्यधि॑पतिरासीत् । लो॒कं पृ॑ण छि॒द्रं पृ॒णाथो॑ सीद ध्रु॒वा त्वम् । इ॑न्द्रा॒ग्नी त्वा॒ बृह॒स्पति॑र॒स्मिन्योना॑वसीषदन् । ता अ॑स्य॒ सूद॑दोहसः॒ सोमँ॑ श्रीणन्ति॒ पृश्न॑यः । जन्म॑न्दे॒वानां॒ विश॑स्त्रि॒ष्वा रो॑च॒ने दि॒वः । इन्द्रं॒ विश्वा॑ अवीवृधन्त्समु॒द्रव्य॑चसं॒ गिरः॑ । र॒थीत॑मँ र॒थीनां॒ वाजा॑नाँ॒ सत्प॑तिं॒ पति॑म् ।।

text:
DRIVE our born enemies away, O Agni; drive from us foes
 unborn, O Jâtavedas.
 Graciously-minded, free from anger, bless us: may we enjoy
 my firm thrice-guarding shelter.
 Drive off with might our foemen born and living: keep off
 these yet unborn, O Jâtavedas.
 Benevolent in thought and spirit bless us. May we remain
 alive: drive off our foemen.
meaning: अग्ने॑ जा॒तान्प्र णु॑द नः स॒पत्ना॒न्प्रत्यजा॑तान्नुद जातवेदः । अधि॑ नो ब्रूहि सु॒मना॒ अहे॑डँ॒स्तव॑ स्याम॒ शर्मँ॑स्त्रि॒वरू॑थ उद्भौ ।।

text:
The Sixteenfold Stoma, strength and wealth. The Forty-
 fourth Stoma, splendour and wealth.
 Apsas art thou, the complement of Agni. As such may all
 the Gods greet thee with praises.
 Enriched with songs of praise, Prishthas, and butter, sit here
 and give us wealth with store of children.
meaning: सह॑सा जा॒तान्प्र णु॑दा नः स॒पत्ना॒न्प्रत्यजा॑तान्जातवेदो नुदस्व । अधि॑ नो ब्रूहि सुमन॒स्यमा॑नो व॒यँ स्या॑म॒ प्र णु॑दा नः स॒पत्ना॑न् ।।

text:
Course metre. Space metre. Happy metre, Encompassing
 metre. Covering metre. Mind metre. Expanse
 metre. River metre. Sea metre. Water metre. Kakup
 metre. Trikakup metre. Kâvya metre. Ankupa metre
 Aksharapankti metre. Padapankti metre. Vishtârapankti
 metre. Kshurabhrâja metre.
meaning: षो॑ड॒शी स्तोम॒ ओजो॒ द्रवि॑णम् । च॑तुश्चत्वारिँ॒श स्तोमो॒ वर्चो॒ द्रवि॑णम् । अ॒ग्नेः पुरी॑षमस्य॒ अप्सो॒ नाम॒ तां त्वा॒ विश्वे॑ अ॒भि गृ॑णन्तु दे॒वाः । स्तोम॑पृष्ठा घृ॒तव॑ती॒ह सी॑द प्र॒जाव॑द॒स्मे द्र॑वि॒णा य॑जस्व ।।

text:
Covering metre. Clothing metre. Collecting metre. Parting
 metre. Brihat metre. Rathantara metre, Group
 metre. Vivadhra metre. Swallower metre. Bright metre.
 Samstup metre. Anushtup metre. Course metre. Space
 metre. Vigour metre. Vigour-giving metre. Emulating
 metre. Spacious metre, Inaccessible metre. Slow metre.
 Ankânka metre.
meaning: एव॒श्छन्दः॑ । वरि॑व॒श्छन्दः॑ । शं॒भूश्छन्दः॑ । प॑रि॒भूश्छन्दः॑ । आ॒च्छच्छन्दः॑ । मन॒श्छन्दः॑ । व्यच॒श्छन्दः॑ । सिन्धु॒श्छन्दः॑ । स॑मु॒द्रश्छन्दः॑ । स॑रि॒रं छन्दः॑ । क॒कुप्छन्दः॑ । त्रि॑क॒कुप्छन्दः॑ । का॒व्यं छन्दः॑ । अ॑ङ्कु॒पं छन्दः॑ । अ॒क्षर॑पङ्क्ति॒श्छन्दः॑ । प॒दप॑ङ्क्ति॒श्छन्दः॑ । वि॑ष्टा॒रप॑ङ्क्ति॒श्छन्दः॑ । क्षु॒रो भ्राज॒श्छन्दः॑ ।।

text:
With the ray for truth quicken thou truth. With advance
 by duty quicken duty. With following by heaven quicken
 heaven. With union by middle air quicken middle air.
 With Pratidhi by Earth quicken Earth. With support
 by rain quicken rain. With blowing away by day quicken
 day. With following by eight quicken night. With
 clarified butter by the Vasus quicken the Vasus. With
 perception by the Âdityas quicken the Âdityas.
meaning: आ॒च्छच्छन्दः॑ । प्र॒च्छच्छन्दः॑ । सं॒यच्छन्दः॑ । वि॒यच्छन्दः॑ । बृ॒हच्छन्दः॑ । र॑थन्त॒रं छन्दः॑ । नि॑का॒यश्छन्दः॑ । वि॑व॒धश्छन्दः॑ । गिर॒श्छन्दः॑ । भ्रज॒श्छन्दः॑ । सँ॒स्तुप्छन्दः॑ । अ॑नु॒ष्टुप्छन्दः॑ । एव॒श्छन्दः॑ । वरि॑व॒श्छन्दः॑ । वय॒श्छन्दः॑ । व॑य॒स्कृच्छन्दः॑ । विच्५ष्प॑र्धा॒श्छन्दः॑ । वि॑शा॒लं छन्दः॑ । छ॒दिश्छन्दः॑ । दू॑रोह॒णं छन्दः॑ । त॒न्द्रं छन्दः॑ । अ॑ङ्का॒ङ्कं छन्दः॑ ।।

text:
With the thread by prosperity quicken prosperity. With
 the creeper by revelation quicken revelation. With
 refreshment by plants quicken plants. With the best by
 bodies quicken bodies. With the invigorating by religious
 study quicken religious study. With the victorious by
 brilliance quicken brilliance.
meaning: र॒श्मिना॑ स॒त्याय॑ स॒त्यं जि॑न्व । प्रेति॑ना॒ धर्म॑णा॒ धर्मं॑ जिन्व । अन्वि॑त्या दि॒वा दिवं॑ जिन्व । सं॒धिना॒न्तरि॑क्षेणा॒न्तरि॑क्षं जिन्व । प्र॑ति॒धिन्पृ॑थि॒व्या पृ॑थि॒वीं जि॑न्व । वि॑ष्ट॒म्भेन॒ वृष्ट्या॒ वृस्टिं॑ जिन्व । प्र॒वयाह्नाह॑र्जिन्व । अ॑नु॒या रत्र्या॒ रात्रीं॑ जिन्व । उ॒शिजा॒ वसु॑भ्यो॒ वसू॑न्जिन्व । प्र॑के॒तेना॑दि॒त्येभ्य॑ आदि॒त्यान्जि॑न्व ।।

text:
Thou art Pratipad, for Pratipad thee. Thou art Anupad,
 for Anupad thee. Thou art Sampad, for Sampad thee.
 Thou art brilliance, for brilliance thee.
meaning: तन्तु॑ना रा॒यस्पोषे॑ण रा॒यस्पोषं॑ जिन्व । सँ॒सर्पे॑ण श्रु॒ताय॑ श्रु॒तं जि॑न्व । अै॒डेनौ॑षधीभि॒रोष॑धीर्जिन्व । उ॑त्त॒मेन॑ त॒नूभि॑स्त॒नूर्जि॑न्व । व॑यो॒धसाधी॑तेअ॒नाधी॑तं जिन्व । अ॑भि॒जिता॒ तेज॑सा॒ तेजो॑ जिन्व ।।

text:
Trivrit (triple) art thou, thee for Trivrit. Pravrit art thou,
 thee for Pravrit. Vivrit art thou, thee for Vivrit. Savrit
 art thou, thee for Savrit. Thou art attack, thee for attack.
 Thou art concurrence, thee for concurrence. Thou art
 ascent, thee for ascent. Thou art upstriding, thee for
 upstriding. With Energy as
over-lord
 quicken
 food-essence.
meaning: प्र॑ति॒पद॑सि प्रति॒पदे॑ त्वा । अ॑नु॒पद॑स्यनु॒पदे॑ त्वा । स॒म्पद॑सि स॒म्पदे॑ त्वा । तेजो॑ सि॒ तेज॑से त्वा ।।

text:
Thou art the Queen, the Eastern region. The bright Vasus
 are thine overlords. Agni is thy warder-off of hostile
 weapons. May the Trivrit Stoma assist thee on earth.
 The Âjya Uktha fix thee firmly against slipping. The
 Rathantara Sâman establish thee in the sky for secure
 station. May the first-born Rishis extend thee among the

Gods by the measure and amplitude of heaven. May
 this Disposer and the Over-Lord extend thee. May all,
 concordant, settle thee on the ridge of heaven in the
 world of Svarga.
meaning: त्रि॒वृद॑सि त्रि॒वृते॑ त्वा । प्र॒वृद॑सि प्र॒वृते॑ त्वा । वि॒वृद॑सि वि॒वृते॑ त्वा । स॒वृद॑सि स॒वृते॑ त्वा । आ॑क्र॒मो॑ स्याक्र॒माय॑ त्वा । सं॑क्र॒मो॑ सि संक्र॒माय॑ त्वा । उ॑त्क्र॒मो॑ स्युत्क्र॒माय॑ त्वा । उत्क्रा॑न्तिर॒स्युत्क्रा॑न्त्यै त्वा । अधि॑पतिनो॒र्जोर्जं॑ जिन्व ।।

text:
Thou art Far-ruling, the Southern region. The bright
 Rudras are thine over-lords. Indra is thy warder-off of
 arrows. May the Pañchadasa Stoma support thee on
 earth. The Praüga Uktha fix thee firmly against slipping.
 The Brihat Sâman establish thee in the sky, etc. (the rest
 as in 10).
meaning: राज्ञ्य॑सि॒ प्राची॒ दिग्वस॑वस्ते दे॒वा अधि॑पतयो॒ ग्निर्हे॑ती॒नां प्र॑तिध॒र्ता त्रि॒वृत्त्वा॒ स्तोमः॑ पृथि॒व्याँ श्र॑य॒त्वाज्य॑मु॒क्थमव्य॑थायै स्तभ्नातु रथन्त॒रँ साम॒ प्रति॑ष्�त्या अ॒न्तरि॑क्ष॒ ऋष॑यस्त्वा प्रथम॒जा दे॒वेषु॑ दि॒वो मात्र॑या वरि॒म्णा प्र॑थन्तु विध॒र्ता चा॒यमधि॑पतिश्च॒ ते त्वा॒ सर्वे॑ संविदा॒ता नाक॑स्य पृ॒ष्ठे स्व॒र्गे लो॒के यज॑मानं च सादयन्तु ।।

text:
Thou art Universal Ruler, the Western region. The Âdityas
 are thine over-lords. Varuna is thy warder-off of missiles.
 The Saptadasa Stoma support thee on earth. The Marutvatîya
 Uktha fix thee firmly against slipping. The
 Vairûpa Sâman establish thee, etc. (as above).
meaning: वि॒राड॑सि॒ दक्षि॑णा॒ दिग्रु॒द्रास्ते॑ दे॒वा अधि॑पतय॒ इन्द्रो॑ हेती॒नां प्र॑तिध॒र्ता प॑ञ्चद�स्त्वा॒ स्तोमः॑ पृथि॒व्याँ श्र॑यतु॒ प्रउग॑मु॒क्थमव्य॑थायै स्तभ्नातु बृ॒हत्साम॒ प्रति॑ष्ठित्या अ॒न्तरि॑क्ष॒ ऋष॑यस्त्वा प्रथम॒जा दे॒वेषु॑ दि॒वो मात्र॑या वरि॒म्णा प्र॑थन्तु विध॒र्ता चा॒यमधि॑पतिश्च॒ ते त्वा॒ सर्वे॑ संविदा॒ता नाक॑स्य पृ॒ष्ठे स्व॒र्गे लो॒के यज॑मानं च सादयन्तु ।।

text:
Thou art Independent Ruler, the Northern region. (The
 rest is identical with 12, with the substitution of Maruts
 . . . Soma . . . .Vimsa Stoma . . . Nishkevalya Uktha. . . . Vairâja
 Sâman for the corresponding names).
meaning: स॒म्राड॑सि प्र॒तीची॒ दिगा॑दि॒त्यास्ते॑ दे॒वा अधि॑पतयो॒ वरु॑णो हेती॒नां प्र॑तिध॒र्ता स॑प्तद�स्त्वा॒ स्तोमः॑ पृथि॒व्याँ श्र॑यतु मरुत्व॒तीय॑मु॒क्थमव्य॑थायै स्तभ्नातु वैरू॒पँ साम॒ प्रति॑ष्ठित्या अ॒न्तरि॑क्ष॒ ऋष॑यस्त्वा प्रथम॒जा दे॒वेषु॑ दि॒वो मात्र॑या वरि॒म्णा प्र॑थन्तु विध॒र्ता चा॒यमधि॑पतिश्च॒ ते त्वा॒ सर्वे॑ संविदा॒ता नाक॑स्य पृ॒ष्ठे स्व॒र्गे लो॒के यज॑मानं च सादयन्तु ।।

text:
Thou art Lady-Paramount, the Lofty region. (The rest as
 above, Visvedevas. . . Brihaspati . . .Trinava and Trayastrimsa
 Stomas . . .Vaisvadeva and Mâruta Ukthas . . . Sâkvara and
 Raivata Sâmans being substituted for the corresponding
 names.
meaning: स्व॒राड॒स्युदी॒च्य्दिङ्म॒रुत॑स्ते दे॒वा अधि॑पतयः॒ सोमो॑ हेती॒नां प्र॑तिधर्तैकविँ॒शस्त्वा॒ स्तोमः॑ पृथि॒व्याँ श्र॑यतु॒ निष्के॑वल्यमु॒क्थमव्य॑थायै स्तभ्नातु वैरा॒जँ साम॒ प्रति॑ष्ठित्या अ॒न्तरि॑क्ष॒ ऋष॑यस्त्वा प्रथम॒जा दे॒वेषु॑ दि॒वो मात्र॑या वरि॒म्णा प्र॑थन्तु विध॒र्ता चा॒यमधि॑पतिश्च॒ ते त्वा॒ सर्वे॑ संविदा॒ता नाक॑स्य पृ॒ष्ठे स्व॒र्गे लो॒के यज॑मानं च सादयन्तु ।।

text:
This one in front, golden-tressed, with sunbeams; the leader
 of his host and his chieftain are Rathagritsa and Rathaujas,
 and Puñjikasthalâ: and Kratusthalâ his Apsarases.
 Biting animals are his weapon, homicide his missile weapon;
 to them be homage: may they protect us, may
 they have mercy upon us. In their jaws we place the
 man whom we hate and who hates us.
meaning: अधि॑पत्न्यसि बृह॒ती दिग्विश्वे॑ ते दे॒वा अधि॑पतयो॒ बृह॒स्पति॑र्हेती॒नां प्र॑तिध॒र्ता त्रि॑णवत्रयस्त्रिँशौ त्वा॒ स्तोमौ॑ पृथि॒व्याँ श्र॑यतां वैश्वदेवाग्निमारु॒ते उ॒क्थे अव्य॑थायै स्तभ्नीताँ शाक्वररैव॒ते साम॑नी॒ प्रति॑ष्ठित्या अ॒न्तरि॑क्ष॒ ऋष॑यस्त्वा प्रथम॒जा दे॒वेषु॑ दि॒वो मात्र॑या वरि॒म्णा प्र॑थन्तु विध॒र्ता चा॒यमधि॑पतिश्च॒ ते त्वा॒ सर्वे॑ संविदा॒ता नाक॑स्य पृ॒ष्ठे स्व॒र्गे लो॒के यज॑मानं च सादयन्तु ।।

text:
This one on the right, the Omnific; the leader of his host
 and his chieftain are Rathasvana and Rathechitra, and
 Menakâ and Sahajanyâ his Apsarases. Yâtudhânas are
 his weapon, Râkshasas his missile weapon; to them be
 homage, etc. (as in 15).
meaning: अ॒यं पु॒रो हरि॑केशः॒ सूर्य॑रश्मि॒स्तस्य॑ रथगृ॒त्सश्च॒ रथौ॑जाश्च सेनानीग्राम॒ण्या॑ । पु॑ञ्जिकस्थ॒ला च॑ क्रतुस्थ॒ला चा॑प्स॒रसौ॑ द॒ङ्क्ष्णवः॑ प॒शवो॑ हे॒तिः पौ॑रुषेयो व॒धः प्रहे॑ति॒स्तेभ्यो॒ नमो॑ अस्तु॒ ते नो॑ वन्तु॒ ते नो॑ मृडयन्तु॒ ते यं द्वि॒ष्मो यश्च॑ नो॒ द्वेष्टि॒ तमे॑षां॒ जम्भे॑ दध्मः ।।

text:
This one behind, the All-comprising; the leader of his
 host and his chieftain are Rathaprota and Asamaratha,
 and Pramlochantî and Anumochlantî are his Apsarases.
 Tigers are his weapon, Serpents his missile weapon; to
 them be homage, etc.
meaning: अ॒यं द॑क्षि॒णा वि॒श्वक॑र्मा॒ तस्य॑ रथस्व॒नश्च॒ रथे॑चित्रश्च सेनानीग्राम॒ण्या॑ । मे॑न॒का च॑ सहज॒न्या चा॑प्स॒रसौ॑ यातुधा॒ना हे॒ती रक्षाँ॑सि॒ प्रहे॑ति॒स्तेभ्यो॒ नमो॑ अस्तु॒ ते नो॑ वन्तु॒ ते नो॑ मृडयन्तु॒ ते यं द्वि॒ष्मो यश्च॑ नो॒ द्वेष्टि॒ तमे॑षां॒ जम्भे॑ दध्मः ।।

text:
This one on the left, Lord of uninterrupted riches; the
 leader of his host and his chieftain are Târkshya and
 Arishtanemi, and Visvâchî and Ghritâchi his Apsarases.
 Water is his weapon, wind his missile weapon; to them
 be homage, etc.
meaning: अ॒यं प॒श्चाद्वि॒श्वव्य॑चा॒स्तस्य॒ रथ॑प्रो॒तश्चास॑मरथश्च सेनानीग्राम॒ण्या॑ । प्र॒म्लोच॑न्ती चानु॒म्लोच॑न्ती चाप्स॒रसौ॑ व्या॒घ्रा हे॒तिः स॒र्पा प्रहे॑ति॒स्तेभ्यो॒ न मोअ॑स्तु॒ ते नो॑ वन्तु॒ ते नो॑ मृडयन्तु॒ ते यं द्वि॒ष्मो यश्च॑ नो॒ द्वेष्टि॒ तमे॑षां॒ जम्भे॑ दध्मः ।।

text:
This one above, Wealth-giver; the leader of his host and his
 chieftain are Senajit and Sushena, and Urvasi and Pûrvachitti
 his Apsarases. Thundering is his weapon and lightning
 his missile weapon; to them be homage, etc.
meaning: अ॒यमु॑त्त॒रात्सं॒यद्व॑सु॒स्तस्य॒ तार्क्ष्य॒श्चारि॑ष्टनेमिश्च सेनानीग्राम॒ण्या॑ । वि॒श्वाची॑ च घृ॒ताची॑ चाप्स॒रसा॒वापो॑ हे॒तिर्वातः॒ प्रहे॑ति॒स्तेभ्यो॒ नमो॑ अस्तु॒ ते नो॑ वन्तु॒ ते नो॑ मृडयन्तु॒ ते यं द्वि॒ष्मो यश्च॑ नो॒ द्वेष्टि॒ तमे॑षां॒ जम्भे॑ दध्मः ।।

text:
Agni is head and height of heaven, the Master of the earth
 is he. He quickeneth the waters’ seed.
meaning: अ॒यमु॒पर्य॒र्वाग्व॑सु॒स्तस्य॑ सेन॒जिच्च॑ सु॒षेण॑श्च सेनानीग्राम॒ण्या॑ । उ॒र्वशी॑ च पू॒र्वचि॑त्तिश्चाप्स॒रसा॑वव॒स्पूर्ज॑न्हे॒तिर्वि॒द्युत्प्रहे॑ति॒स्तेभ्यो॒ नमो॑ अस्तु॒ ते नो॑ वन्तु॒ ते नो॑ मृडयन्तु॒ ते यं द्वि॒ष्मो यश्च॑ नो॒ द्वेष्टि॒ तमे॑षां॒ जम्भे॑ दध्मः ।।

text:
This Agni is the Master of spoil thousandfold and
 hundredfold, the sapient one, the head of wealth.
meaning: अ॒ग्निर्मू॒र्धा दि॒वः क॒कुत्पतिः॑ पृथि॒व्या अ॒यम् । अ॒पाँ रेताँ॑सि जिन्वति ।।

text:
Agni, Atharvan brought thee forth by rubbing from the
 lotus-leaf, the head of Visva, of the Priest.
meaning: अ॒यम॒ग्निः स॑ह॒स्रिणो॒ वाज॑स्य श॒तिन॒स्पतिः॑ । मू॒र्धा क॒वी र॑यी॒णाम् ।।

text:
Guide of the rite art thou and of the region to which with
 thine auspicious teams thou tendest.
 Thy light-bestowing head to heaven thou liftest, making thy
 tongue oblation-bearer, Agni.
meaning: त्वाम॑ग्ने॒ पुष्क॑रा॒दध्यथ॑र्वा॒ निर॑मन्थत । मू॒र्ध्नो विश्व॑स्य वा॒घतः॑ ।।

text:
Agni is wakened by the people's fuel to meet the Dawn who
 cometh like a milch-cow.
 Like young trees shooting up on high their branches his
 flames are rising to the vault of heaven.
meaning: भुवो॑ य॒ज्ञस्य॒ रज॑सश्च ने॒ता यत्रा॑ नि॒युद्भिः॒ सच॑से शि॒वाभिः॑ । दि॒वि मू॒र्धानं॑ दधिषे स्व॒र्षां जि॒ह्वाम॑ग्ने चकृषे हव्य॒वाह॑म् ।।

text:
To him adorable, sage, strong and mighty we have sung
 forth our song of praise and homage.
 Gavishthira hath raised with prayer to Agni this laud
 far-reaching as the gold in heaven.
meaning: अबो॑ध्य॒ग्निः स॒मिधा॒ जना॑नां॒ प्रति॑ धे॒नुमि॑वाय॒तीमु॒षास॑म् । य॒ह्वा इ॑व॒ प्र व॒यामु॒ज्जिहा॑नाः॒ प्र भा॒नवः॑ सिस्रते॒ नाक॒मच्छ॑ ।।

text:
Here by ordainers was this God appointed first Invoker, best
 at worship, to be praised at rites;
 Whom Apnavâna and the Bhrigus caused to shine bright-coloured
 in the wood, spreading to every house.
meaning: अवो॑चाम क॒वये॒ मेध्या॑य॒ वचो॑ व॒न्दारु॑ वृष॒भाय॒ वृष्णे॑ । गवि॑ष्ठिरो॒ नम॑सा॒ स्तोम॑मग्नौ दि॒वी॑व रु॒क्ममु॑रु॒व्यञ्च॑मश्रेत् ।।

text:
The watchful Guardian of the people hath been born, Agni
 the very strong, for fresh prosperity.
 With oil upon his face, with high heaven-touching flame, he
 shineth splendidly, pure for the Bharatas.
meaning: अ॒यमि॒ह प्र॑थ॒मो धा॑यि धा॒तृभि॒र्होता॒ यजि॑ष्ठो अध्व॒रेष्वीड्यः॑ । यमप्न॑वानो॒ भृग॑वो विरुरु॒चुर्वने॑षु चि॒त्रं वि॒भ्वं॑ वि॒शेवि॑शे ।।

text:
Agni, Angirases discovered thee what time thou layest hidden,
 fleeing back from wood to wood.
 Thou by attrition art produced as conquering, might, and
 men, O Angiras, call thee the Son of Strength.
meaning: जन॑स्य गो॒पा अ॑जनिष्ट॒ जागृ॑विर॒ग्निः सु॒दक्षः॑ सुवि॒ताय॒ नव्य॑से । घृ॒तप्र॑तीको बृह॒ता दि॑वि॒स्पृशा॑ द्यु॒मद्वि भा॑ति भर॒तेभ्यः॒ शुचिः॑ ।।

text:
Offer to Agni, O my friends, your seemly food, your seemly
 praise;
 To him supremest o’er the folk, the Son of Strength, the
 Mighty Lord.
meaning: त्वाम॑ग्ने॒ अङ्गि॑रसो॒ गुहा॑ हि॒तमन्व॑विन्दञ्छिश्रिया॒णं वने॑वने । स जा॑यसे म॒थ्यमा॑नः॒ सहो॑ म॒हत्त्वामा॑हुः॒ सह॑सस्पु॒त्रम॑ङ्गिरः ।।

text:
Thou, mighty Agni, gatherest up all that is precious for thy
 friend:
 Bring us all treasure as thou art enkindled in libation's place.
meaning: सखा॑यः॒ सं वः॑ स॒म्यञ्च॒मिषँ॒ स्तोमं॑ चा॒ग्नये॑ । वर्षि॑ष्ठाय क्षिती॒नामू॒र्जो नप्त्रे॒ सह॑स्वते ।।

text:
O Agni, loved of many, thou of fame most wondrous, in
 their homes
 Men call on thee whose hair is flame to be the bearer of
 their gifts.
meaning: सँस॒मिद्यु॑वसे वृष॒न्नग्ने॒ विश्वा॑न्य॒र्य आ । इ॒डस्प॒दे समि॑ध्यसे॒ स नो॒ वसू॒न्या भ॑र ।।

text:
With this my reverent hymn I call Agni for you, the Son.
 of Strength,
 Dear, wisest envoy, served with noble sacrifice, immortal
 messenger of all.
meaning: त्वां चि॑त्रश्रवस्तम॒ हव॑न्ते वि॒क्षु ज॒न्तवः॑ । शो॒चिष्के॑शं पुरुप्रि॒याग्ने॑ ह॒व्याय॒ वोढ॑वे ।।

text:
Immortal messenger of all, immortal messenger of all,
 His two red steeds, all-cherishing; he harnesseth: let him,
 well-worshipped, urge them fast.
meaning: ए॒ना वो॑ अ॒ग्निं नम॑सो॒र्जो नपा॑त॒मा हु॑वे । प्रि॒यं चेति॑ष्ठमर॒तिँ स्व॑ध्व॒रं विश्व॑स्य दू॒तम॒मृत॑म् ।।

text:
Let him well-worshipped urge them fast, let him
 well-worshipped urge them fast.
 Then hath the sacrifice good prayer and happy end, and
 heavenly gift of wealth to men.
meaning: विश्व॑स्य दू॒तम॒मृतं॒ विश्व॑स्य दू॒तम॒मृत॑म् । स यो॑जते अरु॒षा वि॒श्वभो॑जसा॒ स दु॑द्रव॒त्स्वा॑हुतः ।।

text:
O Agni, thou who art the Lord of wealth in kine, the Son
 of Strength,
 Vouchsafe to us, O Jâtavedas, high renown.
meaning: स दु॑द्रव॒त्स्वा॑हुतः॒ स दु॑द्रव॒त्स्वा॑हुतः । सु॒ब्रह्मा॑ य॒ज्ञः सु॒शमी॒ वसू॑नां दे॒वँ राधो॒ जना॑नाम् ।।

text:
He, Agni, kindled, good and wise, must be exalted in our
 song:
 Shine, thou of many forms, shine radiantly on us.
meaning: अग्ने॒ वाज॑स्य॒ गोम॑त॒ ईशा॑नः सहसो यहो । अ॒स्मे धे॑हि जातवेदो॒ महि॒ श्रवः॑ ।।

text:
O Agni, shining of thyself by night and when the morning
 breaks,
 Burn, thou whose teeth are sharp, against the Râkshasas.
meaning: स इ॑धा॒नो वसु॑ष्क॒विर॒ग्निरी॒डेन्यो॑ गि॒रा । रे॒वद॒स्मभ्यं॑ पुर्वणीक दीदिहि ।।

text:
May Agni, worshipped, bring us bliss, may the gift, Blessed
 One! and sacrifice bring bliss,
 Yea, may our praises bring us bliss.
meaning: क्ष॒पो रा॑जन्नु॒त त्मनाग्ने॒ वस्तो॑रु॒तोषसः॑ । स ति॑ग्मजम्भ र॒क्षसो॑ दह॒ प्रति॑ ।।

text:
Yea, may our praises bring us bliss. Show forth the mind
 that brings success in war with fiends, wherewith thou
 conquerest in fights:
meaning: भ॒द्रो नो॑ अ॒ग्निराहु॑तो भ॒द्रा रा॒तिः सु॑भग भ॒द्रो अ॑ध्व॒रः । भ॒द्रा उ॒त प्रश॑स्तयः ।।

text:
Wherewith thou conquerest in fights. Bring down the many
 firm hopes of our enemies, and let us vanquish with thine
 aid.
meaning: भ॒द्रा उ॒त प्रश॑स्तयो भ॒द्रं मनः॑ कृणुष्व वृत्र॒तूर्ये॑ । येना॑ स॒मत्सु॑ सा॒सहः॑ ।।

text:
I value Agni, that good Lord, the home to which the kind
 return;
 Whom fleet-foot coursers seek as home, and strong enduring
 steeds as home. Bring food to those who sing thy praise.
meaning: येना॑ स॒मत्सु॑ सा॒सहो व॑ स्थि॒रा त॑नुहि॒ भूरि॒ शर्ध॑ताम् । व॒नेमा॑ ते अ॒भिष्टि॑भिः ।।

text:
’Tis Agni whom we laud as good, to whom the milch-kine
 come in herds,
 To whom the coursers swift of foot, to whom our well-born
 princes come. Bring food to those who sing thy praise.
meaning: अ॒ग्निं तं म॑न्ये॒ यो वसु॒रस्तं॒ यं यन्ति॑ धे॒नवः॑ । अस्त॒मर्व॑न्त आ॒शवो स्तं॒ नित्या॑सो वा॒जिन॒ इषँ॑ स्तो॒तृभ्य॒ आ भ॑र ।।

text:
Thou, brilliant God, within thy mouth warmest both ladles
 of the oil.
 So fill us also in our hymns abundantly, O Lord of Strength.
 Bring food to those who sing thy praise.
meaning: सो अ॒ग्निर्यो वसु॑र्गृ॒णे सं यमा॒यन्ति॑ धे॒नवः॑ । समर्व॑न्तो रघु॒द्रुवः॒ सँ सु॑जा॒तासः॑ सू॒रय॒ इषँ॑ स्तो॒तृभ्य॒ आ भ॑र ।।

text:
Agni, with lauds this day may we bring thee that which
 thou lovest,
 Right judgment, like a horse, with our devotions.
meaning: उ॒भे सु॑श्चन्द्र स॒र्पिषो॒ दर्वी॑ श्रीणीष आ॒सनि॑ । उ॒तो न॒ उत्पु॑पूर्या उ॒क्थेषु॑ शवसस्पत॒ इषँ॑ स्तो॒तृभ्य॒ आ भ॑र ।।

text:
For thou hast ever been the car-driver, Agni, of noble
 Strength, lofty sacrifice, and rightful judgment.
meaning: अग्ने॒ तम॒द्याश्वं॒ न स्तोमैः॒ क्रतुं॒ न भ॒द्रँ हृ॑दि॒स्पृश॑म् । ऋ॒ध्यामा॑ त॒ ओहैः॑ ।।

text:
Through these our praises come thou to meet us, bright as
 the sunlight,
 O Agni, well-disposed, with all thine aspects.
meaning: अधा॒ ह्य॑ग्ने॒ क्रतो॑र्भ॒द्रस्य॒ दक्ष॑स्य सा॒धोः । र॒थीरृ॒तस्य॑ बृह॒तो ब॒भूथ॑ ।।

text:
Agni I hold as Herald, the munificent, the gracious Son of
 Strength who knoweth all that live, as holy singer knowing
 all;
 Lord of fair rites, a God with form erected, turning to the
 Gods,
 He, when the flame hath sprung forth from the sacred oil,
 the offered fatness, longeth for it with his glow.
meaning: ए॒भिर्नो॑ अर्कै॒र्भवा॑ नो अ॒र्वाङ्स्व॒र्ण ज्योतिः॑ । अग्ने॒ विश्वे॑भिः सु॒मना॒ अनी॑कैः ।।

text:
O Agni, be our nearest Friend, be thou a kind deliverer and
 a gracious Friend.
 Come as good Agni, come as excellent and give us wealth
 most splendidly renowned.
 To thee then, O most bright, O radiant God, we come with
 prayer for happiness for our friends.
meaning: अ॒ग्निँ होता॑रं मन्ये॒ दास्व॑न्तं॒ वसुँ॑ सू॒नुँ सह॑सो जा॒तवे॑दसं॒ विप्रं॒ न जा॒तवे॑दसम् । य ऊ॒र्ध्वया॑ स्वध्व॒रो दे॒वो दे॒वाच्या॑ कृ॒पा । घृ॒तस्य॒ विभ्रा॑ष्टि॒मनु॑ वष्टि शो॒चिषा॒जुह्वा॑नस्य स॒र्पिषः॑ ।।

text:
With what devotion, winning light, the Rishis came, kindling
 Agni, to the Holy session,
 Even with that in heaven I stablish Agni whom men call
 him whose sacred grass is scattered.
meaning: अग्ने॒ त्वं नो॒ अन्त॑म उ॒त त्रा॒ता शि॒वो भ॑व वरू॒थ्यः॑ । वसु॑र॒ग्निर्वसु॑श्रवा॒ अच्छा॑ नक्षि द्यु॒मत्त॑मँ र॒यिं दाः॑ । तं त्वा॑ शोचिष्ठ दीदिवः सु॒म्नाय॑ नू॒नमी॑महे॒ सखि॑भ्यः ।।

text:
Gods, let us follow him with wives beside us, with sons, with
 brothers, with our gold adornments,
 Grasping the sky up in the world of virtue, on the third
 height, the luminous realm of heaven.
meaning: येन॒ ऋष॑य॒स्तप॑सा स॒त्रमाय॒न्निन्धा॑ना अ॒ग्निँ स्व॑रा॒भर॑न्तः । तस्मि॑न्न॒हं नि द॑धे॒ नाके॑ अ॒स्ग्निं यमा॒हुर्मन॑व स्ती॒र्णब॑र्हिषम् ।।

text:
This Agni mounted up to Speech's Centre, Lord of the
 Brave, observant, ever-active.
 Laid on the back of Earth, may he, resplendent, cast under
 foot those who would fight against us.
meaning: तं पत्नी॑भि॒रनु॑ गच्छेम देवाः पुत्रै॒र्भ्रातृ॑भिरु॒त वा॒ हिर॑ण्यैः । नाकं॑ गृभ्णा॒नाः सु॑कृ॒तस्य॑ लो॒के तृ॒तीये॑ पृ॒ष्ठे अधि॑ रोच॒ने दि॒वः ।।

text:
May this most manly Agni, strength-bestower, giver of thousands,
 shine with care that fails not.
 Resplendent in the middle of the water, make thine approach
 to the celestial mansions.
meaning: आ वा॒चो मध्य॑मरुहद्गुर॒ण्युर॒यम॒ग्निः सत्प॑ति॒श्चेकि॑तानः । पृ॒ष्ठे पृ॑थि॒व्या निहि॑तो॒ दवि॑द्युतद॒धस्प॒दं कृ॑णुतां॒ ये पृ॑त॒न्यवः॑ ।।

text:
Make him go forth from all sides: meet, Approach ye. O
 Agni, make the paths for Godward travel.
 Making the Parents young with life's renewal, the out spun
 thread in thee have they extended.
meaning: अ॒यम॒ग्निर्वी॒रत॑मो वयो॒धाः स॑ह॒स्रियो॑ द्योतता॒मप्र॑युच्छन् । वि॒भ्राज॑मानः सरि॒रस्य॒ मध्य॒ उप॒ प्र या॑हि दि॒व्यानि॒ धाम॑ ।।

text:
Wake up, O Agni, thou, and keep him watchful. Wish and
 fruition, meet, and he, together.
 In this and in the loftier habitation be seated, All-Gods!
 and the Sacrificer.
meaning: स॒म्प्र च्य॑वध्व॒मुप॑ स॒म्प्र या॑ताग्ने प॒थो दे॑व॒याना॑न्कृणुध्वम् । पुनः॑ कृण्वा॒ना पि॒तरा॒ युवा॑ना॒न्वा ताँ॑सी॒त्त्वयि॒ तन्तु॑मे॒तम् ।।

text:
Convey our sacrifice to heaven that it may reach the God
 with that

Whereby thou, Agni, bearest wealth in thousands and all
 precious things.
meaning: उद्बु॑ध्यस्वाग्ने॒ प्रति॑ जागृहि॒ त्वमि॑ष्टापू॒र्ते सँ सृ॑जेथाम॒यं च॑ । अ॒स्मिन्त्स॒धस्थे॒ अध्युत्त॑रस्मि॒न्विस्वे॑ देवा॒ यज॑मानाश्च सीदत ।।

text:
56 This is thine ordered place of birth whence sprung to life
 thou shonest forth.
 Knowing this, Agni, rise thou up and cause our riches to
 increase.
meaning: येन॒ वह॑सि स॒हस्रं॒ येना॑ग्ने सर्ववेद॒सम् । तेने॒मं य॒ज्ञं नो॑ नय॒ स्व॑र्दे॒वेषु॒ गन्त॑वे ।।

text:
Tapa, Tapasya, pair of Dewy Seasons: thou art, etc. (as
 in XIII. 25).
meaning: अ॒यं ते॒ योनि॑रृ॒त्वियो॒ यतो॑ जा॒तो अरो॑चथाः । तं जा॒नन्न॑ग्न आरो॒हाथा॑ नो वर्धया र॒यिम् ।।

text:
On the sky's back may Parameshthin lay thee, etc. (as in
 XIV. 14).
 Thy Lord is Sûrya, etc. (as in XIV. 14).
meaning: तप॑श्च तप॒स्य॑श्च शैशि॒रावृ॒तू अ॒ग्नेर॑न्तःश्ले॒षो॑ सि॒ कल्पे॑तां॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी कल्प॑न्�प॒ ओष॑धयः॒ कल्प॑न्ताम॒ग्नयः॒ पृथ॒ङ्नम ज्यैष्ठ्याय॒ सव्र॑ताः । ये अ॒ग्नयः॒ सम॑नसो न्त॒रा द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी इ॒मे शै॑शि॒रावृ॒तू अ॑भि॒कल्प॑माना॒ इन्द्र॑मिव दे॒वा अ॑भि॒सं वि॑शन्तु॒ तया॑ दे॒वत॑याङ्गिर॒स्वद्ध्रु॒वे सी॑दतम् ।।

text: Repeated from XII. 54.
meaning: प॑रमे॒ष्ठी त्वा॑ सादयतु दि॒वस्पृ॒ष्ठे ज्योति॑ष्मतीम् । विश्व॑स्मै प्रा॒णाया॑पा॒नाय॑ व्या॒नायो॑दा॒नाय॑ प्रति॒ष्ठायै॑ च॒रित्रा॑य । सूर्य॒स्ते धि॑पति॒स्तया॑ दे॒वत॑याङ्गिर॒स्वद्ध्रु॒वा सी॑द ।।

text: Repeated from XII. 55.
meaning: लो॒कं पृ॑ण छि॒द्रं पृ॒णाथो॑ सीद ध्रु॒वा त्वम् । इ॑न्द्रा॒ग्नी त्वा॒ बृह॒स्पति॑र॒स्मिन्योना॑वसीषदन् ।।

text: Repeated from XII. 56.
meaning: ता अ॑स्य॒ सूद॑दोहसः॒ सोमँ॑ श्रीणन्ति॒ पृश्न॑यः । जन्म॑न्दे॒वानां॒ विश॑स्त्रि॒ष्वा रो॑च॒ने दि॒वः ।।

text:
Like a horse neighing, eager for the pasture, when he hath
 stepped forth from the great enclosure:
 Then the wind following blows upon his splendour, and,
 straight, the path is black which thou hast travelled.
meaning: इन्द्रं॒ विश्वा॑ अवीवृधन्त्समु॒द्रव्य॑चसं॒ गिरः॑ । र॒थीत॑मँ र॒थीनां॒ वाजा॑नाँ॒ सत्प॑तिं॒ पति॑म् ।।

text:
In Âyu's seat I set thee, in the shadow of the protector in
 the heart of Ocean,
 Thee luminous, bright with eyes, thee who illumest the sky,
 the earth, and air's broad realm between them.
meaning: प्रोथ॒दश्वो॒ न यव॑से वि॒ष्यन्य॒दा म॒हः सं॒वर॑णा॒द्व्यस्था॑त् । आद॑स्य॒ वातो॒ अनु॑ वाति शो॒चिरध॑ स्म ते॒ व्रज॑नं कृ॒ष्णम॑स्ति ।।

text:
On the sky's back may Parameshthin set thee, etc. (as in
 XIV. 12, substituting sky for air and Sûrya for Vâyu).
meaning: आ॒योष्ट्वा॒ सद॑ने सादया॒म्यव॑तश्छा॒यायाँ॑ समु॒द्रस्य॒ हृद॑ये । र॑श्मी॒वतीं॒ भास्व॑ती॒मा या द्यां भास्या पृ॑थि॒वीमोर्व॒न्तरि॑क्षम् ।।

text:
Thou art the measure of a thousand. Thou art the representative
 of a thousand. Thou art the equivalent of a thousand. Thou art
 worth a thousand. Thee for a thousand.
meaning: प॑रमे॒ष्ठी त्वा॑ सादयतु दि॒वस्पृ॒ष्ठे व्यच॑स्वतीं॒ प्रथ॑स्वती॒म्दिवं॑ यच्छ॒ दिवं॑ दृँह॒ दिवं॒ मा हिँ॑सीः । विश्व॑स्मै प्रा॒णाया॑पा॒नाय॑ व्या॒नायो॑दा॒नाय॑ प्रति॒ष्ठायै॑ च॒रित्रा॑य । सूर्य॑स्त्वा॒भि पा॑तु म॒ह्या स्व॒स्त्या छ॒र्दिषा॒ शंत॑मेन॒ तया॑ दे॒वत॑याङ्गिर॒स्वद्ध्रु॒वे सी॑दतम् ।।

text:
HOMAGE be paid unto thy wrath, O Rudra, homage to thy
 shaft: to thy two arms be homage paid.
meaning: नम॑स्ते रुद्र म॒न्यव॑ उ॒तो त॒ इष॑वे॒ नमः॑ । बा॒हुभ्या॑मु॒त ते॒ नमः॑ ।।

text:
With that auspicious form of thine, mild, Rudra! pleasant
 to behold,
 Even with that most blessèd form, look, Mountain-haunter!
 here on us.
meaning: या ते॑ रुद्र शि॒वा त॒नूरघो॒रापा॑पकाशिनी । तया॑ नस्त॒न्वा॒ शंत॑मया॒ गिरि॑शन्ता॒भि चा॑कशीहि ।।

text:
The shaft which, Mountain-haunter, thou art holding in
 thy hand to shoot,
 Make that auspicious, Mountain-Lord! Injure not man nor
 moving thing.
meaning: यामिषुं॑ गिरिशन्त॒ हस्ते॑ बि॒भर्ष्यस्त॑वे । शि॒वां गि॑रित्र॒ तां कु॑रु॒ मा हिँ॑सीः॒ पुरु॑षं॒ जग॑त् ।।
शि॒वेन॒ वच॑सा त्वा गिरि॒शाच्छा॑ वदामसि । यथा॑ नः॒ सर्व॒मिज्जग॑दय॒क्ष्मँ सु॒मना॒ अस॑त् ।।

text:
The Advocate, the first divine Physician, hath defended us.
 Crushing all serpents, drive away all Yâtudhânis down below.
meaning: अध्य॑वोचदधिव॒क्ता प्र॑थ॒मो दै॑व्यो भि॒षक् । अहीँ॑श्च॒ सर्वा॑न्ज॒म्भय॒न्त्सर्वा॑श्च यातुधा॒न्यो॑ ध॒राचीः॒ परा॑ सुव ।।

text:
That most auspicious One whose hue is coppery and red
 and brown,
 And those, the Rudras who maintain their station in the
 regions, who surround him in a thousand bands, of these
 we deprecate the wrath.
meaning: असौ॒ यस्ता॒म्रो अ॑रु॒ण उ॒त ब॒भ्रुः सु॑म॒ङ्गलः॑ । ये चै॑नँ रु॒द्रा अ॒भितो॑ दि॒क्षु श्रि॒ताः स॑हस्र॒शो वै॑षाँ॒ हेड॑ ईमहे ।।

text:
May he who glides away, whose neck is azure, and whose
 hue is red,
 He whom the herdsmen, whom the girls who carry water
 have beheld, may he when seen be kind to us.
meaning: असौ॒ यो॑ व॒सर्प॑ति॒ नील॑ग्रीवो॒ विलो॑हितः । उतैनं गो॒पा अ॑दृश्र॒न्नदृ॑श्रन्नुदहा॒र्यः॒ स दृ॒ष्तो मृ॑डयाति नः ।।

text:
Homage to him the Azure-nested, the thousand-eyed, the
 bountiful,
 Yea, and his spirit ministers—to them I offer reverence.
meaning: नमो॑ स्तु॒ नील॑ग्रीवाय सहस्रा॒क्षाय॑ मी॒ढुषे॑ । अथो॒ ये अ॑स्य॒ सत्वा॑नो॒ हं तेभ्यो॑ करं॒ नमः॑ ।।

text:
Loosen thy bowstring, loosen it from thy bow's two
 extremities,
 And cast away, O Lord Divine, the arrows that are in thy
 hand.
meaning: प्र मु॑ञ्च॒ धन्व॑न॒स्त्वमु॒भयो॒रार्त्न्यो॒र्ज्याम् । याश्च॑ ते॒ हस्त॒ इष॑वः॒ परा॒ ता भ॑गवो वप ।।

text:
Now stringless be Kapardin's bow, his quiver hold no pointed
 shaft.
 The shafts he had have perished and the sheath that held
 his sword is bare.
meaning: विज्यं॒ धनुः॑ कप॒र्दिनो॒ विश॑ल्यो॒ वाण॑वाँ उ॒त । अने॑शन्नस्य॒ या इष॑व आ॒भुर॑स्य निषङ्ग॒धिः ।।

text:
Thy weapon, O Most Bountiful, the bow that resteth in thy
 hand,—
 With that, deprived of power to harm, protect thou us on
 every side.
meaning: या ते॑ हे॒तिर्मी॑ढुष्टम॒ हस्ते॑ ब॒भूव॑ ते॒ धनुः॑ । तया॒स्मान्वि॒श्वत॒स्त्वम॑य॒क्ष्मया॒ परि॑ भुज ।।

text:
So may the arrow of thy bow, in all directions, pass us by,
 And in a place remote from us lay thou the quiver that thou
 hast.
meaning: परि॑ ते॒ धन्व॑नो हे॒तिर॒स्मान्वृ॑णक्तु वि॒श्वतः॑ । अथो॒ य इ॑षु॒धिस्तवा॒रे अ॒स्मन्नि धे॑हि॒ तम् ।।

text:
Having unbent thy how O thou hundred-eyed, hundred-quivered
 One!
 And dulled thy pointed arrows' heads, be kind and gracious
 unto us.
meaning: अ॑व॒तत्य॒ धनु॒ष्ट्वँ सह॑स्राक्ष॒ शते॑षुधे । नि॒शीर्य॑ श॒ल्यानां॒ मुखा॑ शि॒वो नः॑ सु॒मना॑ भव ।।

text:
To thy fierce weapon, now unstrung, be reverent obeisance
 paid.
 Homage be paid to both thine arms, and to thy bow be
 reverence!
meaning: नम॑स्त॒ आयु॑धा॒याना॑तताय धृ॒ष्णवे॑ । उ॒भाभ्या॑मु॒त ते॒ नमो॑ बा॒हुभ्यां॒ तव॒ धन्व॑ने ।।

text:
Do thou no injury to great or small of us, harm not the
 growing boy, harm not the full grown man.
 Slay not a sire among us, slay no mother here, and to our
 own dear bodies, Rudra! do no harm.
meaning: मा नो॑ म॒हान्त॑मु॒त मा नो॑ अर्भ॒कं मा न॒ उक्ष॑न्तमु॒त मा न॑ उक्षि॒तम् । मा नो॑ वधीः पि॒तरं॒ मोत मा॒तरं॒ मा नः॑ प्रि॒यास्त॒न्वो॑ रुद्र रीरिषः ।।

text:
Harm us not in our seed or in our progeny, harm us not in
 our life or in our cows or steeds.
 Slay not our heroes in the fury of their wrath. We with
 oblations ever call on only thee.
meaning: मा न॑स्तो॒के तन॑ये॒ मा न॒ आयु॑षि॒ मा नो॒ गोषु॒ मा नो॒ अश्वे॑षु रीरिषः । मा नो॑ वी॒रान्रु॑द्र भा॒मिनो॑ वधीर्ह॒विष्म॑न्तः॒ सद॒मित्त्वा॑ हवामहे ।।

text: Homage to the golden-armed leader of hosts, lord of the
meaning: नमो॒ हिर॑ण्यबाहवे सेना॒न्ये॑ दि॒शां च॒ पत॑ये॒ नमो॒ नमो॑ वृ॒क्षेभ्यो॒ हरि॑केशेभ्यः पशू॒नां पत॑ये॒ नमो॒ नमः॑ श॒ष्पिञ्ज॑राय॒ त्विषी॑मते पथी॒नां पत॑ये॒ नमो॒ नम्परि॑केशायोपवी॒तिने॑ पु॒ष्टानां॒ पत॑ये॒ नमः॑ ।।

text:
regions, to the trees with their green tresses, to the Lord
 of beasts be homage; homage to him whose sheen is like
 green grass, homage to the radiant Lord of paths, homage
 to the golden-haired wearer of the sacrificial cord, homage
 to the Lord of the well-endowed.
meaning: नमो॑ बभ्लु॒शाय॑ व्या॒धिने न्ना॑नां॒ पत॑ये॒ नमो॒ नमो॑ भ॒वस्य॑ हेत्यै॒ जग॑तां॒ पत॑ये॒ नमो॒ नमो॑ रु॒द्राया॑तता॒यिने॒ क्षेत्रा॑णां॒ पत॑ये॒ नमो॒ नमः॑ सू॒तायाह॑न्त्यै॒वना॑नां॒ पत॑ये॒ नमः॑ ।।

text:
Homage to the brown-hued piercer, to the Lord of food be
 homage. Homage to Bhava's weapon, homage to the
 Lord of moving things! homage to Rudra whose bow is
 bent to slay, to the Lord of fields homage, homage to the
 charioteer who injures, none, to the Lord of forests be
 homage.
meaning: नमो॒ रोहि॑ताय स्थ॒पत॑ये वृ॒क्षाणां॒ पत॑ये॒ नमो॒ नमो॑ भुव॒न्तये॑ वारिवस्कृ॒तायौ॑षधीनां॒ पत॑ये॒ नमो॒ नमो॑ म॒न्त्रिणे॑ वाणि॒जाय॒ कक्षा॑णां॒ पत॑ये॒ नमो॒ नम॑ उच्चैर्घोषायाक्र॒न्द�॑ते पत्ती॒नां पत॑ये॒ नमः॑ ।।

text:
Homage to the red architect, to the Lord of trees homage!
 Homage to him who stretched out the earth, to him who
 gives relief be homage. Homage to the Lord of Plants,
 homage to the prudent merchant! Homage to the Lord
 of bushes, to the shouting Lord of foot-soldiers who
 makes foes weep be homage.
meaning: नमः॑ कृत्स्नाय॒तया॒ धाव॑ते॒ सत्व॑नां॒ पत॑ये॒ नमो॒ नमः॒ सह॑मानाय निव्या॒धिन॑ आव्या॒धिनी॑नां॒ पत॑ये॒ नमो॒ नमो॑ निष॒ङ्गिणे॑ ककु॒भाय॑ स्ते॒नानां॒ पत॑ये॒ नमो॒ नम्नि॑चे॒रवे॑ परिच॒राया�नां॒ पत॑ये॒ नमः॑ ।।

text:
Homage to the runner at full stretch, to the Lord of
 ministering spirits, homage! Homage to the conquering,
 piercing Lord of assailing bands, homage to the towering
 sword-bearer, to the Lord of thieves homage! Homage to
 the gliding robber, to the roamer, to the Lord of forests
 homage!
meaning: नमो॒ वञ्च॑ते परि॒वञ्च॑ते स्तायू॒नां पत॑ये॒ नमो॒ नमो॑ निष॒ङ्गिण॑ इषुधि॒मते॒ तस्क॑राणां॒ पत॑ये॒ नमो॒ नमः॑ सृका॒यिभ्यो॒ जिघाँ॑सद्भ्यो मुष्ण॒तां पत॑ये॒ नमो॒ नमो॑ सि॒मद्भ्यो॒ नक्तं॒ चर॑द्भ्यो विकृ॒न्तानां॒ पत॑ये॒ नमः॑ ।।

text:
Homage to the cheat, to the arch-deceiver, to the Lord of
 stealers homage! Homage to the wearer of sword and
 quiver, to the Lord of robbers homage! Homage to the
 boltarmed homicides, to the Lord of pilferers homage!
 Homage to the sword-bearers, to those who roam at night,
 to the Lord of plunderers homage!
meaning: नम॑ उष्णी॒षिणे॑ गिरिच॒राय॑ कुलु॒ञ्चानां॒ पत॑ये॒ नमो॒ नम॑ इषु॒मध्ब्यो॑ धन्वा॒यिभ्य॑श्च वो॒ नमो॒ नम॑ आतन्वा॒नेभ्यः॑ प्रति॒दधा॑नेभ्यश्च वो॒ नमो॒ नम॑ आ॒यच्छ॒द्भ्यो स्य॑द्भ्यश्च वो॒ नमः॑ ।।

text:
To the turban-wearing haunter of mountains, Lord of
 land-grabbers homage! Homage to you who bear arrows
 and to you who carry bows. Homage to you with bent
 bows, and to you who adjust your arrows, to you who
 draw the bow and to you who shoot be homage!
meaning: नमो॑ विसृ॒जद्भ्यो॒ विध्य॑द्भ्यश्च वो॒ नमो॒ नमः॑ स्व॒पद्भ्यो॒ जाग्र॑द्भ्यश्च वो॒ नमो॒ नमः॒ शया॑नेभ्य॒ आसी॑नेभ्यश्च वो॒ नमो॒ नम॒स्तिष्ठ॑द्भ्यो॒ धाव॑द्भ्यश्च वो॒ नमः॑ ।।

text:
Homage to you who let fly and to you who pierce, homage
 to you who sleep and to you who wake, homage to you
 who lie and to you who sit, homage to you who stand
 and to you who run.
meaning: नमः॑ स॒भाभ्यः॑ स॒भाप॑तिभ्यश्च वो॒ नमो॒ नमो श्वे॒भ्यो श्व॑पतिभ्यश्च वो॒ नमो॒ नम॑ आव्या॒धिनी॑भ्यो वि॒विध्य॑न्तीभ्यश्च वो॒ नमो॒ नम॒ उग॑णाभ्यस्तृँह॒तीभ्य॑श्च वो॒ नमः॑ ।।

text:
Homage to assemblies and to you lords of assemblies,
 homage to horses and to you masters of horses, homage to
 you hosts that wound and pierce, to you destructive
 armies with excellent bands be homage.
meaning: नमो॑ ग॒णेभ्यो॑ ग॒णप॑तिभ्यश्च वो॒ नमो॒ नमो॒ व्राते॑भ्यो॒ व्रात॑पतिभ्यश्च वो॒ नमो॒ नम्गृत्से॑भ्यो॒ गृत्स॑पतिभ्यश्च वो॒ नमो॒ नमो॒ विरू॑पेभ्यो वि॒श्वरू॑पेभ्यश्च वो॒ नमः॑ ।।

text:
Homage to the troops and to you lords of troops be homage.
 Homage to the companies and to you lords of companies, homage.
 Homage to sharpers and to you lords of sharpers, homage.
 Homage to you the deformed, and to you who wear all forms, homage!
meaning: नमः॒ सेना॑भ्यः सेना॒निभ्य॑श्च वो॒ नमो॒ नमो॑ र॒थिभ्यो॑ अर॒तेभ्य॑श्च वो॒ नमो॒ नमः॑ क्ष॒त्तृभ्यः॑ संग्रही॒तृभ्य॑श्च वो॒ नमो॒ नमो॑ म॒हद्भ्यो॑ अर्भ॒केभ्य॑श्च वो॒ नमः॑ ।।

text:
Homage to armies and to you the leaders of armies, homage.
 Homage to you car-borne and to you who are carless, homage.
 Homage to the charioteers and to you drivers of horses, homage.
 Homage to you the great and to you the small, homage.
meaning: नम॒स्तक्ष॑भ्यो रथका॒रेभ्य॑श्च वो॒ नमो॒ नमः॒ कुला॑लेभ्यः कु॒र्मारे॑भ्यश्च वो॒ नमो॒ नमो॑ निषा॒देभ्यः॑ पु॒ञ्जिष्टे॑भ्यश्च वो॒ नमो॒ नमः॑ श्व॒निभ्यो॑ मृग॒युभ्य॑श्च वो॒ नमः॑ ।।

text:
Homage to you carpenters, and to you chariot-makers homage.
 Homage to you potters and to you blacksmiths, homage.
 Homage to you Nishâdas and to you Puñjishthas, homage.
 Homage to you dog-leaders, and to you hunters, homage.
meaning: नमः॒ श्वभ्यः॒ श्वप॑तिभ्यश्च वो॒ नमो॒ नमो॑ भ॒वाय॑ च रु॒द्राय॑ च॒ नमः॑ श॒र्वाय॑ च पशु॒पत॑ये च॒ नमो॒ नील॑ग्रीवाय च शिति॒कण्ठा॑य च ।।

text:
Homage to dogs, and to you masters of dogs, homage.
 Homage to Bhava, and to Rudra homage, homage to Sarva
 and to Pasupati, and to Nîlagrîva and Sitikantha, homage.
meaning: नमः॑ कप॒र्दिने॑ च॒ व्यु॑प्तकेशाय च॒ नमः॑ सहस्रा॒क्षाय॑ च श॒तध॑न्वने च॒ नमो॑ गिरिश॒याय॑ च शिपिवि॒ष्टाय॑ च॒ नमो॑ मी॒ढुष्ट॑माय॒ चेषु॑मते च ।।

text:
Homage to him with braided hair and to him with shaven
 hair, homage! homage to the thousand-eyed and to him
 with a hundred bows, homage!
 To the mountain-haunter and to Sipivishta, homage!
 To the most bountiful, armed with arrows, homage!
meaning: नमो॑ ह्र॒स्वाय॑ च वाम॒नाय॑ च॒ नमो॑ बृह॒ते च॒ वर्षी॑यसे च॒ नमो॑ वृ॒द्धाय॑ च स॒वृधे॑ च॒ नमो ग्र्या॑य च प्रथ॒माय॑ च ।।

text:
Homage to the short, and to the dwarf, homage, homage to
 the great and to the adult, homage! Homage to the full-grown
 and to the growing, to the foremost and to the first
 be homage.
meaning: नम॑ आ॒शवे॑ चाजि॒राय॑ च॒ नमः॒ शीघ्र्या॑य च॒ शीभ्या॑य च॒ नम॒ ऊर्म्या॑य चावस्व॒न्या॑य च॒ नमो॑ नादे॒याय॑ च॒ द्वीप्या॑य च ।।

text:
Homage to the swift, and to the active be homage, and to
 the hasty and to the rapid mover be homage! Homage to
 him who dwells in waves, and in still waters, to him who
 dwells in rivers and on islands.
meaning: नमो॑ ज्ये॒ष्ठाय॑ च कनि॒ष्ठाय॑ च॒ नमः॑ पूर्व॒जाय॑ चापर॒जाय॑ च॒ नमो॑ मध्य॒माय॑ चापग॒ल्भाय॑ च॒ नमो॑ जघ॒न्या॑य च बु॒ध्न्या॑य च ।।

text:
Homage to the eldest and to the youngest, to the first-born
 and to the last-born, homage! Homage to the middle-most
 and to the immature, to the lowest and to him who
 is in the depth, be homage!
meaning: नमः॒ सोम्या॑य च प्रतिस॒र्या॑य च॒ नमो॒ याम्या॑य च॒ क्षेम्या॑य च॒ नमः॒ श्लोक्या॑य चावसा॒न्या॑य च॒ नम॑ उर्व॒र्या॑य च॒ खल्या॑य च ।।

text:
Homage to Sobhya and to the dweller in the magic amulet,
 homage! Homage to him who is allied to Yama, to him
 who prospers be homage! Homage to the famous and to
 the endmost, to him of the sown corn-land and to him of
 the threshing-floor be homage.
meaning: नमो॒ वन्या॑य च॒ कक्ष्ण्या॑य च॒ नमः॑ श्र॒वाय॑ च प्रतिश्र॒वाय॑ च॒ नम॑ आ॒शुषे॑णाय चा॒शुर॑थाय च॒ नमः॒ शूरा॑य चावभे॒दिने॑ च ।।

text:
Homage to him in woods and to him in bushes, homage!
 Homage to him as sound and to him as echo, homage!
 Homage to him with swift armies and to him with swift
 chariots, homage! Homage to the hero, and to him who
 rends asunder be homage.
meaning: नमो॑ बि॒ल्मिने॑ च कव॒चिने॑ च॒ नमो॑ व॒र्मिणे॑ च वरू॒थिने॑ च॒ नमः॑ श्रु॒ताय॑ च श्रुतसे॒नाय॑ च॒ नमो॑ दुन्दु॒भ्याय॑ चाहन॒न्या॑य च ।।

text:
Homage to him who wears a helmet, and to him who wears
 a cuirass, homage! To him who wears mail and defensive
 armour, homage! To the renowned one and to him whose
 army is renowned be homage, to him who is in drums and
 to him who makes himself known by beating them.
meaning: नमो॑ धृ॒ष्णवे॑ च प्रमृ॒शाय॑ च॒ नमो॑ निष॒ङ्गिणे॑ चेषुधि॒मते॑ च॒ नम॑स्ती॒क्ष्णेष॑वे चायु॒धिने॑ च॒ नमः॑ स्वायु॒धाय॑ च सु॒धन्व॑ने च ।।

text:
Homage to the bold one and to the prudent, homage to him
 who carries sword and quiver, homage to him who hath
 keen arrows and is armed with weapons, homage to him
 who hath good weapons and a good bow.
meaning: नमः॒ स्रुत्या॑य च॒ पथ्या॑य च॒ नमः॒ काट्या॑य च॒ नीप्या॑य च॒ नमः॒ कुल्या॑य च सर॒स्या॑य च॒ नमो॑ नादे॒याय॑ च वैश॒न्ताय॑ च ।।

text:
Homage to him who dwells on paths and roads, homage to
 him who dwells in rugged spots and on the skirts of mountains,
 homage to him who dwells in water courses and
 lakes, homage to him who dwells in rivers and mores.
meaning: नमः॒ कूप्या॑य चाव॒ट्या॑य च॒ नमो॒ वीध्र्या॑य चात॒प्या॑य च॒ नमो॒ मेघ्या॑य च च विद्यु॒त्या॑य॒ नमो॒ वर्ष्या॑य चाव॒र्ष्याय॑ च ।।

text:
Homage to him who dwells in wells and pits, homage to him
 who dwells in bright sky and sunlight. Homage to him
 who dwells in cloud and lightning, homage to him who
 dwells in rain and to him who dwells in fair weather.
meaning: नमो॒ वात्या॑य च॒ रेष्म्या॑य च॒ नमो॑ वास्त॒व्या॑य च वास्तु॒पाय॑ च॒ नमः॒ सोमा॑य च रु॒द्राय॑ च॒ नम॑स्ता॒म्राय॑ चारु॒णाय॑ च ।।

text:
Homage to him who dwells in wind and to him who dwells
 in tempest, homage to the dweller in houses and to the
 house-protector. Homage to Soma and to Rudra, homage
 to the copper-coloured and to the ruddy One.
meaning: नमः॑ शं॒गवे॑ च पशु॒पत॑ये च॒ नम॑ उ॒ग्राय॑ च भी॒माय॑ च॒ नमो॑ अग्रेव॒धाय॑ च दूरेव॒धाय॑ च॒ नमो॑ ह॒न्त्रे च॒ हनी॑यसे च॒ नमो॑ वृ॒क्षेभ्यो॒ हरि॑केशेभ्यो॒ नम॑स्ता॒राय॑ ।।

text:
Homage to the giver of weal, and to Pasupati, homage to
 the fierce and to the terrific. Homage to him who slays
 in front and to him who slays at a distance, homage to
 the slayer and to the frequent slayer, homage to the
 green-tressed trees, homage to the deliverer.
meaning: नमः॑ शम्भ॒वाय॑ च मयोभ॒वाय॑ च॒ नमः॑ शंक॒राय॑ च मयस्क॒राय॑ च॒ नमः॑ शि॒वाय॑ च शि॒वत॑राय च ।।

text:
Homage to the source of happiness and to the source of
 delight, homage to the causer of happiness and to the causer
 of delight, homage to the auspicious, homage to the most
 auspicious.
meaning: नमः॒ पार्या॑य चावा॒र्या॑य च॒ नमः॑ प्र॒तर॑णाय चो॒त्तर॑णाय च॒ नम॒स्तीर्थ्या॑य च॒ कूल्या॑य च॒ नमः॒ शष्प्या॑य च॒ पेन्या॑य च ।।

text:
Homage to him who is beyond and to him who is on this
 side, homage to him who crosses over and to him who
 crosses back. Homage to him who is in fords and on
 river banks, homage to him who is in tender grass and in
 foam.
meaning: नमः॑ सिक॒त्या॑य च प्रवा॒ह्या॑य च॒ नमः॑ किँशि॒लाय॑ च क्षय॒णाय॑ च॒ नमः॑ कप॒र्दिने॑ च पुल॒स्तये॑ च॒ नम॑ इरि॒ण्या॑य च प्रप॒थ्या॑य च ।।

text:
Homage to him who is in sand and to him who is in running
 water, homage to him who is on pebbly ground and to
 him who is where still water stands. Homage to him
 who wears braided hair and to him whose hair is smooth.
 Homage to him who is in deserts and to him who is on
 broad roads.
meaning: नमो॒ व्रज्या॑य च॒ गोष्ठ्या॑य च॒ नम॒स्तल्प्या॑य च॒ गेह्या॑य च॒ नमो॑ हृद॒य्या॑य च निवे॒ष्या॑य च॒ नमः॒ काट्या॑य च गह्वरे॒ष्ठाय॑ च ।।

text:
Homage to him who is in herds of cattle and to him who
 is in cow-pens, homage to him who is on beds and to
 him who is in houses. Homage to him who is in hearts,
 and to him who is in whirlpools, homage to him who is in
 wells and to him who is in abysses.
meaning: नमः॒ शुष्क्या॑य च हरि॒त्या॑य च॒ नमः॑ पाँस॒व्या॑य च रज॒स्या॑य च॒ नमो॒ लोप्या॑य चोल॒प्या॑य च॒ नम॒ ऊर्व्या॑य च॒ सूर्व्या॑य च ।।

text:
Homage to him who is in dry things and to him who is in
 green things. Homage to him who is in dust and to him
 who is in vapour. Homage to him who is in inaccessible
 places, homage to him who is in creeping plants, homage
 to him who is in the earth and to him who is in good soil.
meaning: नमः॑ प॒र्णाय॑ च पर्णश॒दाय॑ च॒ नम॑ उद्गु॒रमा॑णाय चाभिघ्न॒ते च॒ नम॑ आखिद॒ते च॑ प्रखिद॒ते च॒ नम॑ इषु॒कृद्भ्यो॑ धनु॒ष्कृद्भ्यस्च॑ वो॒ नमो॒ नमो॑ वः किरि॒केभ्यो॑ दे॒वानाँ॒ हृद॑येभ्यो॒ नमो॑ विचिन्व॒त्केभ्यो॒ नमो॑ विक्षिण॒त्केभ्यो॒ नम॑ आनिर्ह॒तेभ्यः॑ ।।

text:
Homage to him who is in leaves and to him who is in the
 falling of leaves. Homage to him with the threatening
 voice and to him who slays, homage to him who troubles
 and to him who afflicts. Homage to you arrow-makers
 and to you bow-makers, homage to you sprinklers, to the
 hearts of the Gods. Homage to the discerners, homage
 to the destroyers; homage to the indestructible.
meaning: द्रापे॒ अन्ध॑सस्पते॒ दरि॑द्र॒ नील॑लोहित । आ॒सां प्र॒जाना॑मे॒षां प॑शू॒नां मा भे॒र्मा रो॒ङ्मो च॑ नः॒ किं च॒नाम॑मत् ।।

text:
Pursuer, Lord of Soma juice, thou cleaver, coloured blue
 and red,
 Cleave not, destroy not one of these our children, nor of
 these our beasts, let nothing that is ours be sick.
meaning: इ॒मा रु॒द्राय॑ त॒वसे॑ कप॒र्दिने॑ क्ष॒यद्वी॑राय॒ प्र भ॑रामहे म॒तीः । यथा॒ शमस॑द्द्वि॒पदे॒ चतु॑ष्पदे॒ विश्वं॑ पु॒ष्टं ग्रामे॑ अ॒स्मिन्न॑नातु॒रम् ।।

text:
To the strong Rudra bring we these our songs of praise, to
 him the Lord of Heroes, with the braided hair,
 That it be well with all our cattle and our men, that in this
 village all be healthy and well-fed.
meaning: या ते॑ रुद्र शि॒वा त॒नूः शि॒वा वि॒श्वाहा॑ भेष॒जी । शि॒वा रु॒तस्य॑ भेष॒जी तया॑ नो मृड जी॒वसे॑ ।।

text:
Rudra, with that auspicious form of thine which healeth
 every day,
 Auspicious, healer of disease, be kind to us that we may live.
meaning: परि॑ नो रु॒द्रस्य॑ हे॒तिर्वृ॑णक्तु॒ परि॑ त्वे॒षस्य॑ दुर्म॒तिर॑घा॒योः । अव॑ स्थि॒रा म॒घव॑द्भ्यस्तनुष्व॒ मीढ्व॑स्तो॒काय॒ तन॑याय मृड ।।

text:
May Rudra's missile turn aside and spare us, the great
 wrath of the impetuous One avoid us.
 Turn, Bounteous God, thy strong bow from our princes, and
 be thou gracious to our seed and offspring.
 I Most bounteous, most auspicious, be auspicious, well inclined
 to us.
 On some remotest tree lay down thy weapon. and clad in
 robe of skin approach, bearing thy bow come hitherward.
meaning: मीढु॑ष्टम॒ शिव॑तम शि॒वो नः॑ सु॒मना॑ भव । प॑र॒मे वृ॒क्ष आयु॑धं नि॒धाय॒ कृत्तिं॒ वसा॑न॒ आ च॑र॒ पिना॑कं॒ बिभ्र॒दा ग॑हि ।।

text:
O Wound averter, purple-hued, to thee be homage, holy Lord!
 May all those thousand darts of thine strike dead another
 one than us.
meaning: विकि॑रिद्र॒ विलो॑हित॒ नम॑स्ते अस्तु भगवः । यास्ते॑ स॒हस्रँ॑ हे॒तयो॒ न्यम॒स्मन्नि व॑पन्तु॒ ताः ।।

text:
Thousands of thousands are the shafts, the missiles ready
 in thy hands:
 Thou holy Lord, who hast the power, turn thou their
 points away from us.
meaning: स॒हस्रा॑णि सहस्र॒शो बा॒ह्वोस्तव॑ हे॒तयः॑ । तासा॒मीशा॑नो भगवः परा॒चीना॒ मुखा॑ कृधि ।।

text:
Innumerable thousands are the Rudras on the face of earth:
 Of all these Rudras we unbend the bows a thousand leagues
 away.
meaning: असं॑ख्याता स॒हस्रा॑णि॒ ये रु॒द्रा अधि॒ भूम्या॑म् । तेषाँ॑ सहस्रयोज॒ने व॒ धन्वा॑नि तन्मसि ।।

text:
Bhavas there are above us in this mighty billowy sea of air,
 Of all of these do we unbend, etc.
meaning: अ॒स्मिन्म॑ह॒त्य॑र्ण॒वे॒ न्तरि॑क्षे भ॒वा अधि॑ । तेषाँ॑ सहस्रयोज॒ने व॒ धन्वा॑नि तन्मसि ।।

text:
Rudras are dwelling in the sky, whose necks are blue, whose
 throats are white:
 Of these do we unbend the bows a thousand leagues away
 from us.
meaning: नील॑ग्रीवाः शिति॒कण्ठा॒ दिवँ॑ रु॒द्रा उपा॑श्रिताः । तेषाँ॑ सहस्रयोज॒ने व॒ धन्वा॑नि तन्मसि ।।

text:
Sarvas haunt realms beneath the earth—their necks are blue,
 their throats are white:
 Of these, etc.
meaning: नील॑ग्रीवाः शिति॒कण्ठाः॑ श॒र्वा अ॒धः क्ष॑माच॒राः । तेषाँ॑ सहस्रयोज॒ने व॒ धन्वा॑नि तन्मसि ।।

text:
These, green like young grass, in the trees, with azure necks
 and purple hue,
 Of those, etc.
meaning: ये वृ॒क्षेषु॑ श॒ष्पिञ्ज॑रा॒ नील॑ग्रीवा॒ विलो॑हिताः । तेषाँ॑ सहस्रयोज॒ने व॒ धन्वा॑नि तन्मसि ।।

text:
Those, ministering spirits’ lords, with no hair-tufts, with
 braided locks,
 Of these, etc.
meaning: ये भू॒ताना॒मधि॑पतयो विशि॒खासः॑ कप॒र्दिनः॑ । तेषाँ॑ सहस्रयोज॒ने व॒ धन्वा॑नि तन्मसि ।।

text:
Those, the protectors of the paths, bringers of food, who
 fight for life. Of these, etc.
meaning: ये प॒थां प॑थि॒रक्ष॑स ऐलबृ॒दा आ॑यु॒र्युधः॑ । तेषाँ॑ सहस्रयोज॒ने व॒ धन्वा॑नि तन्मसि ।।

text:
Those who with arrows in their hand, and armed with
 words, frequent the fords, Of these, etc.
meaning: ये ती॒र्थानि॑ प्र॒चर॑न्ति सृ॒काह॑स्ता निष॒ङ्गिणः॑ । तेषाँ॑ सहस्रयोज॒ने व॒ धन्वा॑नि तन्मसि ।।

text:
Those who, inhabiting the food, vex men while drinking from
 their cups, etc.
meaning: ये न्ने॑षु वि॒विध्य॑न्ति॒ पात्रे॑षु॒ पिब॑तो॒ जना॑न् । तेषाँ॑ सहस्रयोज॒ने व॒ धन्वा॑नि तन्मसि ।।

text:
Rudras so many and still more, lodged in the quarters of
 the sky, etc.
meaning: ये ए॒ताव॑न्तश्च॒ भूयाँ॑सश्च॒ दिशो॑ रु॒द्रा वि॑तस्थि॒रे । तेषाँ॑ सहस्रयोज॒ने व॒ धन्वा॑नि तन्मसि ।।

text:
Homage to Rudras, those whose home is sky, whose arrows
 floods of rain.
 To them ten eastward, southward ten, ten to the south, ten
 to the north, ten to the region uppermost!
 To them be homage! May they spare and guard us. Within
 their jaws we lay the man who hates us and whom we
 abhor.
meaning: नमो॑ स्तु रु॒द्रेभ्यो॒ ये दि॒वि येषां॑ व॒र्षमिष॑वः । तेभ्यो॒ दश॒ प्राची॒र्दश॑ दक्षि॒णा दश॑ प्र॒तीची॒र्दशोदी॑ची॒र्दशो॒र्ध्वाः । तेभ्यो॒ नमो॑ अस्तु॒ ते नो॑ वन्तु॒ ते नो॑ मृडयन्तु॒ ते यं द्वि॒ष्मो यश्च॑ नो॒ द्वेष्टि॒ तमे॑षां॒ जम्भे॑ दध्मः ।।

text:
Homage to Rudras, those whose home is air, whose arrows
 is the rain. To them, etc.
meaning: नमो॑ स्तु रु॒द्रेभ्यो॒ ये॒ न्तरि॑क्षे॒ येषां॒ वात॒ इष॑वः । तेभ्यो॒ दश॒ प्राची॒र्दश॑ दक्षि॒णा दश॑ प्र॒तीची॒र्दशोदी॑ची॒र्दशो॒र्ध्वाः । तेभ्यो॒ नमो॑ अस्तु॒ ते नो॑ वन्तु॒ ते नो॑ मृडयन्तु॒ ते यं द्वि॒ष्मो यश्च॑ नो॒ द्वेष्टि॒ तमे॑षां॒ जम्भे॑ दध्मः ।।

text:
Homage to Rudras, those whose home is earth, whose arrows
 is men's food.
 To them be homage, etc.
meaning: नमो॑ स्तु रु॒द्रेभ्यो॒ ये पृ॑थि॒व्यां येषा॒मन्न॒मिष॑वः । तेभ्यो॒ दश॒ प्राची॒र्दश॑ दक्षि॒णा दश॑ प्र॒तीची॒र्दशोदी॑ची॒र्दशो॒र्ध्वाः । तेभ्यो॒ नमो॑ अस्तु॒ ते नो॑ वन्तु॒ ते नो॑ मृडयन्तु॒ ते यं द्वि॒ष्मो यश्च॑ नो॒ द्वेष्टि॒ तमे॑षां॒ जम्भे॑ दध्मः ।।

text:
THE food and strength contained in stone and mountain,
 drink gathered from the plants and trees and waters,
 That food and strength, Maruts! free-givers, grant us.
 In the stone is thy hunger. In me is thy food. Let thy
 pain reach the man we hate.
meaning: अश्म॒न्नूर्जं॒ पर्व॑ते शिश्रिया॒णाम॒द्भ्य ओष॑धीभ्यो॒ वन॒स्पति॒भ्यो धि॒ सम्भृ॑तं॒ पयः॑ । तां न॒ इष॒मूर्जं॑ धत्त मरुतः सँररा॒णाः । अश्मँ॑स्ते॒ क्षुत् । मयि॑ त॒ ऊर्क् । यं द्वि॒ष्मस्तं ते॒ शुगृ॑च्छतु ।।

text:
O Agni, may these bricks be mine own milch kine: one, and
 ten, and ten tens, a hundred, and ten hundreds, a thousand,
 and ten thousand a myriad, and a hundred thousand,
 and a million, and a hundred millions, and an ocean middle
 and end, and a hundred thousand millions, and a billion.
 May these bricks be mine own milch-kine in yonder world
 and in this world.
meaning: इ॒मा मे॑ अग्न॒ इष्ट॑का धे॒नवः॑ स॒न्त्वेका॑ च॒ दश॑ च॒ दश॑ च श॒तं च॑ श॒तं च॑ स॒हस्रं॑ च स॒हस्रं॑ चा॒युतं॑ चा॒युतं॑ च नि॒युतं॑ च नि॒युतं॑ च प्र॒युतं॒ चार्बु॑दं च॒ न्य॑र्बुदँ समु॒द्रश्च॒ मध्यं॒ चान्त॑श्च परा॒र्धश्चै॒ता मे॑ अग्न॒ इष्ट॑का धे॒नवः॑ सन्त्व॒मुत्रा॒मुष्मिं॑ल्लो॒के ।।

text:
Ye are the Seasons, strengthening Law, fixed in due season,
 strengthening Law,
 Called Splendid, dropping butter down and honey, yielders
 of every wish, imperishable.
meaning: ऋ॒तव॑ स्थ ऋता॒वृध॑ ऋतु॒ष्ठा स्थ॑ ऋता॒वृधः॑ । घृ॑त॒श्च्युतो॑ मधु॒श्च्युतो॑ वि॒राजो॒ नाम॑ काम॒दुघा॒ अक्षी॑यमाणाः ।।

text:
With the lake's mantling need we robe thee, Agni: to us
 he purifying and auspicious.
meaning: स॑मु॒द्रस्य॒ त्वाव॑क॒याग्ने॒ परि॑ व्ययामसि । पा॑व॒को अ॒स्मभ्यँ॑ शि॒वो भ॑व ।।

text:
With cold's investing garb we gird thee, Agni: to us be purifying
 and auspicious.
meaning: हि॒मस्य॑ त्वा ज॒रायु॒णाग्ने॒ परि॑ व्ययामसि । पा॑व॒को अ॒स्मभ्यँ॑ शि॒वो भ॑व ।।

text:
Descend upon the earth, the reed, the rivers: thou art the
 gall, O Agni, of the waters.
 With them come hither, female Frog, and render this sacrifice
 of ours bright-hued, successful.
meaning: उप॒ ज्मन्नुप॑ वेत॒से व॑ तर न॒दीष्वा । अग्ने॑ पि॒त्तम॒पाम॑सि । मण्डू॑कि॒ ताभि॒रा ग॑हि॒ सेमं नो॑ य॒ज्ञं पा॑व॒कव॑र्णँ शिवं कृधि ।।

text:
This is the place where waters meet; here is the gathering
 of the flood.
 Let thy shaft burn others than us: be thou cleanser, propitious
 unto us.
meaning: अ॒पामि॒दं न्यय॑नँ समु॒द्रस्य॑ नि॒वेश॑नम् । अ॒न्याँस्ते॑ अ॒स्मत्त॑पन्तु हे॒तयः॑ पाव॒को अ॒स्मभ्यँ॑ शि॒वो भ॑व ।।

text:
O Agni, purifier, God, with splendour and thy pleasant
 tongue
 Bring hither, and adore, the Gods.
meaning: अग्ने॑ पावक रो॒चिषा॑ म॒न्द्रया॑ देव जि॒ह्वया॑ । आ दे॒वान्व॑क्षि॒ यक्षि॑ च ।।

text:
So, Agni, purifying, bright, bring hither to our sacrifice,
 To our oblation bring the Gods.
meaning: स नः॑ पावक दीदि॒वो ग्ने॑ दे॒वाँ इ॒हा व॑ह । उप॑ य॒ज्ञँ ह॒विश्च॑ नः ।।

text:
He who with purifying, eye-attracting form hath shone upon
 the earth as with the light of Dawn;
 Who speeding on, as in the fleet steed's race, in fight, cometh
 untouched by age, as one athirst in heat.
meaning: पा॑व॒कया॒ यश्चि॒तय॑न्त्या कृ॒पा क्षाम॑न्रुरु॒च उ॒षसो॒ न भा॒नुना॑ । तूर्व॒न्न याम॒न्नेत॑शस्य॒ नू रण॒ आ यो घृ॒णे न त॑तृषा॒णो अ॒जरः॑ ।।

text:
Obeisance to thy wrath and glow! Obeisance to thy fiery
 flame!
 Let thy shot missiles burn others than us: be thou cleanser,
 propitious unto us.
meaning: नम॑स्ते॒ हर॑से शो॒चिषे॒ नम॑स्ते अस्त्व॒र्चिषे॑ । अ॒न्याँस्ते॑ अ॒स्मत्त॑पन्तु हे॒तयः॑ पाव॒को अ॒स्मभ्यँ॑ शि॒वो भ॑व ।।

text:
To him who dwells in man, Hail! To him who dwells in
 waters, Hail!
 To him who dwells in sacred grass, Hail! To him who dwells
 in the wood, Hail! To him who finds the light, Hail!
meaning: नृ॒षदे॒ वेट् । अ॑प्सु॒षदे॒ वेट् । ब॑र्हि॒षदे॒ वेट् । व॑न॒सदे॒ वेट् । स्व॒र्विदे॒ वेट् ।।

text:
Worshipful Gods of Gods who merit worship, those who sit
 down beside their yearly portion,
 Let them who eat not sacrificial presents drink in this rite
 of honey and of butter.
meaning: ये दे॒वा दे॒वानां॑ य॒ज्ञिया॑ य॒ज्ञिया॑नाँ संवत्स॒रीण॒मुप॑ भा॒गमास॑ते । अ॑हु॒तादो॑ ह॒विषो॑ य॒ज्ञे अ॒स्मिन्त्स्व॒यं पि॑बन्तु॒ मधु॑नो घृ॒तस्य॑ ।।

text:
Those Gods who have attained to Godhead over Gods, they
 who have led the way in this our holy work,
 Without whose aid no body whatsoever moves, not on heaven's
 heights are they, nor on the face of earth.
meaning: ये दे॒वा दे॒वेष्वधि॑ देव॒त्वमाय॒न्ये ब्रह्म॑णः पुरए॒तारो॑ अस्य । येभ्यो॑ न ऋ॒ते पव॑ते॒ धाम॒ किं च॒न न ते दि॒वो न पृ॑थि॒व्या अधि॒ स्नुषु॑ ।।

text:
Giver of breath, of out-breath, breath diffusive, giver of
 lustre, giving room and freedom,
 Let thy shot missiles burn others than us: be thou cleanser,
 propitious unto us.
meaning: प्रा॑ण॒दा अ॑पान॒दा व्या॑न॒दा व॑र्चो॒दा व॑रिवो॒दाः । अ॒न्याँस्ते॑ अ॒स्मत्त॑पन्तु हे॒तयः॑ पाव॒को अ॒स्मभ्यँ॑ शि॒वो भ॑व ।।

text:
May Agni with his sharpened blaze cast down each fierce
 devouring fiend.
 May Agni win us wealth by war.
meaning: अ॒ग्निस्ति॒ग्मेन॑ शो॒चिषा॒ यास॒द्विश्वं॒ न्य॒त्रिण॑म् । अ॒ग्निर्नो॑ वनते र॒यिम् ।।

text:
He who sate down as Hotar priest, the Rishi, our Father
 offering, up all things existent
