meaning: का स्वि॑दासीत्पू॒र्वचि॑त्तिः॒ किँ स्वि॑दासीद्बृ॒हद्वयः॑ । का स्वि॑दासीत्पिलिप्पि॒ला का स्वि॑दासीत्पिशङ्गि॒ला ।।

text:
-FOURTH.

HORSE, hornless goat, Gomriga, these belong to Prajâpati.
 A black-necked goat, devoted to Agni, (is to be bound)
 in front to the forehead (of the horse); Sarasvatî's ewe
 below his jaws; two goats belonging to the Asvins, with
 marks on the lower parts of the body, to his fore-legs; a
 dark-coloured goat, Soma's and Pûshan's, to his navel; a
 white and a black, sacred to Soma and Varna, to his sides;
 Tvashtar's two, with bushy tails, to his hind feet; Vâyu's
 white goat to his tail; for Indra the Good Worker a cow
 who slips her calf; a dwarf belonging to Vishnu.
meaning: अश्व॑स्तूप॒रो गो॑मृ॒गस्ते प्रा॑जाप॒त्याः कृ॒ष्णग्री॑व आग्ने॒यो र॒राटे॑ पु॒रस्ता॑त्सारस्व॒ती मे॒ष्य॑धस्ता॒द्धन्वो॑राश्वि॒नाव॒धोरा॑मौ बा॒ह्वोः सौ॑मपौ॒ष्णः श्या॒मो नाभ्याँ॑ सौर्ययामौ श्वे॒तश्च॑ कृ॒ष्णश्च॑ पा॒र्श्वयो॑स्त्वाष्ट्रौ लोम॒शस॑क्थौ स॒क्थ्योर्वा॑य॒व्यः॑ श्वे॒तः पुच्छ॒ इन्द्रा॑य स्वप॒स्या॑य वे॒हद्वै॑ष्ण॒वो वा॑म॒नः ।।

text:
The red goat, the smoky-red, the jujube-red, these belong to
 Soma. The brown, the ruddy-brown, the parrot-brown,
 these are Varuna's. One with white ear holes, one with
 partly white, one with wholly white, belong to Savitar.
 One with fore feet white, partly white, wholly white,
 belongs to Brihaspati. She goats speckled, with small spots,
 with big spots, these belong to Mitra-Varuna.
meaning: रोहि॑तो धू॒म्ररो॑हितः क॒र्कन्धु॑रोहित॒स्ते सौ॒म्या ब॒भ्रुर॑रु॒णब॑भ्रुः॒ शुक॑बभ्रु॒स्ते वा॑रु॒णाः शि॑ति॒रन्ध्रो॒ न्यतः॑शितिरन्ध्रः सम॒न्तशि॑तिरन्ध्र॒स्ते सा॑वि॒त्राः शि॑तिहुः सम॒न्तशि॑तिबाहु॒स्ते बा॑र्हस्प॒त्याः पृष॑ती क्षु॒द्रपृ॑षती स्थू॒लपृ॑षती॒ ता मै॑त्रावर�॒ण्यः॑ ।।

text:
The bright-tailed, the wholly bright-tailed, the jewel-tailed,
 these belong to the Asvins. The white, the white-eyed,
 the reddish, these are for Rudra Lord of Beasts. Long-eared
 goats are for Yama; proud ones for Rudra; cloud-coloured
 ones for Parjanya.
meaning: शु॒द्धवा॑लः स॒र्वशु॑द्धवालो मणि॒वाल॒स्त आ॑श्वि॒नाः श्येतः॑ श्येता॒क्षो॑ रु॒णस्ते रु॒द्राय॑ पशु॒पत॑ये क॒र्णा या॒मा अ॑वलि॒प्ता रौ॒द्रा नभो॑रूपाः पार्ज॒न्याः ।।

text:
Goats speckled, transversely speckled, upward speckled are
 for the Maruts. The reddish she-goat, the red-haired, the
 white, these belong to Sarasvatî. The goat with diseased
 ears, the short-eared, the red eared are Tvashtar's. The
 black-necked, the white-flanked, one with bright-coloured
 thighs belong to Indra and Agni. Those with black marks,
 small marks, large marks belong to Dawn.
meaning: पृश्नि॑स्तिर॒श्चीन॑पृश्निरू॒र्ध्वपृ॑श्नि॒स्ते मा॑रु॒ताः प॒ल्गूर्लो॑हितो॒र्णी प॑ल॒क्षी ताः सा॑रस्व॒त्यः॑ प्लीहा॒कर्णः॑ शुण्ठा॒कर्णो॑ द्ध्यालोह॒कर्ण॒स्ते त्वा॒ष्ट्राः कृ॒ष�॑वः शिति॒कक्षो॑ ञ्जिस॒क्थस्त ऐ॑न्द्रा॒ग्नाः कृ॒ष्णाञ्जि॒रल्पा॑ञ्जिर्म॒हाञ्जि॒स्त उ॑ष॒स्याः॑ ।।

text:
Parti-coloured female victims belong to the All-Gods;
 red-coloured, eighteen mouths old to Vâk; victims without
 distinguishing marks to Aditi; those of one same colour
 to Dhâtar; weaned kids sacred to the Consorts of the Gods.
meaning: शि॒ल्पा वै॑श्वदे॒व्यो॒ रोहि॑ण्य॒स्त्र्यव॑यो वा॒चे वि॑ज्ञाता॒ अदि॑त्यै॒ सरू॑पा धा॒त्रे व॑त्सत॒र्यो॑ दे॒वानां॒ पत्नी॑भ्यः ।।
कृ॒ष्णग्री॑वा आग्ने॒याः शि॑ति॒भ्रवो॒ वसू॑नाँ॒ रोहि॑ता रु॒द्राणाँ॑ श्वे॒ता अ॑वरो॒किण॑ आदि॒त्यानां॒ नभो॑रूपाः पार्ज॒न्याः ।।

text:
The tall goat, the sturdy, the dwarf, these are Indra-Vishnu's;
 the tall, the white fore-footed, the black-backed,
 Indra-Brihaspati's; parrot-coloured the Vâjins’; speckled
 Agni-Maruts’; dark-coloured Pûshan's.
meaning: उ॑न्न॒त ऋ॑ष॒भो वा॑म॒नस्त ऐ॑न्द्रवैष्ण॒वा उ॑न्न॒तः शि॑तिबा॒हुः शि॑तिपृ॒ष्ठस्त ऐ॑न्द्राबार्�॒त्याः शुक॑रूपा वाजि॒नाः क॒ल्माषा॑ आग्निमारु॒ताः श्या॒माः पौ॒ष्नाः ।।

text:
Variegated, Indra-Agni's; two-coloured, Agni-Soma's; dwarf
 oxen, Agni-Vishnu's; barren cows, Mitra-Varuna's; partly
 variegated, Mitra's.
meaning: एता॑ ऐन्द्रा॒ग्ना द्वि॑रू॒पा अ॑ग्नीषो॒मीया॑ वाम॒ना अ॑न॒ड्वाह॑ आग्नावैष्ण॒वा व॒शा मै॑त्रावर�॒ण्यो॒ न्यतए॑न्यो मै॒त्र्यः॑ ।।
कृ॒ष्णग्री॑वा आग्ने॒या ब॒भ्रवः॑ सौ॒म्याः श्वे॒ता वा॑य॒व्या॒ अवि॑ज्ञाता॒ अदि॑त्यै॒ सरू॑पा धा॒त्रे व॑त्सत॒र्यो॑ दे॒वानां॒ पत्नी॑भ्यः ।।

text:
Black ones for Earth; smoke-coloured for Firmament; tall
 ones for Sky; brindled ones for Lightning; blotched ones
 for Stars.
meaning: कृ॒ष्णा भौ॒मा धू॒म्रा आ॑न्तरि॒क्षा बृ॒हन्तो॑ दि॒व्याः श॒बला॑ वैद्यु॒ताः सि॒ध्मास्ता॑र॒काः ।।
धू॒म्रान्व॑स॒न्ताया ल॑भते श्वे॒तान्ग्री॒ष्माय॑ कृ॒ष्णान्व॒र्षाभ्यो॑ रु॒णाञ्छ॒रदे॒ पृष॑तो हेम॒न्ताय॑ पि॒शङ्गा॒ञ्छिशि॑राय ।।
त्र्यव॑यो गायत्र्यै॒ पञ्चा॑वयस्त्रि॒ष्टुभे॑ दित्य॒वाहो॒ जग॑त्यै त्रिव॒त्सा अ॑नु॒ष्टुभे॑ तुर्य॒वाह॑ उ॒ष्णिहे॑ ।।
प॑ष्थ॒वाहो॑ वि॒राज॑ उ॒क्षणो॑ बृह॒त्या ऋ॑ष॒भाः क॒कुभे॑ न॒ड्वाहः॑ पङ्क्त्यै धे॒नवो॑ तिच्छन्दसे ।।

text:
Black-necked victims sacred to Agni; brown to Soma; spotted
 to Savitar; weaned she-kids to Sarasvatî; dark-coloured
 goats to Pûshan; speckled victims to the Maruts;
 many-coloured to the All-Gods; barren cows to Heaven
 and Earth.
meaning: कृ॒ष्णग्री॑वा आग्ने॒या ब॒भ्रवः॑ सौ॒म्या उ॑पध्व॒स्ताः सा॑वि॒त्रा व॑त्सत॒र्यः॑ सारस्व॒त्यः॑ श्या॒माः पौ॒ष्णाः पृश्न॑यो मारु॒ता ब॑हुरू॒पा वै॑श्वदे॒वा व॒शा द्या॑वापृथि॒वीयाः॑ ।।
उ॒क्ताः सं॑च॒रा एता॑ ऐन्द्रा॒ग्नाः कृ॒ष्णाः वा॑रु॒णाः पृश्न॑यो मारु॒ताः का॒यास्तू॑प॒राः ।।

text:
To Agni foremost in place he sacrifices firstling goats; to
 the consuming Maruts those born of one mother; to the
 Maruts who perform domestic rites those born after a long
 time; to the sportive Maruts those born together; to the
 self-strong Maruts those born in succession.
meaning: अ॒ग्नये नी॑कवते प्रथम॒जाना ल॑भते म॒रुद्भ्यः॑ सांतप॒नेभ्यः॑ सवा॒त्यान्म॒रुद्भ्यो॑ गृहमे॒धिभ्यो॒ बष्कि॑हान्म॒रुद्भ्यः॑ क्री॒डिभ्यः॑ सँसृ॒ष्टान्म॒रुद्भ्यः॒ स्वत॑वद्भ्यो नुसृ॒ष्टान् ।।
उ॒क्ताः सं॑च॒रा एता॑ ऐन्द्रा॒ग्नाः प्रा॑शृ॒ङ्गा मा॑हे॒न्द्रा ब॑हुरू॒पा वै॑श्वकर्म॒णाः ।।

text:
Smoke-coloured, those of brownish hue, to be offered to the
 Soma-possessing Fathers; the brown and the smoky-looking
 to the Fathers who sit on sacred grass; the black and
 the brownish-looking to the Fathers who have been tasted
 by Agni; the black and the spotted belong to Tryambaka.
meaning: धू॒म्रा ब॒भ्रुनी॑काशाः पितॄ॒णाँ सोम॑वतां ब॒भ्रवो॑ ब॒भ्रुनी॑काशाः पितॄ॒णां ब॑र्हि॒षदां॑ कृ॒ष्णा ब॒भ्रुनी॑काशाः पितॄ॒णाम॑ग्निष्वा॒त्तानां॑ कृ॒ष्णाः पृष॑न्तस्त्रैयम्ब॒काः ।।

text:
Called contemporaneous, the dappled belong to Suna and
 Sîra; white ones to Vâyu; white ones to Sûrya.

To Spring he offers Kapiñjalas; to Summer sparrows; to
 the Rains partridges; to Autumn quails; to Winter.
 Kakaras; to the Dewy Season Vikakaras.
meaning: व॑स॒न्ताय॑ क॒पिञ्ज॑ला॒ना ल॑भते ग्री॒ष्माय॑ कल॒विङ्गा॑न्व॒र्षाभ्य॑स्ति॒त्तिरी॑ञ्छ॒रदे॒ वर्ति॑का हेम॒न्ताय॒ कक॑रा॒ञ्छिशि॑राय॒ विक॑करान् ।।

text:
To the Sea he sacrifices porpoises; to Parjanya frogs; to
 the Waters fishes; to Mitra Kulîpayas; to Varuna crocodiles.
meaning: स॑मु॒द्राय॑ शिशु॒मारा॒न ल॑भते प॒र्जन्या॑य म॒ण्डूका॑न॒द्भ्यो मत्स्या॑न्मि॒त्राय॑ कुली॒पया॒य ना॒क्रान् ।।
सोमा॑य हँ॒साना ल॑भते वा॒यवे॑ ब॒लाका॑ इन्द्रा॒ग्निभ्यां॒ क्रुञ्चा॑न्मि॒त्राय॑ म॒द्गून्वरु॑�य चक्रवा॒कान् ।।

text:
To Agni he sacrifices cocks; to Vanaspatis owls; to Agni-Soma
 blue jays; to the Asvins peacocks; to Mitra-Varuna
 pigeons.
meaning: अ॒ग्नये॑ कु॒टरू॒ना ल॑भते॒ वन॒स्पति॑भ्य॒ उलू॑कान॒ग्नीषोमा॑भ्यां॒ चाषा॑न॒श्विभ्यां॑ म॒यूरा॑भ्यां क॒पोता॑न् ।।
सोमा॑य ल॒बाना ल॑भते॒ त्वष्ट्रे॑ कौली॒कान्गो॑षा॒दीर्दे॒वानां॒ पत्नी॑भ्यः कु॒लीका॑ देवजा॒मिभ्यो॒ ग्नये॑ गृ॒हप॑तये पारु॒ष्णान् ।।

text:
To Day he sacrifices doves; to Night Sîchâpûs; to the Joints
 of Day and Night bats; to the Months gallinules; to the
 Year great eagles.
meaning: अह्ने॑ पा॒राव॑ता॒ना ल॑भते॒ रात्र्यै॑ सीचा॒पूर॑होरा॒त्रयोः॑ सं॒धिभ्यो॑ ज॒तूर्मासे॑भ्यो दात्यौ॒हान्त्सं॑वत्स॒राय॑ मह॒तः सु॑प॒र्णान् ।।

text:
To Ground he sacrifices rats; to Firmament field-rats; to
 Day voles; to the Quarters mungooses; to the Intermediate
 Spaces brownish ichneumons.
meaning: भूम्या॑ आ॒खूना ल॑भते॒ न्तरि॑क्षाय पा॒ङ्क्त्रान्दि॒वे कशा॑न्दि॒ग्भ्यो न॑कु॒लान्बभ्रु॑कानवाभ्यः॑ ।।
वसु॑भ्य॒ ऋश्या॒ना ल॑भते रु॒द्रेभ्यः॒ रुरू॑नादि॒त्येभ्यो॒ न्यङ्कू॒न्विश्वे॑भ्यो दे॒वेभ्यः॑ पृष॒तान्त्सा॒ध्येभ्यः॑ कुलु॒ङ्गान् ।।

text:
To Îsâna he sacrifices wild asses; to Mitra Gauras; to Varuna
 buffaloes; to Brihaspati Gayals; to Tvashtar camels.
meaning: ईशा॑नाय॒ पर॑स्वत॒ आ ल॑भते मि॒त्राय॑ गौ॒रान्वरु॑णाय महि॒षान्बृह॒स्पत॑ये गव॒याँस्त्वष्ट्र॒ उष्ट्रा॑न् ।।

text:
To Prajâpati he sacrifices men elephants; to Vâk white ants;
 to Sight flies; to Hearing black bees.
meaning: प्र॒जाप॑तये॒ पुरु॑षान्ह॒स्तिन॒ आ ल॑भते वा॒चे प्लुषीँ॒श्चक्षु॑षे म॒शका॒ञ्छ्रोत्रा॑य॒ भृङ्गाः॑ ।।

text:
To Prajâpati and to Vâyu a Gayal is to be offered; to Varuna
 a wild ram; to Yama a black ram; to a human king a
 monkey; to the Tiger a red doe; to the Bull a female
 Gayal, to the Kshiprasyena a quail; to the Nilangu a
 worm; to the Sea a porpoise; to the Snowy Mountain an
 elephant.
meaning: प्र॒जाप॑तये च वा॒यवे॑ च गोमृ॒गो वरु॑णायार॒ण्यो मे॒षो य॒माय॒ कृष्णो॑ मनुष्यरा॒जाय॑ म॒र्कटः॑ शार्दू॒लाय॑ रो॒हिदृ॑ष॒भाय॑ गव॒यी क्षि॑प्रश्ये॒नाय॒ वर्ति॑का॒ नीलं॑गोः॒ कृमिः॑ समु॒द्राय॑ शिशु॒मारो॑ हि॒मव॑ते ह॒स्ती ।।

text:
The Kinnara belongs to Prajâpati; the Ula, the Halikshna,
 the cat belong to Dhâtar; the heron belongs to the Quarters;
 the Dhunkshâ to Agni; sparrow, red snake, Sâras,
 these are Tvashtar's; the curlew belongs to Vâk.
meaning: म॒युः प्रा॑जाप॒त्य उ॒लो ह॒लिक्ष्णो॑ वृषदँ॒शस्ते धा॒त्रे दि॒शां क॒ङ्को धुङ्क्षा॑ग्ने॒यी क॑ल॒विङ्को॑ लोहिता॒हिः पु॑ष्करसा॒दस्ते त्वा॒ष्ट्रा वा॒चे क्रुञ्चः॑ ।।

text:
To Soma an antelope is to be offered; wild goat, mungoose,
 Sakâ. these are Pûshan's; the jackal is the Mâyu's; the
 Gaura Indra's; Pidva, antelope, cock, these are Anumati's;
 the Chakravâka is for Echo.
meaning: सोमा॑य कुलु॒ङ्ग आ॑र॒ण्यो॒ जो न॑कु॒लः शका॒ ते पौ॒ष्णाः क्रो॒ष्टा मा॒योरिन्द्र॑स्य गौरमृ॒गः पि॒द्वो न्यङ्कुः॑ कक्क॒टस्ते नु॑मत्यै प्रति॒श्रुत्का॑यै चक्रवा॒कः ।।

text:
The female crane is Sûrya's; Sârga, Srijays, Sayândaka,
 these are Mitra's; to Sarasvatî belongs the human-voiced
 Maina; to Ground the porcupine; tiger, wolf, viper belong
 to Passion; to Sarasvân the human-voiced parrot.
meaning: सौ॒री ब॒लाका॑ शा॒र्गः सृ॑ज॒यः श॒याण्ड॑क॒स्ते मै॒त्राः सर॑स्वत्यै॒ शारिः॑ पुरुष॒वाक्श्वा॒वि�॒मी शा॑र्दू॒लो वृकः॒ पृदा॑कु॒स्ते म॒न्यवे॒ सर॑स्वते॒ शुकः॑ पुरुष॒वाक् ।।
सु॑प॒र्णः पा॑र्ज॒न्य आ॒तिर्वा॑ह॒सो दर्वि॑दा॒ ते वा॒यवे॒ बृह॒स्पत॑ये वा॒चस्पत॑ये पैङ्गरा॒जो॑ ल॒ज आ॑न्तरि॒क्षः प्ल॒वो म॒द्गुर्मत्स्य॒स्ते न॑दी॒पत॑ये द्यावापृथि॒वीयः॑ कू॒र्मः ।।

text:
The book belongs to the Moon; iguana, Kâlakâ, woodpecker,
 these belong to the Vanaspatis; the cock belongs to Savitar;
 the swan is Vâta's; crocodile, dolphin, Kulîpaya,
 these belong to the Sea; the porcupine to Modesty.
meaning: पु॑रुषमृ॒गश्च॒न्द्रम॑सो गो॒धा काल॑का दार्वाघा॒टस्ते वन॒स्पती॑नां कृक॒वाकुः॑ सावि॒त्रो हँ॒सो वात॑स्य ना॒क्रो मक॑रः कुली॒पय॒स्ते कू॑पारस्य ह्रियै॒ शल्प॑कः ।।

text:
The Black-doe belongs to Day; frog, female rat, partridge,
 these belong to the Serpents; the jackal belongs to the
 Asvins; the Black-buck to Night; bear, bat, Sushilikâ,
 these belong to the Other Folk (
i.e. fairies--JBH
); the polecat belongs to
 Vishnu.
meaning: ए॒ण्यह्नो॑ म॒ण्डूको॒ मूषि॑का ति॒त्तिरि॒स्ते स॒र्पाणां॑ लोपा॒श आ॑श्वि॒नः कृष्णो॒ रात्र्या॒ ऋक्षो॑ ज॒तूः सु॑षि॒लीका॒ त इ॑तरज॒नानां॒ जह॑का वैष्ण॒वी ।।

text:
The cuckoo belongs to the Half Months; antelope, peacock,
 eagle, these are the Gandharvas’; the otter belongs to
 the Months; tortoise, doe-antelope, iguana, Golathikâ
 belong to the Apsarases; the black snake belongs to Death.
meaning: अ॑न्यवा॒पो॑ र्धमा॒साना॒मृश्यो॑ म॒यूरः॑ सुप॒र्णस्ते ग॑न्ध॒र्वाणा॑म॒पामु॒द्रो मा॒सां क॒श्यपो॑ रो॒हित्कु॑ण्डृ॒णाची॑ गो॒लत्ति॑का॒ ते॑ प्स॒रसां॑ मृ॒त्यवे॑ सि॒तः ।।

text:
The frog belongs to the Seasons; the vole, the rat, the mouse,
 these are the Fathers’; the Python, the Balâva belong to
 the Vasus; Kapiñjala, pigeons owl, hare belong to Nirriti;
 the wild ram to Varuna.
meaning: व॑र्षा॒हूरृ॒तूना॑मा॒खुः कशो॑ मान्था॒लस्ते पि॑तॄ॒णां बला॑याजग॒रो वसू॑नां क॒पिञ्ज॑लः क॒पोत॒ उलू॑कः श॒शस्ते निरृ॑त्यै॒ वरु॑णायार॒ण्यो मे॒षः ।।

text:
The white animal belongs to the Âdityas; the camel, the
 Ghrintîvân, the rhinoceros to Mati; the Srimara belong to
 the Forest-God; the Raru buck is Rudra's; Kvayi, cock,
 gallinule, these are the Vâjins’; the cuckoo belongs to
 Kâma.
meaning: श्वि॒त्र आ॑दि॒त्याना॒मुष्ट्रो॒ घृणी॑वान्वार्ध्रीण॒सस्ते म॒त्या अर॑ण्याय सृम॒रो रुरू॑ रौ॒द्रः क्वयिः॑ कु॒टरु॑र्दात्यौ॒हस्ते वा॒जिनां॒ कामा॑य पि॒कः ।।

text:
The Khanga is the All-Gods'; the black dog, the long eared,
 the ass, the hyena, these are the Râkshasas; the boar is
 for Indra; the lion is for the Maruts; the chameleon,
 the Pipoaka, the vulture, these belong to Saravyâ; the
 spotted antelope belongs to the All-Gods.
meaning: ख॒ङ्गो वै॑श्वदे॒वः श्वा कृ॒ष्णः क॒र्णो ग॑र्द॒भस्त॒रक्षु॒स्ते रक्ष॑सा॒मिन्द्रा॑य सूक॒रः सिँ॒हो मा॑रु॒ताः कृ॑कला॒सः पिप्प॑का श॒कुनि॒स्ते श॑र॒व्या॑यै॒ विश्वे॑षां दे॒वानां॑ पृष॒तः ।।

text:
-FIFTH.

I GRATIFY Fresh Grass with his teeth, Avakâ with his gums,
 Clay with his tooth-sockets, Tegas with his fangs. The
 tongue-tip for Sarasvatî; I gratify the root of the tongue
 and the palate with his neigh, Vâja with his jaws, the
 Waters with his mouth, the Stallion with his testicles,
 the Âdityas with the beard, Path with his eyebrows,
 Heaven and Earth with his eyelashes, Lightning with
 the pupils of his eyes. Hail to the white! Hail to the
 black! Effectual are his eyelashes, irresistible are his
 lower eyelashes; irresistible are his eyelashes, effectual
 are his lower eyelashes.
meaning: शादं॑ द॒द्भिरव॑कां दन्तमूलै॒र्मृदं॒ बर्स्वै॑स्ते॒गान्दँष्ट्रा॑भ्याँ॒ सर॑स्वत्या अग्रजि॒ह्वं जि॒ह्वाया॑ उत्सा॒दम॑वक्र॒न्देन॒ तालु॒ वाजँ॒ हनु॑भ्याम॒प आ॒स्ये॑न॒ वृष॑णमा॒ण्डाभ्या॑�॒त्याँ श्मश्रु॑भिः॒ पन्था॑नं भ्रू॒भ्यां द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी वर्तो॑भ्यां वि॒द्युतं॑ क॒नीन॑काभ्याँ शु॒क्लाय॒ स्वाहा॑ कृ॒ष्णाय॒ स्वाहा॒ पार्या॑णि॒ पक्ष्मा॑ण्यवा॒र्या॑ इ॒क्षवो॑ वा॒र्या॑णि॒ पक्ष्मा॑णि॒ पार्या॑ इ॒क्षवः॑ ।।

वातं॑ प्रा॒णेना॑पा॒नेन॒ नसि॑के उपया॒ममध॑रेणौष्ठेन॒ सदुत्त॑रेण प्रका॒शेनान्त॑रमनूका॒शेन॒ बाह्व्यं॑ निवे॒ष्यं मू॒र्ध्ना स्त॑नयि॒त्नुं नि॑र्बा॒धेना॒शनिं॑ म॒स्तिष्के॑ण वि॒द्युतं॑ क॒नीन॑काभ्यां॒ कर्णा॑भ्याँ॒ श्रोत्रँ॒ श्रोत्रा॑भ्यां॒ कर्णौ॑ तेद॒नीम॑धरक॒ण्ठेना॒पः शु॑ष्कक॒ण्ठेन॑ चि॒त्तं मन्या॑भि॒रदि॑तिँ शी॒र्ष्णा निरृ॑तिं॒ निर्ज॑र्जल्पेन शी॒र्ष्णा सं॑क्रोशैः प्रा॒णान्रे॒ष्माणँ॑ स्तु॒पेन॑ ।।

text:
I gratify Flies with his hair; Indra with his active shoulder;
 Brihaspati with his quick spring; Tortoises with his
 hoofs; Approach with his fetlocks; Kapiñjalas with his
 heel-ropes; Speed with his two thighs; the Way with
 his two fore-legs; the Forest-God with a kneepan; Agni
 with his two knees; Pûshan with his two fore-feet; the
 Asvins with his shoulders; Rudra with his shoulder-joints,
meaning: म॒शका॒न्केशै॒रिन्द्रँ॒ स्वप॑सा॒ वहे॑न॒ बृह॒स्पतिँ॑ शकुनिसा॒देन॑ कू॒र्माञ्छपैरा॒क्रम॑नँ स्थू॒राभ्या॑मृ॒क्षला॑भिः क॒पिञ्ज॑लान्ज॒वं जङ्घा॑भ्या॒मध्वा॑नं बा॒हुभ्यां॒ जाम्बी॑ले॒�ग्भ्यां॑ पू॒षणं॑ दो॒र्भ्याम॒श्विना॒वँसा॑भ्याँ रु॒द्रँ रोरा॑भ्याम् ।।

text:
The first rib is Agni's; the second Vâyu's; the third
 Indra's; the fourth Soma's; the fifth Aditi's; the sixth
 Indrânî's; the seventh the Maruts’; the eighth Brihaspati's;
 the ninth Aryaman's; the tenth Dhâtar's; the
 eleventh Indra's; the twelfth Varuna's; the thirteenth
 Yama's.
meaning: अ॒ग्नेः प॑क्ष॒तिर्वा॒योर्निप॑क्षति॒रिन्द्र॑स्य तृ॒तीया॒ सोम॑स्य चतु॒र्थ्यदि॑त्यै पञ्च॒मी�॑ण्यै ष॒ष्ठी म॒रुताँ॑ सप्त॒मी बृह॒स्पते॑रष्ट॒म्य॑र्य॒म्णो न॑व॒मी धा॒तुर्द॑श॒मीन्द्र॑स्यैक॒शी वरु॑णस्य द्वाद॒शी य॒मस्य॑ त्रयोद॒शी ।।

text:
(On the left side) the first rib belongs to Indra-Agni; the
 second to Sarasvatî; the third to Mitra; the fourth to
 the Waters; the fifth to Nirriti; the sixth to Agni-Soma;
 the seventh to the Serpents; the eighth to Vishnu; the
 ninth to Pûshan; the tenth to Tvashtar; the eleventh to
 Indra; the twelfth to Varuna; the thirteenth to Yama.
 The right flank belongs to Heaven and Earth, the left to
 the All-Gods.
meaning: इ॑न्द्रा॒ग्न्योः प॑क्ष॒तिर्सर॑स्वत्यै॒ निप॑क्षतिर्मि॒त्रस्य॑ तृ॒तीया॒पां च॑तु॒र्थी निरृ॑त्यै पञ्च॒म्य॒ग्नीषोम॑योः ष॒ष्ठी स॒र्पाणाँ॑ सप्त॒मी विष्णो॑रष्ट॒मी पू॒ष्णो न॑व॒मी त्वष्टु॑र्दश॒मीन्द्र॑स्यैकाद॒शी वरु॑णस्य द्वाद॒शी यम्यै त्रयोद॒शी द्यावा॑पृथ�॑णं पा॒र्श्वं विश्वे॑षां दे॒वाना॒मुत्त॑रम् ।।

text:
The shoulders belong to the Maruts; the first rib-cartilages
 to the All-Gods; the second to the Rudras; the third to
 the Âdityas; the tail belongs to Vâyu; the hind-quarters
 to Agni-Soma. I gratify the two Curlews with the hips;
 Indra-Brihaspati with the thighs; Mitra-Varuna with
 the groins; Approach with the buttocks; Strength with
 the two cavities of the loins.
meaning: म॒रुताँ॒ स्कन्धा॒ विश्वे॑षां दे॒वानां॑ प्रथ॒मा कीक॑सा रु॒द्राणां॑ द्वि॒तीया॑दि॒त्यानां॑ तृ॒तीया॑ वा॒योः पुच्छ॑म॒ग्नीषोम॑यो॒र्भास॑दौ॒ क्रुञ्चौ॒ श्रोणि॑भ्या॒मिन्द्रा॒बृह॒स्पती॑ ऊ॒रुभ्यां॑ मि॒त्रावरु॑णाव॒ल्गाभ्या॑मा॒क्रम॑णँ स्थू॒राभ्यां॒ बलं॒ कुष्ठा॑भ्याम् ।।

text:
I gratify Pûshan with the rectum; Blind-worms with the
 large intestines; Serpents with the entrails; Worms with
 the guts; the Waters with the bladder; Scrotum with
 the testicles; the Vâjins with his penis; Offspring with
 his seed; Blue jays with his bile; Fissures with his
 arms; Kûshmas with his lumps of dung.
meaning: पू॒षणं॑ वनि॒ष्ठुना॑न्धा॒हीन्त्स्थू॑लगु॒दया॑ स॒र्पान्गुदा॑भिर्वि॒ह्रुत॑ आन्त्रैर॒पो व॒स्तिना॒ वृष॑णमा॒ण्डाभ्यां॒ वाजि॑नँ॒ शेपे॑न प्र॒जाँ रेत॑सा॒ चाषा॑न्पि॒त्तेन॑ प्रद॒रान्पा॒युना॑ कू॒श्माञ्छ॑कपिण्डैः ।।

इन्द्र॑स्य क्री॒डो दि॑त्यै पाज॒स्यं॑ दि॒शां ज॒त्रवो दि॑त्यै भ॒सज्जी॒मूता॑न्हृदयौप॒शेना॒न्�॑क्षं पुरी॒तता॒ नभ॑ उद॒र्ये॑ण चक्रवाकौ॒ मत॑स्नाभ्यां॒ दिवं॑ वृ॒क्काभ्यां॑ गि॒रीन्प्ला॒शिभि�॒ह्ना व॒ल्मीका॑न्क्लो॒मभि॑र्ग्लौ॒भिर्गुल्मा॑न्हि॒राभिः॒ स्रव॑न्तीर्ह्र॒दान्कु॒क्षिभ्याँ॑ समु॒द्रमु॒दरे॑ण वैश्वान॒रं भस्म॑ना ।।

text:
I gratify Separation with his navel; Butter with his flavour;
 the Waters with his broth; Sunbeams with his drops of
 fat; Hoar-frost with his heat; Ice with his marrow; Hailstones
 with his tears; Thunderbolts with the rheum of
 his eyes; Râkshasas with his blood; Bright things with
 his limbs; Stars with his beauty; Earth with his skin.
 All-hail to Jumbaka!
meaning: विधृ॑तिं॒ नाभ्या॑ धृ॒तँ रसे॑ना॒पो यू॒ष्णा मरी॑चीर्वि॒प्रुड्भि॑र्नीहा॒रमू॒ष्मणा॑ शी॒नं वस॑या॒ प्रुष्वा॒ अश्रु॑भिर्ह्रा॒दुनी॑र्दू॒षीका॑भिर॒स्ना रक्षाँ॑सि चि॒त्राण्यङ्गै॒र्न�णि रू॒पेण॑ पृथि॒वीं त्व॒चा जु॑म्ब॒काय॒ स्वाहा॑ ।।

text:
In the beginning rose Hiranyagarbha, etc., as in XIII. 4;
 XXIII. 1.
meaning: हि॑रण्यग॒र्भः सम॑वर्त॒ताग्रे॑ भू॒तस्य॑ जा॒तः पति॒रेक॑ आसीत् । स दा॑धार पृथि॒वीं द्यामु॒तेमां कस्मै॑ दे॒वाय॑ ह॒विषा॑ विधेम ।।

text: Who by his grandeur, etc., as in XXIII. 3.
meaning: यः प्रा॑ण॒तो नि॑मिष॒तो म॑हित्वैक॒ इद्राजा॒ जग॑तो ब॒भूव॑ । य ईशे॑ अ॒स्य द्वि॒पद॒श्चतु॑ष्पदः॒ कस्मै॑ दे॒वाय॑ ह॒विषा॑ विधेम ।।

text:
Whose, by his might, are these snow-covered mountains,
 and men call sea and Rasâ his possession:
 Whose are these arms, whose are these heavenly regions.
 What God shall we adore with our oblation?
meaning: यस्ये॒मे हि॒मव॑न्तो महि॒त्वा यस्य॑ समु॒द्रँ र॒सया॑ स॒हाहुः । यस्ये॒माः प्र॒दिशो॒ यस्य॑ बा॒हू कस्मै॑ दे॒वाय॑ ह॒विषा॑ विधेम ।।

text:
Giver of vital breath, of power and vigour, he whose
 commandment all the Gods acknowledge:
 The Lord of death, whose shade is life immortal. What
 God shall we adore with our oblation?
meaning: य आ॑त्म॒दा ब॑ल॒दा यस्य॒ विश्व॑ उ॒पास॑ते प्र॒शिषं॒ यस्य॑ दे॒वाः । यस्य॑ छा॒यामृतं॒ यस्य॑ मृ॒त्युः कस्मै॑ दे॒वाय॑ ह॒विषा॑ विधेम ।।

text:
May powers auspicious come to us from every side, never
 deceived, unhindered and victorious,
 That the Gods ever may be with us for our gain, our guardians
 day by day, unceasing in their care.
meaning: आ नो॑ भ॒द्राः क्रत॑वो यन्तु वि॒श्वतो द॑ब्धासो॒ अप॑रीतास उ॒द्भिदः॑ । दे॒वा नो॒ यथा॒ सद॒मिद्वृ॒धे अस॒न्नप्रा॑युवो रक्षि॒तारो॑ दि॒वेदि॑वे ।।

text:
May the auspicious favour of the Gods be ours, on us
 descend the bounty of the righteous Gods.
 The friendship of the Gods have we devoutly sought: so
 may the Gods extend our life that we may live.
meaning: दे॒वानां॑ भ॒द्रा सु॑म॒तिरृ॑जूय॒तां दे॒वानाँ॑ रा॒तिर॒भि नो॒ नि व॑र्तताम् । दे॒वानाँ॑ स॒ख्यमुप॑ सेदिमा व॒यं दे॒वा न॒ आयुः॒ प्र ति॑रन्तु जी॒वसे॑ ।।

text:
We call them hither with a hymn of olden time, Bhaga, the
 friendly Daksha, Mitra, Aditi,
 Aryaman, Varuna, Soma, the Asvins. May Sarasvatî, auspicious,
 grant felicity.
meaning: तान्पूर्व॑या नि॒विदा॑ हूमहे व॒यं भगं॑ मि॒त्रमदि॑तिं॒ दक्ष॑म॒स्रिध॑म् । अ॑र्य॒मणं॒ वरु॑णँ॒ सोम॑म॒श्विना॒ सर॑स्वती नः सु॒भगा॒ मय॑स्करत् ।।

text:
May the Wind waft to us that pleasant medicine, may Earth
 our Mother give it, and our Father Heaven,
 And the joy-giving stones that press the Soma's juice. Asvins,
 may ye, for whom our spirits long, hear this.
meaning: तन्नो॒ वातो॑ मयो॒भु वा॑तु भेष॒जं तन्मा॒ता पृ॑थि॒वी तत्पि॒ता द्यौः॑ । तद्ग्रावा॑णः सोम॒सुतो॑ मयो॒भुव॒स्तद॑श्विना शृणुतं धिष्ण्या यु॒वम् ।।

text:
Him we invoke for aid who reigns supreme, the Lord of all
 that stands or moves, inspirer of the soul,
 That Pûshan may promote the increase of our wealth, our
 keeper and our guard infallible for our good.
meaning: तमीशा॑नं॒ जग॑तस्त॒स्थुष॒स्पतिं॑ धियंजि॒न्वमव॑से हूमहे व॒यम् । पू॒षा नो॒ यथा॒ वेद॑सा॒मस॑द्वृ॒धे र॑क्षि॒ता पा॒युरद॑ब्धः स्व॒स्तये॑ ।।

text:
Illustrious far and wide, may Indra prosper us: may Pûshan
 prosper us, the Master of all wealth.
 May Târkshya with uninjured fellies prosper us: Brihaspati
 vouchsafe to us prosperity.
meaning: स्व॒स्ति न॒ इन्द्रो॑ वृ॒द्धश्र॑वाः स्व॒स्ति नः॑ पू॒षा वि॒श्ववे॑दाः । स्व॒स्ति न॒स्तार्क्ष्यो॒ अरि॑ष्टनेमिः स्व॒स्ति नो॒ बृह॒स्पति॑र्दधातु ।।

text:
The Maruts, Sons of Prisni, borne by spotted steeds, moving
 in glory, oft visiting holy rites,
 Sages whose tongue is Agni and their eyes the Sun,——hither
 let all the Gods for our protection come.
meaning: पृष॑दश्वा म॒रुतः॒ पृश्नि॑मातरः शुभं॒यावा॑नो वि॒दथे॑षु॒ जग्म॑यः । अ॑ग्निजि॒ह्वा मन॑वः॒ सूर॑चक्षसो॒ विश्वे॑ नो दे॒वा अव॒सा ग॑मन्नि॒ह ।।

text:
Gods, may we with our ears listen to what is good, and with
 our eyes see what is good, ye Holy Ones.
 With limbs and bodies firm may we extolling you attain the
 term of life appointed by the Gods.
meaning: भ॒द्रं कर्णे॑भिः शृणुयाम देवा भ॒द्रं प॑श्येमा॒क्षभि॑र्यजत्राः । स्थिरै॒रङ्गै॑स्तुष्टु॒वाँस॑स्त॒नूभि॒र्व्य॑शेमहि दे॒वहि॑तं॒ यदायुः॑ ।।

text:
A hundred autumns stand before us, O ye Gods, within
 whose space ye bring our bodies to decay;
 Within whose space our sons become fathers in turn. Break
 ye not in the midst our course of fleeting life.
meaning: श॒तमिन्नु श॒रदो॒ अन्ति॑ देवा॒ यत्रा॑ नश्च॒क्रा ज॒रसं॑ त॒नूना॑म् । पु॒त्रासो॒ यत्र॑ पि॒तरो॒ भव॑न्ति॒ मा नो॑ म॒ध्या री॑रिष॒तायु॒र्गन्तोः॑ ।।

text:
Aditi is the heaven, Aditi is mid-air, Aditi is the Mother
 and the Sire and Son.

Aditi is all Gods, Aditi five-classed men, Aditi all that hath
 been born and shall be born.
meaning: अदि॑तिर्द्यौ॒रदि॑तिर॒न्तरि॑क्ष॒मदि॑तिर्मा॒ता स पि॒ता स पु॒त्रः । विश्वे॑ दे॒वा अदि॑तिः॒ पञ्च॒ जना॒ अदि॑तिर्जा॒तमदि॑ति॒र्जनि॑त्वम् ।।

text:
Slight us not Varuna, Aryaman, or Mitra, Ribhukshan,
 Indra, Âyu, or the Maruts,
 When we declare amid the congregation the virtues of the
 Strong Steed, God-descended.
meaning: मा नो॑ मि॒त्रो वरु॑णो अर्य॒मायुरिन्द्र॑ ऋभु॒क्षा म॒रुतः॒ परि॑ ख्यन् । यद्वा॒जिनो॑ दे॒वजा॑तस्य॒ सप्तेः॑ प्रव॒क्ष्यामो॑ वि॒दथे॑ वी॒र्या॑णि ।।

text:
What time they bear before the Courser, covered with
 trappings and with wealth, the grasped oblation,
 The dappled goat goeth straightforward, bleating, to the
 place dear to Indra and to Pûshan.
meaning: यन्नि॒र्णिजा॒ रेक्ण॑सा॒ प्रावृ॑तस्य रा॒तिं गृ॑भी॒तां मु॑ख॒तो नय॑न्ति । सुप्रा॑ङ॒जो मेम्य॑द्वि॒श्वरू॑प इन्द्रापू॒ष्णोः प्रि॒यमप्ये॑ति॒ पाथः॑ ।।

text:
Dear to all Gods, this goat, the share of Pûshan, is first led
 forward with the vigorous Courser,
 While Tvashtar sends him forward with the Charger, acceptable
 for sacrifice, to glory.
meaning: ए॒ष छागः॑ पु॒रो अश्वे॑न वा॒जिना॑ पू॒ष्णो भा॒गो नी॑यते वि॒श्वदे॑व्यः । अ॑भि॒प्रियं॒ यत्पु॑रो॒डाश॒मर्व॑ता॒ त्वष्टेदे॑नँ सौश्रव॒साय॑ जिन्वति ।।

text:
When thrice the men lead round the Steed, in order, who
 goeth to the Gods as meet oblation,
 The goat precedeth him, the share of Pûshan, and to the
 Gods the sacrifice announceth.
meaning: यद्ध॑वि॒ष्य॑मृतु॒शो दे॑व॒यानं॒ त्रिर्मानु॑षाः॒ पर्यश्वं॒ नय॑न्ति । अत्रा॑ पू॒ष्णः प्र॑थ॒मो भा॒ग ए॑ति य॒ज्ञं दे॒वेभ्यः॑ प्रतिवे॒दय॑न्न॒जः ।।

text:
Invoker, ministering priest, stoner, fire-kindler, Soma-presser,
 sage, reciter,
 With this well ordered sacrifice, well finished, do ye fill full
 the channels of the rivers.
meaning: होता॑ध्व॒र्युराव॑या अग्निमि॒न्धो ग्रा॑वग्रा॒भ उ॒त शँस्ता॒ सुवि॑प्रः । तेन॑ य॒ज्ञेन॒ स्व॑रंकृतेन॒ स्वि॑ष्टेन व॒क्षणा॒ आ पृ॑णध्वम् ।।

text:
The hewers of the post and those who carry it, and those
 who carve the knob to deck the Horse's stake;
 Those who prepare the cooking-vessels for the Steed,—may
 the approving help of these promote our work.
meaning: यू॑पव्र॒स्का उ॒त ये यू॑पवा॒हाश्च॒षालं॒ ये अ॑श्वयू॒पाय॒ तक्ष॑ति । ये चार्व॑ते॒ पच॑नँ स॒म्भर॑न्त्यु॒तो तेषा॑म॒भिगू॑र्तिर्न इन्वतु ।।

text:
Forth, for the regions of the Gods, the Charger with his
 smooth back is come; my prayer attends him.
 In him rejoice the singer and the sages. A good friend
 have we won for the Gods’ banquet.
meaning: उप॒ प्रागा॑त्सु॒मन्मे॑ धायि॒ मन्म॑ दे॒वाना॒मा शाउप॑ वी॒तपृ॑ष्ठः । अन्वे॑नं॒ विप्रा॒ ऋष॑यो मदन्ति दे॒वानां॑ पु॒ष्टे च॑कृमा सु॒बन्धु॑म् ।।

text:
May the fleet Courser's halter and his heel-ropes, the headstall
 and the girths and cords about him,
 And the grass put within his mouth to bait him,—among
 the Gods, too, let all these be with thee.
meaning: यद्वा॒जिनो॒ दाम॑ सं॒दान॒मर्व॑तो॒ या शी॑र्ष॒ण्या॑ रश॒ना रज्जु॑रस्य । यद्वा॑ घास्य॒ प्रभृ॑तमा॒स्ये॒ तृणँ॒ सर्वा॒ ता ते॒ अपि॑ दे॒वेष्व॑स्तु ।।

text:
What part of the Steed's flesh the fly hath eaten, or is left
 sticking to the post or hatchet,
 Or to the slayer's hands and nails adhereth,—among the
 Gods, tog, may all this he with thee.
meaning: यदश्व॑स्य क्र॒विषो॒ मक्षि॒काश॒ यद्वा॒ स्वरौ॒ स्वधि॑तौ रि॒प्तमस्ति॑ । यद्धस्त॑योः शमि॒तुर्यन्न॒खेषु॒ सर्वा॒ ता ते॒ अपि॑ दे॒वेष्व॑स्तु ।।

text:
Food undigested steaming from his belly, and any odour of
 raw flesh remaining,
 This let the immolators set in order and dress the sacrifice
 with perfect cooking.
meaning: यदूव॑ध्यमु॒दर॑स्याप॒वाति॒ य आ॒मस्य॑ क्र॒विषो॑ ग॒न्धो अस्ति॑ । सु॑कृ॒ता तच्छ॑मि॒तारः॑ कृण्वन्तू॒त मेधँ॑ शृत॒पाकं॑ पचन्तु ।।

text:
What from thy body which with fire is roasted, when thou
 art set upon the spit, distilleth,—
 Let not that lie on earth or grass neglected, but to the longing
 Gods let all be offered.
meaning: यत्ते॒ गात्रा॑द॒ग्निना॑ प॒च्यमा॑नाद॒भि शूलं॒ निह॑तस्याव॒धाव॑ति । मा तद्भूम्या॒मा श्रि॑ष॒न्मा तृणे॑षु दे॒वेभ्य॒स्तदु॒शद्भ्यो॑ रा॒तम॑स्तु ।।

text:
They who, observing that the Horse is ready, call out and
 say, The smell is good; remove it;
 And, craving meat, await the distribution,—may their
 approving help promote our labour.
meaning: ये वा॒जिनं॑ परि॒पश्य॑न्ति प॒क्वं य ई॑मा॒हुः सु॑र॒भिर्निर्ह॒रेति॑ । ये चार्व॑तो माँसभि॒क्षामु॒पास॑त उ॒तो तेषा॑म॒भिगू॑र्तिर्न इन्वतु ।।

text:
The trial-fork of the flesh cooking caldron, the vessels out
 of which the broth is sprinkled,
 The warming-pots, the covers of the dishes, hooks,
 carving-boards,—all these attend the Charger.
meaning: यन्नीक्ष॑णं माँ॒स्पच॑न्या उ॒खाया॒ या पात्रा॑णि यू॒ष्ण आ॒सेच॑नानि । ऊ॑ष्म॒ण्या॑पि॒धाना॑ चरू॒णाम॒ङ्काः सू॒नाः परि॑ भूष॒न्त्यश्व॑म् ।।

text:
Let not the fire, smoke-scented, make thee crackle, nor
 glowing caldron smell and break to pieces.
 Offered, beloved, approved, and consecrated,—such Charger
 do the Gods accept with favour.
meaning: मा त्वा॒ग्निर्ध्व॑नयीद्धू॒मग॑न्धि॒र्मोखा भ्राज॑न्त्य॒भि वि॑क्त॒ जघ्रिः॑ । इ॒ष्टं वी॒तम॒भिगू॑र्तं॒ वष॑ट्कृतं॒ तं दे॒वासः॒ प्रति॑ गृभ्ण॒न्त्यश्व॑म् ।।

text:
The starting-place, his place of rest and rolling, the ropes
 wherewith the Charger's feet were fastened,
 The water that he drank, the food he tasted,—among the
 Gods, too, may all these attend thee.
meaning: नि॒क्रम॑णं नि॒षद॑नं वि॒वर्त॑नं॒ यच्च॒ पड्वी॑श॒मर्व॑तः । यच्च॑ पपौ॒ यच्च॑ घा॒सिं ज॒घास॒ सर्वा॒ ता ते॒ अपि॑ दे॒वेष्व॑स्तु ।।

text:
The robe they spread upon the Horse to clothe him, the
 upper covering and the golden trappings,
 The halters which restrain the Steed, the heel-ropes,—all
 these, as grateful to the Gods, they offer.
meaning: यदश्वा॑य॒ वास॑ उपस्तृ॒णन्त्य॑धीवा॒सं या हिर॑ण्यान्यस्मै । सं॒दान॒मर्व॑न्तं॒ पड्वी॑शं प्रि॒या दे॒वेष्वा या॑मयन्ति ।।

text:
If one, when seated, with excessive urging hath with his
 heel or with his whip distressed thee,
 All these thy woes, as with oblation's ladle at sacrifices,
 with my prayer I banish.
meaning: यत्ते॑ सा॒दे मह॑सा॒ शूकृ॑तस्य॒ पार्ष्ण्या॑ वा॒ कश॑या वा तु॒तोद॑ । स्रु॒चेव॒ ता ह॒विषो॑ अध्व॒रेषु॒ सर्वा॒ ता ते॒ ब्रह्म॑णा सूदयामि ।।

text:
The four-and-thirty ribs of the swift Courser, kin to the
 Gods, the slayer's hatchet pierces.

Cut ye with skill so that the parts be flawless, and piece by
 piece declaring them dissect them.
meaning: चतु॑स्त्रिँशद्वा॒जिनो॑ दे॒वब॑न्धो॒र्वङ्क्री॒रश्व॑स्य॒ स्वधि॑तिः॒ समे॑ति । अच्छि॑द्रा॒ गात्रा॑ व॒युना॑ कृणोत॒ परु॑ष्परुरनु॒घुष्या॒ वि श॑स्त ।।

text:
Of Tvashtar's Courser there is one dissector: this is the
 custom: two there are who guide him.
 Such of his limbs as I divide in order, all these, amid the
 lumps, in fire I offer.
meaning: एक॒स्त्वष्टु॒रश्व॑स्या विश॒स्ता द्वा य॒न्तारा॑ भवत॒स्तथ॑ ऋ॒तुः । या ते॒ गात्रा॑णामृतु॒था कृ॒णोमि॒ ताता॒ पिण्डा॑नां॒ प्र जु॑होम्यग्नौ ।।

text:
Let not thy dear soul burn thee as thou comest, let not the
 hatchet linger in thy body.
 Let not a greedy clumsy immolator, missing the joints,
 mangle thy limbs unduly.
meaning: मा त्वा॑ तपत्प्रि॒य आ॒त्मापि॒यन्तं॒ मा स्वधि॑तिस्त॒न्व॒ आ ति॑ष्ठिपत्ते । मा ते॑ गृ॒ध्नुर॑विश॒स्ताति॒हाय॑ छि॒द्रा गात्रा॑ण्य॒सिना॒ मिथू॑ कः ।।

text:
No, here thou diest not, thou art not injured: only by easy
 paths to Gods thou goest.
 Both Bays, both Spotted Mares are now thy fellows, and to
 the Ass's pole is yoked the Courser.
meaning: न वा उ॑ ए॒तन्म्रि॑यसे॒ न रि॑ष्यसि दे॒वाँ इदे॑षि प॒थिभिः॑ सु॒गेभिः॑ । हरी॑ ते॒ युञ्जा॒ पृष॑ती अभूता॒मुपा॑स्थाद्वा॒जी धु॒रि रास॑भस्य ।।

text:
May this Steed bring us all-sustaining riches, wealth in
 good kine, good horses, manly offspring.
 Freedom from sin may Aditi vouchsafe us; the Steed with
 our oblations gain us lordship!
meaning: सु॒गव्यं॑ नो वा॒जी स्वश्व्यं॑ पुँ॒सः पु॒त्राँ उ॒त वि॑श्वा॒पुषँ॑ र॒यिम् । अ॑नागा॒स्त्वं नो॒ अदि॑तिः कृणोतु क्ष॒त्रं नो॒ अश्वो॑ वनताँ ह॒विष्मा॑न् ।।

text:
We will, with Indra and all Gods to help us, bring these
 existing worlds into subjection.
 With the Âdityas, with the band of Maruts, may Indra
 give us medicine to heal us.
 Our sacrifice, our bodies, and our offspring may Indra
 regulate with the Âdityas.
meaning: इ॒मा नु कं॒ भुव॑ना सीषधा॒मेन्द्र॑श्च॒ विश्वे॑ च दे॒वाः । आ॑दित्यै॒रिद्न्रः॒ सग॑णो म॒रुद्भि॑र॒स्मभ्यं॑ भेष॒जा क॑रत् । य॒ज्ञं च॑ नस्त॒न्वं॑ च प्र॒जां चा॑दित्यै॒रिन्द्रः॑ स॒ह सी॑षधाति ।।

text:
O Agni, be our nearest Friend, etc., as in III. 25.
 To thee then, O Most Bright, etc., as in III. 26.
meaning: अग्ने॒ त्वं नो॒ अन्त॑म उ॒त त्रा॒ता शि॒वो भ॑व वरू॒थ्यः॑ । वसु॑र॒ग्निर्वसु॑श्रवा॒ अच्छा॑ नक्षि द्यु॒मत्त॑मँ र॒यिं दाः॑ । तं त्वा॑ शोचिष्ठ दीदिवः सु॒म्नाय॑ नू॒नमी॑महे॒ सखि॑भ्यः ।।

text:
-SIXTH.

AGNI and Prithivî, closely connected, may they bring low for
 me the boon I mention.
 Vâyu and Firmament, closely connected, may they, etc.
 Closely connected Dyaus and the Âditya, may they, etc.
 Closely connected Varuna and Waters, may they, etc.
 Lord of the seven communities and her who forms all beings,
 eighth,
 Make our ways full of pleasantness: may So-and-So and I
 agree.
meaning: अ॒ग्निश्च॑ पृथि॒वी च॒ संन॑ते॒ ते मे॒ सं न॑मताम॒दः । वा॒युश्चा॒न्तरि॑क्षं च॒ संन॑ते॒ ते मे॒ सं न॑मताम॒दः । आ॑दि॒त्यश्च द्यौश्च॒ संन॑ते॒ ते मे॒ सं न॑मताम॒दः । आप॑श्च॒ वरु॑णश्च॒ संन॑ते॒ ते मे॒ सं न॑मताम॒दः । स॒प्त सँ॒सदो॑ अष्ट॒मी भू॑त॒साध॑नी । सका॑माँ॒ अध्व॑नस्कुरु सं॒ज्ञान॑मस्तु मे॒ मुना॑ ।।

text:
That I to all the people may address this salutary speech,
 To priest and nobleman, Sûdra and Arya, to one of our own
 kin and to the stranger.
 Dear may I be to Gods and guerdon-giver. Fulfilled be this
 my hope: be that my portion!
meaning: यथे॒मां वाचं॑ कल्या॒णीमा॒वदा॑नि॒ जने॑भ्यः । ब्र॑ह्मराज॒न्या॑भ्याँ शू॒द्राय॒ चार्या॑य च॒ स्वाय॒ चार॑णाय । प्रि॒यो दे॒वानां॒ दक्षि॑णायै दा॒तुरि॒ह भू॑यासम॒यं मे॒ कामः॒ समृ॑ध्यता॒मुप॑ मा॒दो न॑मतु ।।

text:
Give us, Brihaspati, that wondrous treasure, that which
 exceeds the merit of the foeman,
 Which shines among the folk effectual, splendid, that, Son
 of Law, which is with might refulgent.
 Taken upon a base art thou. Thee for Brihaspati. This is
 thy home. Thee for Brihaspati,
meaning: बृह॑स्पते॒ अति॒ यद॒र्यो अर्हा॑द्द्यु॒मद्वि॒भाति॒ क्रतु॑म॒ज्जने॑षु । यद्दी॒दय॒च्छव॑स ऋतप्रजात॒ तद॒स्मासु॒ द्रवि॑णं धेहि चि॒त्रम् । उ॑पया॒मगृ॑हीतो सि॒ बृह॒स्पत॑ये त्वा । ए॒ष ते॒ योनि॒र्बृह॒स्पत॑ये त्वा ।।

text:
Come hither, Indra, rich in kine! Drink Soma, Lord of
 Hundred Powers,
 Effused by braying pressing-stones.
 Taken upon a base art thou. Thee for Indra, rich in kine.
 This is thy home. Thee for Indra, rich in kine.
meaning: इन्द्र॒ गोम॑न्नि॒हा या॑हि॒ पिबा॒ सोमँ॑ शतक्रतो । वि॒द्यद्भि॒र्ग्राव॑भिः सु॒तम् । उ॑पया॒मगृ॑हीतो॒ सीन्द्रा॑य त्वा॒ गोम॑ते । ए॒ष ते॒ योनि॒रिन्द्रा॑य त्वा॒ गोम॑ते ।।

text:
O Indra, Vritra-slayer, come. Drink Soma, Lord of
 Hundred Powers,
 Expressed with stones whose wealth is kine.
 Taken upon a base art thou, etc., as in verse 4.
meaning: इन्द्रा या॑हि वृत्रह॒न्पिबा॒ सोमँ॑ शतक्रतो । गोम॑द्भि॒र्ग्राव॑भिः सु॒तम् । उ॑पया॒मगृ॑हीतो॒ सीन्द्रा॑य त्वा॒ गोम॑ते । ए॒ष ते॒ योनि॒रिन्द्रा॑य त्वा॒ गोम॑ते ।।

text:
Vaisvânara the righteous One, the Lord of sacrifice and light,
 The heat that wasteth not, we seek.
 Taken upon a base art thou. Thee for Vaisvânara.
 This is thy home: thee for Vaisvânara.
meaning: ऋ॒तावा॑नं वैश्वान॒रमृ॒तस्य॒ ज्योति॑ष॒स्पति॑म् । अज॑स्रं घ॒र्ममी॑महे । उ॑पया॒मगृ॑हीतो सि वैश्वानराय त्वा । ए॒ष ते॒ योनि॑र्वैश्वानराय त्वा ।।

text:
Still in Vaisvânara's grace may we continue: yea, he is
 King Supreme o’er all things living.
 Sprung hence to life upon this All he looketh. Vaisvânara
 hath rivalry with Sûrya.
 Taken upon a base art thou, etc., as in verse 6.
meaning: वै॑श्वान॒रस्य॑ सुमतौ स्याम॒ राजा॒ हि कं॒ भुव॑नानामभि॒श्रीः । इ॒तो जा॒तो विश्व॑मि॒दं वि च॑ष्टे वैश्वान॒रो य॑तते॒ सूर्ये॑ण । उ॑पया॒मगृ॑हीतो सि वैश्वानराय त्वा । ए॒ष ते॒ योनि॑र्वैश्वानराय त्वा ।।

text:
Hitherward come Vaisvânara to succour us from far away,
 Agni through laud that brings him near!
 Taken upon a base, etc, as in verse 6.
meaning: वै॑श्वान॒रो न ऊ॒तय॒ आ प्र या॑तु परा॒वतः॑ । अ॒ग्निरु॒क्थेन॒ वाह॑सा । उ॑पया॒मगृ॑हीतो सि वैश्वानराय त्वा । ए॒ष ते॒ योनि॑र्वैश्वानराय त्वा ।।

text:
Agni is Pavamâna, Sage, the Tribe-Priest of the Races Five:
 To him of mighty wealth we pray.
 Taken upon a base art thou. Thee for lustre. This is thy
 home. Thee for lustre.
meaning: अ॒ग्निरृषिः॒ पव॑मानः॒ पाञ्च॑जन्यः पु॒रोहि॑तः । तमी॑महे महाग॒यम् । उ॑पया॒मगृ॑हीतो स्य॒ग्नये॑ त्वा॒ वर्च॑से । ए॒ष ते॒ योनि॑र॒ग्नये॑ त्वा॒ वर्च॑से ।।

text:
May mighty Indra, thunder-armed, may Shodasî protect us
 well, and slay the wicked man who hateth us.
 Taken upon a base art thou. Thee for Mahendra. This is
 thy home. Thee for Mahendra.
meaning: म॒हाँ इन्द्रो॒ वज्र॑हस्तः षोड॒शी शर्म॑ यच्छतु । हन्तु॑ पा॒प्मानं॒ यो॒ स्मान्द्वेष्टि॑ । उ॑पया॒मगृ॑हीतो सि महे॒न्द्राय॑ त्वा । ए॒ष ते॒ योनि॑र्महे॒न्द्राय॑ त्वा ।।

text:
As cows low to their calves in stalls so with our songs we
 glorify
 This Indra, e’en your wondrous God who checks assault,
 who joys in the delicious juice.
meaning: तं वो॑ द॒स्ममृ॑ती॒षहं॒ वसो॑र्मन्दा॒नमन्ध॑सः । अ॒भि व॒त्सं न स्वस॑रेषु धे॒नव॒ इन्द्रं॑ गी॒र्भिर्न॑वामहे ।।

text:
Agni's is the most fetching song. Shine mightily, thou rich
 in light!
 Like the Chief Consort of a King, riches and strength proceed
 from thee.
meaning: यद्वाहि॑ष्ठं॒ तद॒ग्नये॑ बृ॒हद॑र्च विभावसो । महि॑षीव॒ त्वद्र॒यिस्त्वद्वाजा॒ उदी॑रते ।।

text:
Come, here, O Agni, will I sing verily other songs to thee,
 And with these drops shalt thou grow strong.
meaning: एह्यू॒ षु ब्रवा॑णि॒ ते ग्न॑ इ॒त्थेत॑रा॒ गिरः॑ । ए॒भिर्व॑र्धास॒ इन्दु॑भिः ।।

text:
The Seasons spread thy sacrifice! the Mouths protect thine
 offering!
 May the Year guard our sacrifice for thee and keep our children
 safe.
meaning: ऋ॒तव॑स्ते य॒ज्ञं वि त॑न्वन्तु॒ मासा॒ रक्ष॑न्तु ते॒ हविः॑ । सं॑वत्स॒रस्ते॑ य॒ज्ञं द॑धातु नः प्र॒जां च॒ परि॑ पातु नः ।।

text:
There where the mountains downward slope, there by the
 meeting of the streams
 The sage was manifest with song.
meaning: उ॑पह्व॒रे गि॑री॒णाँ सं॑ग॒मे च॑ नदी॒नाम् । धि॒या विप्रो॑ अजायत ।।

text:
High is thy juice's birth: though sat in heaven, on earth it
 hath obtained
 Strong sheltering power and great renown.
meaning: उ॒च्चा ते॑ जा॒तमन्ध॑सो दि॒वि सद्भूम्या द॑दे । उ॒ग्रँ शर्म॒ महि॒ श्रवः॑ ।।

text:
Finder of room and freedom, flow for Indra, meet for worship,
 flow
 For Varuna and the Marut host.
meaning: स न॒ इन्द्रा॑य॒ यज्य॑वे॒ वरु॑णाय म॒रुद्भ्यः॑ । व॑रिवो॒वित्परि॑ स्रव ।।

text:
Striving to win, with him we gain all wealth of the ungodly
 one,
 Yea, all the glories of mankind.
meaning: ए॒ना विश्वा॑न्य॒र्य आ द्यु॒म्नानि॒ मानु॑षाणाम् । सिषा॑सन्तो वनामहे ।।

text:
May we be prosperous with brave sons, cattle, horses, each
 wish of ours, and varied blessings,
 With quadrupeds, and with the men about us. May the
 Gods guide our sacrifice in season.
meaning: अनु॑ वीरै॒रनु॑ पुष्यास्म॒ गोभि॒रन्वश्वै॒रनु॒ सर्वे॑ण पुष्टैः । अनु॒ द्विप॒दानु॒ चतु॑ष्पदा व॒यं दे॒वा नो॑ य॒ज्ञमृ॑तु॒था न॑यन्तु ।।

text:
O Agni, bring thou hitherward the yearning Consorts of the
 Gods
 Bring Tvashtar to the Soma-draught.
meaning: अग्ने॒ पत्नी॑रि॒हा व॑ह दे॒वाना॑मुश॒तीरुप॑ । त्वष्टा॑रँ॒ सोम॑पीतये ।।

text:
O Neshtar girt by Dames, accept our sacrifice: with Ritu
 drink,
 For thou art he who giveth wealth.
meaning: अ॒भि य॒ज्ञं गृ॑णीहि नो॒ ग्नावो॒ नेष्टः॒ पिब॑ ऋ॒तुना॑ । त्वँ हि र॑त्न॒धा असि॑ ।।

text:
He with the Ritus fain would drink, Wealth-river, from the
 Neshtar's bowl.
 Begin, pay offerings: hasten ye.
meaning: द्र॑विणो॒दाः पि॑पीषति जु॒होत॒ प्र च॑ तिष्ठत । ने॒ष्ट्रादृ॒तुभि॑रिष्यत ।।

text:
Thine is this Soma: come thou near, approach it. Drink
 thou thereof, benevolent, and cease not.
 Sit on the sacred grass at this our worship, and take these
 drops into thy belly, Indra.
meaning: तवा॒यँ सोम॒स्त्वमेह्य॒र्वाङ्छ॑श्वत्त॒मँ सु॒मना॑ अ॒स्य पा॑हि । अ॒स्मिन्य॒ज्ञे ब॒र्हिष्या नि॒षद्या॑ दधि॒ष्वेमं ज॒ठर॒ इन्दु॑मिन्द्र ।।

text:
Come unto us, ye swift to listen! as at home, upon the
 sacred grass sit and enjoy yourselves.
 And, Tvashtar, well content be joyful in the juice with Gods
 and Goddesses in gladsome company.
meaning: अ॒मेव॑ नः सुहवा॒ आ हि गन्त॑न॒ नि ब॒र्हिषि॑ सदतना॒ रणि॑ष्टन । अथा॑ मन्दस्व जुजुषा॒णो अन्ध॑स॒स्त्वष्ट॑र्दे॒वेभि॒र्जनि॑भिः सु॒मद्ग॑णः ।।

text:
In sweetest and most gladdening stream flow pure, O Soma,
 on thy way,
 Pressed out for Indra, for his drink.
meaning: स्वादि॑ष्ठया॒ मदि॑ष्ठया॒ पव॑स्व सोम॒ धार॑या । इन्द्रा॑य॒ पात॑वे सु॒तः ।।

text:
Fiend-queller, Friend of all men, he hath in the vat attained
 unto
 His place, his iron-fashioned home.
meaning: र॑क्षो॒हा वि॒श्वच॑र्षणिर॒भि योनि॒मयो॑हतम् । द्रुणा॑ स॒धस्थ॒मास॑दत् ।।

text:
-SEVENTH

HALF-YEARS and Seasons strengthen thee, O Agni, the Years
 and all the Verities and Rishis!
 Flash forth with thy celestial effulgence: illumine all four
 regions of the heaven.
meaning: सा॑स्त्वाग्न ऋ॒तवो॑ वर्धयन्तु संवत्स॒रा ऋष॑यो॒ यानि॑ स॒त्या । सं दि॒व्येन॑ दीदिहि रोच॒नेन॒ विश्वा॒ आ भा॑हि प्र॒दिश॒श्चत॑स्रः ।।

text:
Kindle thee, Agni, rake this man to knowledge: rise up
 erect for great and happy fortune.
 Agni, be those uninjured who adore thee, thy priests be
 glorious and none beside them!
meaning: सं चे॒ध्यस्वा॑ग्ने॒ प्र च॑ बोधयैन॒मुच्च॑ तिष्ठ मह॒ते सौ॑भगाय । मा च॑ रिषदुपस॒त्ता ते॑ अग्ने ब्र॒ह्माण॑स्ते य॒शसः॑ सन्तु॒ मान्ये ।।

text:
The Brahmans present here elect thee, Agni: be thou
 propitious in our sanctuary.
 Slayer of rivals, Agni, quell our foemen: watch in thy house
 with care that never ceases.
meaning: त्वाम॑ग्ने वृणते ब्राह्म॒णा इ॒मे शि॒वो अ॑ग्ने सं॒वर॑णे भवा नः । स॑पत्न॒हा नो॑ अभिमाति॒जिच्च॒ स्वे गये॑ गागृ॒ह्यप्र॑युच्छन् ।।

text:
Even here do thou, O Agni, stablish wealth: let not oppressors
 injure thee by thinking of thee first.
 Light be thy task of ruling, Agni, with thy power: may he
 who worships thee wax strong, invincible.
meaning: इहै॒वाग्ने॒ अधि॑ धारया र॒यिं मा त्वा॒ नि क्र॑न्पूर्व॒चितो॑ निका॒रिणः॑ । क्ष॒त्रम॑ग्ने सु॒यम॑मस्तु॒ तुभ्य॑मुपस॒त्ता व॑र्धतां ते॒ अनि॑ष्टृतः ।।

text:
Kind to the people, grasp thy power, O Agni: contend thou
 with the Friend by way of friendship.
 Placed, Agni, in the centre of our kinsmen, flash forth to be
 invoked by Kings around thee.
meaning: क्ष॒त्रेणा॑ग्ने॒ स्वायुः॒ सँ र॑भस्व मि॒त्रेणा॑ग्ने मित्र॒धेये॑ यतस्व । स॑जा॒तानां॑ मध्यम॒स्था ए॑धि॒ राज्ञा॑मग्ने विह॒व्यो॑ दीदिही॒ह ।।

text:
Past those who slay, past enemies, past thoughtless men,
 past those who hate,—
 Yes, Agni, drive away all woe and trouble: vouchsafe us
 opulence with men about us.
meaning: अति॒ निहो॒ अति॒ स्रिधो त्यचि॑त्ति॒मत्यरा॑तिमग्ने । विश्वा॒ ह्य॑ग्ने दुरि॒ता स॑ह॒स्वाथा॒स्मभ्यँ॑ स॒हवी॑राँ र॒यिं दाः॑ ।।

text:
Holder of sway, shine here refulgent, Agni! invincible,
 unconquered Jâtavedas.
 Light all the regions, chasing human terrors: with happy
 helps guard us to-day for increase.
meaning: अ॑नाधृ॒ष्यो जा॒तवे॑दा॒ अना॑धृष्टो वि॒राडग्ने॑ क्षत्र॒भृद्दी॑दिही॒ह । विश्वा॒ आशाः॑ प्रमु॒ञ्चन्मानु॑षीर्भ॒यः शि॒वेभि॑र॒द्य परि॑ पाहि नो वृ॒धे ।।

text:
Brihaspati, Savitar, give this man knowledge: sharpen him
 thoroughly though already sharpened.
 To great and high felicity exalt him: in him let all the Gods
 rejoice and triumph.
meaning: बृह॑स्पते सवितर्बो॒धयै॑नँ॒ सँशि॑तं चित्संत॒राँ सँ शि॑शाधि । व॒र्धयै॑नं मह॒ते सौ॑भगाय॒ विश्व॑ एन॒मनु॑ मदन्तु दे॒वाः ।।

text:
As thou, Brihaspati, from curse hast freed us, from dwelling
 yonder in the realm of Yama,
 The Asvins, Leeches of the Gods, O Agni, have chased Death
 far from us with mighty powers.
meaning: अ॑मुत्र॒भूया॒दध॒ यद्य॒मस्य॒ बृह॑स्पते अ॒भिस॑स्ते॒रमु॑ञ्चः । प्रत्औ॑हताम॒श्विना॑ मृ॒त्युम॑स्माद्दे॒वाना॑मग्ने भि॒षजा॒ शची॑भिः ।।

text: Looking upon the loftier light, etc., as in XX. 21.
meaning: उद्व॒यं तम॑स॒स्परि॒ स्वः॒ पश्य॑न्त॒ उत्त॑रम् । दे॒वं दे॑व॒त्रा सूर्य॒मग॑न्म॒ ज्योति॑रुत्त॒मम् ।।

text:
Uplifted are the brands that are his fuel: lofty and brilliant
 are the flames of Agni,
 Splendidly bright of the Son fair of aspect.
meaning: ऊ॒र्ध्वा अ॑स्य स॒मिधो॑ भवन्त्यू॒र्ध्वा शु॒क्रा शो॒चीँष्य॒ग्नेः । द्यु॒मत्त॑मा सु॒प्रती॑कस्य सू॒नोः ।।

text:
Tanûnapât the Asura, all-possessing, God among Gods, the
 God with mead and butter shall bedew the paths.
meaning: तनू॒नपा॒दसु॑रो वि॒श्ववे॑दा दे॒वो दे॒वेषु॑ दे॒वः । प॒थो अ॑नक्तु॒ मध्वा॑ घृ॒तेन॑ ।।

text:
With mead to sacrifice thou comest, Agni, earnest as friendly-
 minded Narâsamsa, and Savitar righteous God who brings
 all blessings.
meaning: मध्वा॑ य॒ज्ञं न॑क्षसे प्रीणा॒नो नरा॒शँसो॑ अग्ने । सु॒कृद्दे॒वः स॑वि॒ता वि॒श्ववा॑रः ।।

text:
He cometh hitherward with power and fatness, the luminous,
 implored with adoration.
 While rites proceed the ladles move to Agni.
meaning: अच्छा॒यमे॑ति॒ शव॑सा घृ॒तेने॑डा॒नो वह्नि॒र्नम॑सा । अ॒ग्निँ स्रुचो॑ अध्व॒रेषु॑ प्र॒यत्सु॑ ।।

text:
Let him pay worship to this Agni's greatness, daintily fed:
 he verily gives enjoyments:
 The wisest Vasu he, and best wealth giver.
meaning: स य॑क्षदस्य महि॒मान॑म॒ग्नेः स ईं॑ म॒न्द्रा सु॑प्र॒यसः॑ । वसु॒श्वेति॑ष्ठो वसु॒धात॑मश्च ।।

text:
Widely expansive, ruling by foundation, the Doors divine—
 and, after, all—
 Preserve this Agni's holy works.
meaning: द्वारो॑ दे॒वीरन्व॑स्य॒ विश्वे॑ व्र॒ता द॑दन्ते अ॒ग्नेः । उ॑रु॒व्यच॑सो॒ धाम्ना॒ पत्य॑मानाः ।।

text:
May Dawn and Night protect—his heavenly Consorts—in
 a his home this our sacrificial worship.
meaning: ते अ॑स्य॒ योष॑णे दि॒व्ये न योना॑ उ॒षासा॒नक्ता॑ । इ॒मं य॒ज्ञमव॑तामध्व॒रं नः॑ ।।

text:
Ye two celestial Hotars, greet with praises this lofty rite of
 ours, the tongue of Agni.
 Cause that our sacrifice be well conducted.
meaning: दै॑व्या॒ होता॑रा ऊ॒र्ध्वम॑ध्व॒रं नो॒ ग्नेर्जु॒ह्वाम॒भि गृ॑णीतम् । कृ॑णु॒तम्नः॒ स्वि॑ष्टम् ।।

text:
Upon this grass three Goddesses be seated, Idâ, Sarasvatî,
 Bhâratî the Mighty glorified with song.
meaning: ति॒स्रो दे॒वीर्ब॒र्हिरि॒दँ स॑द॒न्त्विडा॒ सर॑स्वती॒ भार॑ती । म॒ही गृ॑णा॒ना ।।

text:
This our productive wondrous flow may Tvashtar pour down
 on this man's kin, and wealth and heroes.
meaning: तन्न॑स्तु॒रीप॒मद्भु॑तं पुरु॒क्षु त्वष्टा॑ सु॒वीर्य॑म् । रा॒यस्पोषं॒ वि ष्य॑तु॒ नाभि॑म॒स्मे ।।

text:
Vanaspatî, presenting of thyself, send God-ward! Let Agni,
 Immolator, season our oblation.
meaning: वन॑स्प॒ते व॑ सृजा॒ ररा॑ण॒स्त्मना॑ दे॒वेषु॑ । अ॒ग्निर्ह॒व्यँ श॑मि॒ता सू॑दयाति ।।

text:
Pay sacrifice to Indra, Jâtavedas Agni! with Hail! All Gods
 accept the gift we offer!
meaning: अग्ने॒ स्वाहा॑ कृणुहि जातवेदो॒ इन्द्रा॑य ह॒व्यम् । विश्वे॑ दे॒वा ह॒विरि॒दं जु॑षन्ताम् ।।

text:
Wise, bright, arranger of his teams, he seeketh men with
 rich food whose treasures are abundant.
 They have stood firm of one accord with Vâyu: yea, the
 men wrought all noble operations.
meaning: पीवोअ॑न्ना रयिं॒वृधः॑ सुमे॒धाः श्वे॒तः सि॑षक्ति नि॒युता॑मभि॒श्रीः । ते वा॒यवे॒ सम॑नसो॒ वि त॑स्थु॒र्विश्वेन्नरः॑ स्वप॒त्यानि॑ चक्रुः ।।

text:
The God whom both these worlds brought forth for riches,
 whom heavenly Dhishanâ for our wealth appointeth—
 His team of harnessed horses waits on Vâyu and, foremost,
 on the radiant treasure-holder.
meaning: रा॒ये नु यं ज॒ज्ञतू॒ रोद॑सी॒मे रा॒ये दे॒वी धि॒षणा॑ धाति दे॒वम् । अध॑ वा॒युं नि॒युतः॑ सश्चत॒ स्वा उ॒त श्वे॒तं वसु॑धितिं निरे॒के ।।

text:
What time the mighty waters came containing the universal
 germ, producing Agni,
 Thence sprang the Gods’ one spirit into being. What God
 shall we adore with our oblation?
meaning: आपो॑ ह॒ यद्बृ॑ह॒तीर्विश्व॒माय॒न्गर्भं॒ दधा॑ना ज॒नय॑न्तीर॒ग्निम् । ततो॑ दे॒वानाँ॒ सम॑वर्त॒तासु॒रेकः॒ कस्मै॑ दे॒वाय॑ ह॒विषा॑ विधेम ।।

text:
Who in his might surveyed the floods enclosing productive
 force and generating Worship,
 He who is God mid Gods, and none beside him—What God
 shall we adore with our oblation?
meaning: यश्चि॒दापो॑ महि॒ना प॒र्यप॑श्य॒द्दक्षं॒ दधा॑ना ज॒नय॑न्तीर्य॒ज्ञम् । यो दे॒वेष्वधि॑ दे॒व एक॒ आसी॒त्कस्मै॑ दे॒वाय॑ ह॒विषा॑ विधेम ।।

text:
The teams wherewith thou seekest him who offers, within
 his house, O Vâyu, to direct him,
 Therewith send wealth to us with full enjoyment, a hero son
 and gifts of kine and horses.
meaning: प्र याभि॒र्यासि॑ दा॒श्वाँस॒मच्छा॑ नि॒युद्भि॑र्वायवि॒ष्टये॑ दुरो॒णे । नि नो॑ र॒यिँ सु॒भोज॑सं युवस्व॒ नि वी॒रं गव्य॒मश्व्यं॑ च॒ राधः॑ ।।

text:
With thy yoked teams in hundreds and in thousands come
 to our sacrifice and solemn worship.
 O Vâyu, make thee glad at this libation. Preserve us evermore,
 ye Gods, with blessings.
meaning: आ नो॑ नि॒युद्भिः॑ श॒तिनी॑भिरध्व॒रँ स॑ह॒स्रिणी॑भि॒रुप॑ याहि य॒ज्ञम् । वायो॑ अ॒स्मिन्सव॑ने मादयस्व यू॒यं पा॑त स्व॒स्तिभिः॒ सदा॑ नः ।।

text:
Drawn by thy team, O Vâyu, come: to thee is offered this,
 the pure.
 Thou visitest the presser's house.
meaning: नि॒युत्वा॑न्वाय॒वा ग॑ह्य॒यँ शु॒क्रो अ॑यामि ते । गन्ता॑सि सुन्व॒तो गृ॒हम् ।।

text:
Vâyu, the bright is offered thee, best of the meath at holy
 rites.
 Come thou to drink the Soma juice, God longed-for, on thy
 team-drawn car.
meaning: वायो॑ शु॒क्रो अ॑यामि ते॒ मध्वो॒ अग्रं॒ दिवि॑ष्टिषु । आ या॑हि॒ सोम॑पीतये स्पा॒र्हो दे॑व नि॒युत्व॑ता ।।

text:
Lover of worship, leader, come Vâyu with thought, to sacrifice,
 Propitious with propitious teams!
meaning: वा॒युर॑ग्रे॒गा य॑ज्ञ॒प्रीः सा॒कं ग॒न्मन॑सा य॒ज्ञम् । शि॒वो नि॒युद्भिः॑ शि॒वाभिः॑ ।।

text:
With all the thousand chariots that are thine, O Vâyu, come
 to us,
 Team-drawn, to drink the Soma juice.
meaning: वायो॒ ये ते॑ सह॒स्रिणो॒ रथा॑स॒स्तेभि॒रा ग॑हि । नि॒युत्वा॒न्त्सोम॑पीतये ।।

text:
Come thou with one, and ten, O Self-Existent! with two
 unto the sacrifice, and twenty.
 Three are the teams and thirty which convey thee. O Vâyu,
 in this place unyoke thy coursers.
meaning: एक॑या च द॒शभि॑श्च स्वभूते॒ द्वाभ्या॑मि॒ष्टये॑ विँश॒ती च॑ । ति॒सृभि॑श्च॒ वह॑से त्रिँ॒शता॑ च नि॒युद्भि॑र्वायवि॒ह ता वि मु॑ञ्च ।।

text:
Wonderful Vâyu, Lord of Truth, thou who art Tvashtar's
 Son in-law,
 Thy saving succour we elect.
meaning: तव॑ वायवृतस्पते॒ त्वष्टु॑र्जामातरद्भुत । अवाँ॒स्या वृ॑णीमहे ।।

text:
Like kine unmilked we call aloud, Hero, to thee and sing
 thy praise,
 Looker on heavenly light, Lord of this moving world, Lord,
 Indra! of what moveth not.
meaning: अ॒भि त्वा॑ शूर नोनु॒मो दु॑ग्धा इव धे॒नवः॑ । ईशा॑नम॒स्य जग॑तः स्व॒र्दृश॒मीशा॑नमिन्द्र त॒स्थुषः॑ ।।

text:
None other like to thee, of earth or of the heavens, hath
 been or ever will be born.
 Desiring horses, Indra, Bounteous Lord! and kine, as men
 of might we call on thee.
meaning: न त्वावाँ॑ अ॒न्यो दि॒व्यो न पार्थि॑वो॒ न जा॒तो न ज॑निष्यते । अ॑श्वा॒यन्तो॑ मघवन्निन्द्र वा॒जिनो॑ ग॒व्यन्त॑स्त्वा हवामहे ।।

text:
That we may win us wealth and power, we poets call on
 only thee.
 In war men call on thee, Indra! the hero's Lord, in the
 steed's race-course call on thee.
meaning: त्वामिद्धि हवा॑महे सा॒ता वाज॑स्य का॒रवः॑ । त्वां वृ॒त्रेष्वि॑न्द्र॒ सत्प॑तिं॒ नर॒स्त्वां काष्ठा॒स्वर्व॑तः ।।

text:
As such, O Wonderful, whose hand holds thunder, praised
 as mighty, Caster of the Stone!

Pour on us boldly, Indra, kine and chariot-steeds ever to be
 the conqueror's strength.
meaning: स त्वं न॑श्चित्र वज्रहस्त धृष्णु॒या म॒ह स्त॑वा॒नो अ॑द्रिवः । गामश्वँ॑ र॒थ्य॑मिन्द्र॒ सं कि॑र स॒त्रा वाजं॒ न जि॒ग्युषे॑ ।।

text:
What succour will he bring to us, wonderful, ever-prospering
 Friend?
 With what most mighty company?
meaning: कया॑ नश्चि॒त्र आ भु॑वदू॒ती स॒दावृ॑धः॒ सखा॑ । कया॒ शचि॑ष्ठया वृ॒ता ।।

text:
What, genuine and most liberal draught will spirit thee with
 juice to burst
 Open e’en strongly-guarded wealth
meaning: कस्त्वा॑ स॒त्यो मदा॑नां॒ मँहि॑ष्ठो मत्स॒दन्ध॑सः । दृ॒ढा चि॑दा॒रुजे॒ वसु॑ ।।

text:
Do thou who art protector of us thy friends who praise thee
 With hundred aids approach us.
meaning: अ॒भी षु णः॒ सखी॑नामवि॒ता ज॑रितॄ॒णाम् । श॒तं भ॑वास्यू॒तये॑ ।।

text:
Sing to your Agni with each song, at every sacrifice, for
 strength.
 Come, let us praise the Wise and Everlasting God even as a
 well-belovèd Friend.
meaning: य॒ज्ञाय॑ज्ञा वो अ॒ग्नये॑ गि॒रागि॑रा च॒ दक्ष॑से । प्रप्र॑ व॒यम॒मृतं॑ जा॒तवे॑दसं प्रि॒यं मि॒त्रं न शँ॑सिषम् ।।

text:
Protect us, Agni, through the first, protect us through the
 second hymn.
 Protect us through three hymns, O Lord of Power and Might;
 through four hymns, Vasu! guard thou us.
meaning: पा॒हि नो॑ अग्न॒ एक॑या पा॒ह्यु॒त द्वि॒तीय॑या । पा॒हि गी॒र्भिस्ति॒सृभि॑रूर्जां पते पा॒हि च॑त॒सृभि॑र्वसो ।।

text:
The Son of Strength; for is he not our Friend? Let us serve
 him for offering our gifts.
 In battles may he be our help and strengthener, yea, be the
 saviour of our lives.
meaning: ऊ॒र्जो नपा॑तँ॒ स हि॒नायम॑स्म॒युर्दाशे॑म ह॒व्यदा॑तये । भुव॒द्वाजे॑ष्ववि॒ता भुव॑द्वृ॒ध उ॒त त्रा॒ता त॒नूना॑म् ।।

text:
Thou art Samvatsara; thou art Parivatsara; thou art
 Idâvatsara; thou art Idvatsara; thou art Vatsara.
 Prosper thy Dawns! Prosper thy Day-and-Nights! Prosper
 thy Half-months, Months, Seasons, and Years!
 Combine them for their going and their coming, and send
 then forward on their ordered courses.
 In eagle's shape thou art piled up and layered. With that
 divinity, Angiras-like, lie steady.
meaning: सं॑वत्स॒रो॑ सि परिवत्स॒रो॑ सीदावत्स॒रो॑ सीद्वत्स॒रो॑ सि वत्स॒रो॑ सि । उ॒षस॑स्ते कल्पन्तामहोरा॒त्रास्ते॑ कल्पन्तामर्धमा॒सास्ते॑ कल्पन्तां मा॒सास्ते॑ कल्पन्तामृ�॑स्ते कल्पन्ताँ संवत्स॒रस्ते॑ कल्पताम् । प्रेत्या॒ एत्यै॒ सं चाञ्च॒ प्र च॑ सारय । सु॑पर्ण॒चिद॑सि॒ तया॑ दे॒वत॑याङ्गिर॒स्वद्ध्रु॒वः सी॑द ।।

text:
-EIGHTH.

ON the earth's centre, at libation's place let the Priest worship
 Indra with the kindling-stick.
 The mightiest of the lords of men is kindled on the height
 of heaven.
 Let him enjoy the butter. Hotar, worship.
meaning: होता॑ यक्षद्स॒मिधेन्द्र॑मि॒डस्प॒दे नाभा॑ पृथि॒व्या अधि॑ । दि॒वो वर्ष्म॒न्त्समि॑ध्यत॒ ओजि॑ष्ठश्चर्षणी॒सहां॒ वेत्वाज्य॑स्य॒ होत॒र्यज॑ ।।

text:
Him let the Hotar worship, him Tanûnapât with ready aids;
 the conqueror never overcome,
 Indra, the God who finds heaven's light on paths most rich
 in pleasant sweets, with Narâsamsa all aglow. Let him
 enjoy, etc., as in verse 1.
meaning: होता॑ यक्ष॒त्तनू॒नपा॑तमू॒तिभि॒र्जेता॑र॒मप॑राजितम् । इन्द्रं॑ दे॒वँ स्व॒र्विदं॑ प॒थिभि॒र्मधु॑मत्तमै॒र्नरा॒शँसे॑न॒ तेज॑सा॒ वेत्वाज्य॑स्य॒ होत॒र्यज॑ ।।

text:
With viands let the Hotar worship Indra immortal, praised,
 receiver of oblations.
 The God, the equal of the Gods in vigour, the thunder-wielder,
 breaker-down of castles. Let him enjoy, etc.
meaning: होता॑ यक्ष॒दिडा॑भि॒रिन्द्र॑मीडि॒तमा॒जुह्वा॑न॒मम॑र्त्यम् । दे॒वो देवैः॒ सवी॑र्यो॒ वज्र॑हस्तः पुरंद॒रो वेत्वाज्य॑स्य॒ होत॒र्यज॑ ।।

text:
Let the Priest worship Indra, Bull who sitteth on sacred
 grass, doer of manly actions.
 Let him be seated on the grass with Vasus and Rudras and
 Âdityas for companions. Let him enjoy, etc.
meaning: होता॒ यक्ष॑द्ब॒रिषीन्द्रं॑ निषद्व॒रं वृ॑ष॒भं नर्या॑पसम् । वसु॑भी रुद्रैरादित्यैः सु॒युग्भि॑र्ब॒र्हिरास॑द॒द्वेत्वाज्य॑स्य॒ होत॒र्यज॑ ।।

text:
Let the Priest sacrifice. The Doors have strengthened
 Indra, his force and conquering might and vigour.
 At this our worship let the Doors be opened, easy to pass,
 the strengtheners of Order: wide let them open out for
 bounteous Indra. Let them enjoy, etc.
meaning: होता॑ यक्ष॒दोजो॒ न वी॒र्यँ॒ सहो॒ द्वार॒ इन्द्र॑मवर्धयन् । सु॑प्राय॒णा अ॒स्मिन्य॒ज्ञे वि श्र॑यन्तामृता॒वृधो॒ स्वार॒ इन्द्रा॑य मी॒ढुषे॒ व्यन्त्वाज्य॑स्य॒ होत॒र्यज॑ ।।

text:
Let the Priest sacrifice to Night and Morning, the teeming
 Cows of Indra, Mighty Mothers.
 Indra their calf with lustre have they strengthened, even
 as two mothers of a calf in common. Let them enjoy, etc.
meaning: होता॑ यक्षदु॒षे इन्द्र॑स्य धे॒नू सु॒दुघे॑ मा॒तरा॑ म॒ही । स॑वा॒तरौ॒ न तेज॑सा व॒त्समिन्द्र॑मवर्धतां वी॒तामाज्य॑स्य॒ होत॒र्यज॑ ।।

text:
Let the Priest worship both the heavenly Hotars, Friends,
 Leeches, healing Indra with oblation.
 The sages, Gods preëminent for wisdom bestow on Indra his
 surpassing power. Let them enjoy, etc.
meaning: होता॑ यक्षद्दैव्या॒ होता॑रा भि॒षजा॒ सखा॑या ह॒विषेन्द्रं॑ भिषज्यतः । क॒वी देवौ॒ प्रचे॑तसा॒विन्द्रा॑य धत्त इन्द्रि॒यं वी॒तामाज्य॑स्य॒ होत॒र्यज॑ ।।

text:
Let the Priest offer sacrifice to the three Goddesses and balm.
 Let the three triple active Ones, let Idâ and Sarasvatî and
 Bhâratî the mighty Dames, Consorts of Indra, who receive
 our sacrificial offerings, enjoy the butter, etc.
meaning: होता॑ यक्षत्ति॒स्रो दे॒वीर्न भे॑ष॒जं त्रय॑स्त्रि॒धात॑वो॒ पस॒ इडा॒ सर॑स्व॒त्भार॑ती म॒हीः । इन्द्र॑पत्नीर्ह॒विष्म॑ती॒र्व्यन्त्वाज्य॑स्य॒ होत॒र्यज॑ ।।

text:
Let the Priest worship Tvashtar radiant Indra, Physician
 good at sacrifice, graced with butter,
 Multiform and prolific, rich and bounteous. Let Tvashtar,
 giving wondrous powers to Indra, enjoy, etc.
meaning: होता॑ यक्ष॒त्त्वष्टा॑र॒मिन्द्रं॑ दे॒वं भि॒षजँ॑ सु॒यजं॑ घृत॒श्रिय॑म् । पु॑रु॒रूपँ॑ सु॒रेत॑सं म॒घोन॒मिन्द्रा॑य॒ त्वष्टा॒ दध॑दिन्द्रि॒याणि॒ वेत्वाज्य॑स्य॒ होत॒र्यज॑ ।।

text:
Let the Priest worship him, the Forest-Sovran, the Immolator,
 Lord of Hundred Powers, the lover of the prayer, the
 friend of Indra.
 Balming with mead, may he on easy pathways sweeten our
 sacrifice with savoury butter. Let him enjoy, etc.
meaning: होता॑ यक्ष॒द्वन॒स्पतिँ॑ शमि॒तारँ॑ श॒तक्र॑तुं धि॒यो जो॒ष्टार॑मिन्द्रि॒यम् । मध्वा॑ सम॒ञ्जन्प॒थिभिः॑ सु॒गेभिः॒ स्वदा॑ति य॒ज्ञं मधु॑ना घृ॒तेन॒ वेत्वाज्य॑स्य॒ होत॒र्यज॑ ।।

text:
Let the Priest offer sacrifice to Indra: with Hail! to Gods
 of butter; with Hail! to Gods of marrow; with Hail!
 to Gods of drops; with Hail! to Gods of offerings paid with
 Svâhâ; with Hail! to Gods of sacrificial hymns.
 All hail! May butter-drinking Gods and Indra rejoicing
 taste the butter. Hotar, worship.
meaning: होता॑ यक्ष॒दिन्द्रँ॒ स्वाहाज्य॑स्य॒ स्वाहा॒ मेद॑सः॒ स्वाहा॑ स्तो॒कानाँ॒ स्वाहा॒ स्वाहा॑कृत�नाँ॒ स्वाहा॑ ह॒व्यसू॑क्तीनाम् । स्वाहा॑ दे॒वा आ॑ज्य॒पा जु॑षा॒णा इन्द्र॒ आज्य॑स्य॒ व्यन्तु॒ होत॑र्यज ।।

text:
Vigorous, strewn by Gods upon the altar the right Gods’
 sacred Grass hath strengthened Indra.
 Cut in the day, cherished by night it hath surpassed those
 who have sacrificial Grass with wealth. For gain of riches
 let him taste. Pay sacrifice.
meaning: दे॒वं ब॒र्हिरिन्द्रँ॑ सुदे॒वं देवैर्वी॒रव॑त्स्ती॒र्णं वेद्या॑मवर्धयत् । वस्तो॑र्वृ॒तं प्राक्तोर्भृ॒तँ रा॒या ब॒र्हिष्म॒तो त्य॑गाद्वसु॒वने॑ वसु॒धेय॑स्य वेतु॒ यज॑ ।।

text:
Firm, closely joined, the Doors divine have strengthened
 Indra in the rite.
 Pressed by a calf or tender boy may they drive off the
 courser as he tosses up the sand. For gain of wealth let
 then enjoy. Pay sacrifice.
meaning: दे॒वीर्द्वार॒ इन्द्रँ॑ संघा॒ते वी॒ड्वीर्याम॑न्नवर्धयन् । आ व॒त्सेन॒ तरु॑णेन कुमा॒रेण॑ च मीव॒तापार्वा॑णँ रे॒णुक॑काटं नुदन्तां वसु॒वने॑ वसु॒धेय॑स्य व्यन्तु॒ यज॑ ।।

text:
Morning and Night, the Goddesses, have called on Indra as
 the rite advanced.
 May they well-pleased and ordered well make the Celestial
 Tribes come forth. For gain of wealth let them enjoy.
 Pay sacrifice.
meaning: दे॒वी उ॒षासा॒नक्तेन्द्रं॑ य॒ज्ञे प्र॑य॒त्य॑ह्वेताम् । दै॑वी॒र्विशः॒ प्राया॑सिष्टाँ॒ सुप्री॑ते॒ सुधि॑ते वसु॒वने॑ वसु॒धेय॑स्य वीतां॒ यज॑ ।।

text:
Two Goddesses, wealth-givers, kind, have heightened radiant
 Indra's strength.
 One drives away hatreds and sins; the other shall bring the
 Sacrificer boons and treasure.
 Instructed, let them both enjoy, for gain of wealth. Pay
 sacrifice.
meaning: दे॒वी जोष्ट्री॒ वसु॑धिती दे॒वमिन्द्र॑मवर्धताम् । अया॑व्य॒न्याघा द्वेषाँ॒स्यान्या व॑क्ष॒द्वसु॒ वार्या॑णि॒ यज॑मानाय शिक्षि॒ते व॑सु॒वने॑ वसु॒धेय॑स्य वीतां॒ यज॑ ।।

text:
Bringers of strengthening sacrifice, the Goddesses, the teeming
 Cows, have prospered Indra with their milk.
 Let one bring food and energy, the other feast and banqueting.
 Bringers of strengthening sacrifice, allotting the several portions
 they have put together old energy with new and new
 with olden, strengthening boons and treasures for the
 Sacrificer. Instructed, let them, etc., as in verse 15.
meaning: दे॒वी ऊ॒र्जाहु॑ती॒ दुघे॒ पय॒सेन्द्र॑मवर्धताम् । इष॒मूर्ज॑म॒न्या व॑क्ष॒त्सग्धिँ॒ सपी॑तिम॒न्या नवे॑न॒ पूर्वं॒ दय॑माने पुरा॒णेन॒ नव॒मधा॑ता॒म�॑ती ऊ॒र्जय॑माने॒ वसु॒ वृया॑णि॒ यज॑मानाय शिक्षि॒ते व॑सु॒वने॑ वसु॒धेय॑स्य वीतां॒ यज॑ ।।

text:
The two Celestial Hotars, Gods, have heightened radiant
 Indra's might.
 Freed from slain sinners these have brought the Sacrificer
 wealth and boons. Instructed, let them, etc.
meaning: दे॒वा दे॑व्या॒ होता॑रा दे॒वमिन्द्र॑मवर्धताम् । ह॒ताघ॑शँसा॒वाभा॑र्ष्टां॒ वसु॒ वार्या॑णि॒ यज॑मानाय शिक्षितौ वसु॒वने॑ वसु॒धेय॑स्य वीतां॒ यज॑ ।।

text:
Goddesses three, three Goddesses have heightened their
 Lord Indra's strength.
 One, Bhâratî, hath touched the sky, Sarasvatî the sacrifice
 with Rudras, and, enriched with wealth, Idâ the homesteads
 of the folk. For gain of wealth let them enjoy.
 Pay sacrifice.
meaning: दे॒वीस्ति॒स्रस्ति॒स्रो दे॒वीः पति॒मिन्द्र॑मवर्धयन् । अस्पृ॑क्ष॒द्भार॑ती॒ दिवँ॑ रुद्रैर्य॒ज्ञँ सर॑स्व॒तीडा॑ वसुमती गृ॒हान्व॑सु॒वने॑ वसु॒धेय॑स्य व्यन्तु॒ यज॑ ।।

text:
The radiant Indra, Praise of Men, thrice-shielding, borne on
 three car-seats, hath heightened radiant Indra's strength.
 Set on a hundred white-backed cows, yea, on a thousand
 forth he goes. Mitra and Varuna alone deserve to be his
 Hotar-Priests, Brihaspati his Chanter, and the Asvins his
 Adhvaryavas. For gain of wealth let him enjoy. Pay
 sacrifice.
meaning: दे॒व इन्द्रो॒ नरा॒शँस॑स्त्रिवरू॒थस्त्रि॑बन्धु॒रो दे॒वमिन्द्र॑मवर्धयत् । श॒तेन॑ शितिपृ॒ष्ठाना॒माहि॑तः स॒हस्रे॑ण॒ प्र व॑र्तते मि॒त्रावरु॒णेद॑स्य हो॒त्रमर्ह॑तो॒ बृह॒स्पति॑ स्तो॒त्रम॒श्विनाध्व॑र्यवं वसु॒वने॑ वसु॒धेय॑स्य वेतु॒ यज॑ ।।

text:
Vanaspatî, a God with Gods, with golden leaves, sweet
 boughs, fair fruit, hath heightened radiant Indra's strength.
 Sky with his summit hath he touched, and firmament, and
 stablished earth. For gain of wealth let him enjoy. Pay
 sacrifice.
meaning: दे॒वो देवै॒र्वन॒स्पति॒र्हिर॑ण्यपर्णो॒ मधु॑शाखः सुपिप्प॒लो दे॒वमिन्द्र॑मवर्धयत् । दिव॒मग्रे॑णास्पृक्ष॒दान्तरि॑क्सं पृथि॒वीम॑दृम्हीद्वसु॒वने॑ वसु॒धेय॑स्य वेतु॒ यज॑ ।।

text:
The grassy robe of water-plants, divine, hath heightened
 Indra's strength.
 This, the fair seat where Indra sits, hath topped all other
 sacred grass. For gain of wealth let it enjoy. Pay sacrifice.
meaning: दे॒वं ब॒र्हिर्वारि॑तीनां दे॒वमिन्द्र॑मवर्धयत् । स्वा॑स॒स्थमिन्द्रे॒णास॑न्नम॒न्या ब॒र्हीँष्य॒भ्य॑भूद्वसु॒वने॑ वसु॒धेय॑स्य वेतु॒ यज॑ ।।

text:
Agni, Fair-offering-maker, bright, hath heightened radiant
 Indra's strength.
 To-day may Svishtakrit, Fair-offering-maker, paying good
 sacrifice, for us perform it. For gain of wealth let him
 enjoy. Pay sacrifice.
meaning: दे॒वो अ॒ग्निः स्वि॑ष्ट॒कृद्दे॒वमिन्द्र॑मवर्धयत् । स्वि॑ष्टं कु॒र्वन्त्स्वि॑ष्ट॒कृत्स्वि॑ष्टम॒द्य क॑रोतु नो वसु॒वने॑ वसु॒धेय॑स्य वेतु॒ यज॑ ।।

text:
To-day the Sacrificer hath elected—dressing messes of cooked
 food and a rice-cake, binding a goat for Indra—Agni as
 his Hotar.
 To-day divine Vanaspatî hath with a goat served Indra well.
 He hath eaten from the fat, he hath accepted the cooked
 food, he hath waxed strong with the rice-cake.
 Thee, to-day, O Rishi, etc., as in XXI. 61.
meaning: अ॒ग्निम॒द्य होता॑रमवृणीता॒यं यज॑मानः॒ पच॒न्पक्तीः॒ पच॑न्पुरो॒डाशं॑ ब॒ध्नन्निन्द्रा॑य॒ छाग॑म् । सू॑प॒स्था अ॒द्य दे॒वो वन॒स्पति॑रभव॒दिन्द्रा॑य॒ छागे॑न । अघ॒त्तं मे॑द॒स्तः प्रति॑ पच॒ताग्र॑भी॒दवी॑वृधत्पुरो॒डाशे॑न । त्वाम॒द्य ऋ॑ष आर्षेय ऋषीणां नपादवृणीताय्ं॒ यज॑मानो ब॒हुभ्य॒ आ संग॑तेभ्य ए॒ष मे॑ दे॒वेषु॒ वसु॒ वार्या॑यक्ष्यत॒ इति॒ ता या दे॒वा दे॑व॒ दाना॒न्यदु॒स्तान्य॑स्मा॒ आ च॒ शास्स्वा च॑ गुरस्वेषि॒तश्च॑ होत॒रसि॑ भद्र॒वाच्या॑य॒ प्रेषि॑तो॒ मानु॑षः सूक्तवा॒काय॑ सू॒क्ता ब्रू॑हि ।।

text:
Let the Priest worship Agni, Indra, kindled, splendidly
 kindled, excellent strength-giver,
 Lending him mighty power, Gâyatrî metre, a cow aged
 eighteen months, and vital vigour. Let him enjoy the
 butter. Hotar, worship.
meaning: होता॑ यक्षत्समिधा॒नं म॒हद्यशः॒ सुस॑मिद्धं॒ वरे॑ण्यम॒ग्निमिन्द्रं॑ वयो॒धस॑म् । गा॑य॒त्रीं छन्द॑ इन्द्रि॒यं त्र्यविं॒ गां वयो॒ दध॒द्वेत्वाज्य॑स्य॒ होत॒र्यज॑ ।।

text:
Let the Priest serve with sacrifice him who breaks forth,
 Tanûnapât, the germ which Aditi conceived, pure Indra
 who bestoweth strength,
 Bringing him mighty power, the Ushnih metre, an ox of two
 years old, and vital vigour. Let him enjoy; etc.
meaning: होता॑ यक्ष॒त्तनू॒नपा॑तमु॒द्भिदं॒ यं गर्भ॒मदि॑तिर्द॒धे शुचि॒मिन्द्रं॑ वयो॒धस॑म् । उ॒ष्णिहं॒ छन्द॑ इन्द्रि॒यं दि॑त्य॒वाहं॒ गां वयो॒ दध॒द्वेत्वाज्य॑स्य॒ होत॒र्यज॑ ।।

text:
Let the Priest sacrifice to Soma, Indra, adorable, adored,
 best Vritra-slayer, strength-giver, might, to be adored
 with viands,
 Bringing him mighty power, Anushtup metre, a cow of
 thirty months, and vital vigour. Let him enjoy, etc
meaning: होता॑ यक्षदी॒डेन्य॑मीडि॒तं वृ॑त्र॒हन्त॑म॒मिडा॑भि॒रीड्यँ॒ सहः॒ सोम॒मिन्द्रँ॑ वयो॒धस॑म् । अ॑नु॒ष्टुभं॒ छन्द॑ इन्द्रि॒यं पञ्चा॑विं॒ गां वयो॒ दध॒द्वेत्वाज्य॑स्य॒ होत॒र्यज॑ ।।

text:
Let the Priest worship Indra, strength-bestower, immortal,
 with fair grass, allied with Pûshan, seated on sacred grass,
 dear, everlasting,
 Bringing him mighty power, Brihatî metre, a steer of three
 years’ age and vital vigour. Let him enjoy, etc.
meaning: होता॑ यक्षत्सुब॒र्हिषं॑ पूष॒ण्वन्त॒मम॑र्त्यँ॒ सीद॑न्तं ब॒र्हिषि॑ प्रि॒ये॒ मृतेन्द्रं॑ वयो�॑म् । बृ॑ह॒तीं छन्द॑ इन्द्रि॒यं त्रि॑व॒त्सं गां वयो॒ दध॒द्वेत्वाज्य॑स्य॒ होत॒र्यज॑ ।।

text:
Let the Priest worship the wide-opening Portals, easy to
 pass, divine, Law-strengthening, golden, Indra, the Brahman
 Priest, the strength-bestower,

Bringing him mighty power, the Pankti metre, a bullock
 four years old, and vital vigour. Let them enjoy the
 butter. Hotar, worship.
meaning: होता॑ यक्ष॒द्व्यच॑स्वतीः सुप्राय॒णा ऋ॑ता॒वृधो॒ द्वारो॑ दे॒वीर्हि॑र॒ण्ययी॑र्ब्र॒ह्माण॒मिन्द्रं॑ वयो॒धस॑म् । प॒ङ्क्तिं छन्द॑ इ॒हेन्द्रि॒यं तु॑र्य॒वाहं॒ गां वयो॒ दध॒द्व्यन्त्वाज्य॑स्य॒ होत॒र्यज॑ ।।

text:
Let the Priest worship lofty Night and Morning,
 well-decked, of varied hue, lovely to look on, Indra the
 Universal, strength-bestower,
 Bringing him mighty power, the Trishtup metre, a bullock
 four years old, and vital vigour. Let them enjoy the
 butter. Hotar, worship.
meaning: होता॑ यक्षत्सु॒पेश॑सा सुशि॒ल्पे बृ॑ह॒ती उ॒भे नक्तो॒षासा॒ न द॑र्श॒ते विश्व॒मिन्द्रं॑ वयो॒धस॑म् । त्रि॒ष्टुभं॒ छन्द॑ इ॒हेन्द्रि॒यं प॑ष्ठ॒वहं॒ गां वयो॒ दध॑द्वी॒तामाज्य॑स्य॒ होत॒र्यज॑ ।।

text:
Let the Priest worship both celestial Hotars, the Gods’ best
 glory, sages famed for wisdom, the two companions, Indra
 strength-bestower,
 Bringing him mighty power, Jagatî metre, an ox that draws
 the wain, and vital vigour. Let them enjoy the butter.
 Hotar, worship.
meaning: होता॑ यक्ष॒त्प्रचे॑तसा दे॒वाना॑मुत्त॒मं यशो॒ होता॑रा दैव्या क॒वी स॒युजेन्द्रं॑ वयो॒धस॑म् । जग॑तीं॒ छन्द॑ इन्द्रि॒यम॑न॒ड्वाहं॒ गां वयो॒ दध॑द्वी॒तामाज्य॑स्य॒ होत॒र्यज॑ ।।

text:
Let the Priest sacrifice to three well-decorated Goddesses,
 gold-decked, great, lofty, Bhâratîs, Indra their Lord who
 giveth strength,
 Bringing him mighty power, Virâj the metre, and a cow in
 milk. Let him enjoy the butter. Hotar, worship.
meaning: होता॑ यक्ष॒त्पेश॑स्वतीस्ति॒स्रो दे॒वीर्हि॑र॒ण्ययी॒र्भार॑तीर्बृह॒तीर्म॒हीः पति॒मिन्द्रं॑ वयो॒धस॑म् । वि॒राजं॒ छन्द॑ इ॒हेन्द्रि॒यं धे॒नुं गां न वयो॒ दध॒द्व्यन्त्वाज्य॑स्य॒ होत॒र्यज॑ ।।

text:
Let the Priest worship Tvashtar the prolific, strengthener
 of growth, maintaining varied growth and form, Indra
 who giveth vital force,
 Bringing him Dvipad metre, mighty power, and an ox
 full-grown. Let him enjoy the butter. Hotar, sacrifice.
meaning: होता॑ यक्षत्सु॒रेत॑सं॒ त्वष्टा॑रं पुष्टि॒वर्ध॑नँ रू॒पाणि॒ बिभ्र॑तं॒ पृथ॒क्पुष्टि॒मिन्द्रं॑ वयो॒धस॑म् । द्वि॒पदं॒ छन्द॑ इन्द्रि॒यमु॒क्षाणं॒ गां न वयो॒ दध॒द्वेत्वाज्य॑स्य॒ होत॒र्यज॑ ।।

text:
Let the Priest serve with sacrifice the Forest Lord Vanaspatî,
 the Immolator, hundred-powered, praise-worthy, golden-leafed,
 who wears the girdle, loved, the gracious Lord,
 Indra who gives the strength of life,
 Giving him Kakup metre, mighty power, a barren, a calf-
 slipping cow, and vital vigour. Let him enjoy the butter.
 Hotar, sacrifice.
meaning: होता॑ यक्ष॒द्वन॒स्पतिँ॑ शमि॒तारँ॑ श॒तक्र॑तुँ॒ हिर॑ण्यपर्णमु॒क्थिनँ॑ रश॒नां बिभ्र॑तं व॒शिं भग॒मिन्द्रं॑ वयो॒धस॑म् । क॒कुभं॒ छन्द॑ इ॒हेन्द्रि॒यं व॒शां वे॒हतं॒ गां वयो॒ दध॒द्वेत्वाज्य॑स्य॒ होत॒र्यज॑ ।।

text:
Let the Priest offer worship to the Svâhâkriti Goddesses, to
 Agni Household Lord apart, to Varuna the Leech and
 Sage. might, Indra who bestoweth strength,
 Bringing him Atichhandas metre, great and mighty power,
 a strong bull, his prime, and vital vigour. Let them
 enjoy the butter. Hotar, sacrifice.
meaning: होता॑ यक्ष॒त्स्वाहा॑कृतीर॒ग्निं गृ॒हप॑तिं॒ पृथ॒ग्वरु॑णं भेष॒जं क॒विं क्ष॒त्रमिन्द्रं॑ वयो�॑म् । अति॑च्छन्दसं॒ छन्द॑ इन्द्रि॒यं बृ॒हदृ॑ष॒भं गां वयो॒ दध॒द्व्यन्त्वाज्य॑स्य॒ होत॒र्यज॑ ।।

text:
The Grass divine hath added might to radiant Indra
 strength-giver,
 Laying in Indra wondrous power and sight and strength by
 Gâyatrî. For gain of wealth let him enjoy the butter.
 Offer sacrifice.
meaning: दे॒वं ब॒र्हिर्व॑यो॒धसं॑ दे॒वमिन्द्र॑मवर्धयत् । गा॑य॒त्र्या छन्द॑सेन्द्रि॒यं चक्षु॒रिन्द्रे॒ वयो॒ दध॑द्वसु॒वने॑ वसु॒धेय॑स्य वेतु॒ यज॑ ।।

text:
The Doors divine have magnified bright Indra, who bestoweth
 strength.
 With Ushnih laying mighty power in Indra, vital breath
 and force. For gain of wealth let them enjoy the butter.
 Offer sacrifice.
meaning: दे॒वीर्द्वारो॑ वयो॒धसँ॒ शुचि॒मिन्द्र॑मवर्धयन् । उ॒ष्णिहा॒ छन्द॑सेन्द्रि॒यं प्रा॒णमिन्द्रे॒ वयो॒ दध॑द्वसु॒वने॑ वसु॒धेय॑स्य व्यन्तु॒ यज॑ ।।

text:
Morning and Night, divine Ones, have strengthened bright
 Indra, strength-giver, the Goddesses advanced the God,
 With the Anushtup laying power in Indra, strength and
 vital force. For gain of wealth let them enjoy. Pay
 sacrifice.
meaning: दे॒वी उ॒षासा॒नक्ता॑ दे॒वमिन्द्रं॑ वयो॒धसं॑ दे॒वी दे॒वम॑वर्धताम् । अ॑नु॒ष्टुभा॒ छन्द॑सेन्द्रि॒यं बल॒मिन्द्रे॒ वयो॒ दध॑द्वसु॒वने॑ वसु॒धेय॑स्य वीतां॒ यज॑ ।।

text:
Kind, bounteous, and divine, they have strengthened bright
 Indra, force-giver, the Goddesses advanced the God,
 Laying in Indra power and force and hearing with the
 Brihatî. For gain of wealth let them enjoy. Pay sacrifice.
meaning: दे॒वी जोष्ट्री॒ वसु॑धिती दे॒वमिन्द्रं॑ वयो॒धसं॑ दे॒वी दे॒वम॑वर्धताम् । बृ॑ह॒त्या छन्द॑सेन्द्रि॒यँ श्रोत्र॒मिन्द्रे॒ वयो॒ दध॑द्वसु॒वने॑ वसु॒धेय॑स्य वीतां॒ यज॑ ।।

text:
Bringers of strengthening sacrifice, the Goddesses, two
 teeming cows, have heightened Indra's power with milk,
 Laying bright power in Indra with Pankti, and vital energy.
 For gain of wealth let them enjoy. Pay sacrifice.
meaning: दे॒वी ऊ॒र्जाहु॑ती॒ दुघे॑ सु॒दुघे॒ पय॒सेन्द्रं॑ वयो॒धसं॑ दे॒वी दे॒वम॑वर्धताम् । प॒ङ्क्त्या छन्द॑सेन्द्रि॒यँ शु॒क्रमिन्द्रे॒ वयो॒ दध॑द्वसु॒वने॑ वसु॒धेय॑स्य वीतां॒ यज॑ ।।

text:
The Gods, two heavenly Hotars, have strengthened bright
 Indra, force-giver, those Gods have magnified the God,
 With Trishtup giving Indra power, impetuous might, and
 vital strength. For gain of wealth let them enjoy. Pay
 sacrifice.
meaning: दे॒वा दै॑व्या॒ होता॑रा दे॒वमिन्द्रं॑ वयो॒धसं॑ देवौ दे॒वम॑वर्धताम् । त्रि॒ष्टुभा॒ छन्द॑सेन्द्रि॒यं त्विषि॒मिन्द्रे॒ वयो॒ दध॑द्वसु॒वने॑ वसु॒धेय॑स्य वीतां॒ यज॑ ।।

text:
Goddesses three, three Goddesses have heightened their
 Lord Indra's strength, his who bestoweth vital force,
 Laying in Indra power and might and vital strength with
 Jagatî. For gain of wealth let them enjoy. Pay sacrifice.
meaning: दे॒वीस्ति॒स्रस्ति॒स्रो दे॒वीर्व॑यो॒धसं॒ पति॒मिन्द्र॑मवर्धयन् । जग॑त्या॒ छन्द॑सेन्द्रि॒यँ शूष॒मिन्द्रे॒ वयो॒ दध॑द्वसु॒वने॑ वसु॒धेय॑स्य व्यन्तु॒ यज॑ ।।

text:
The God, the Praise of all men, hath strengthened bright
 Indra force-giver, the God hath magnified the God,
 Laying in Indra with Virâj beauty and power and vital force.
 For gain of wealth let him enjoy. Pay sacrifice.
meaning: दे॒वो नरा॒शँसो॑ दे॒वमिन्द्रं॑ वयो॒धसं॑ दे॒वो दे॒वम॑वर्धयत् । वि॒राजा॒ छन्द॑सेन्द्रि॒यँ रु॒पमिन्द्रे॒ वयो॒ दध॑द्वसु॒वने॑ वसु॒धेय॑स्य वेतु॒ यज॑ ।।

text:
The God the Forest Sovran hath strengthened bright Indra,
 force-giver, the God hath magnified the God,
 With Dvipad storing Indra with fortune and power and vital
 strength. For gain of wealth let him enjoy. Pay sacrifice.
meaning: दे॒वो वन॒स्पति॑र्दे॒वमिन्द्रं॑ वयो॒धसं॑ दे॒वो दे॒वम॑वर्धयत् । द्विप॑दा॒ छन्द॑सेन्द्रि॒यं भग॒मिन्द्रे॒ वयो॒ दध॑द्वसु॒वने॑ वसु॒धेय॑स्य वेतु॒ यज॑ ।।

text:
The Grass divine of water-plants hath helped bright Indra
 force-giver, the God hath magnified the God,
 Laying in Indra mighty power with Kakup, fame and vital
 strength. For gain of wealth let it enjoy. Pay sacrifice.
meaning: दे॒वं ब॒र्हिर्वारि॑तीनां दे॒वमिन्द्रं॑ वयो॒धसं॑ दे॒वं दे॒वम॑वर्धयत् । क॒कुभा॒ छन्द॑सेन्द्रि॒यं यश॒ इन्द्रे॒ वयो॒ दध॑द्वसु॒वने॑ वसु॒धेय॑स्य वेतु॒ यज॑ ।।

text:
Agni, the God who makes fair rites, hath strengthened
 Indra force-giver, the God hath magnified the God,
 Laying with Atichhandas power in Indra, sway, and vital
 strength. For gain of wealth let him enjoy. Pay sacrifice.
meaning: दे॒वो अ॒ग्निः स्वि॑ष्ट॒कृद्दे॒वमिन्द्रं॑ वयो॒धसं॑ दे॒वो दे॒वम॑वर्धयत् । अति॑च्छन्दसा॒ छन्द॑सेन्द्रि॒यं क्ष॒त्रमिन्द्रे॒ वयो॒ दध॑द्वसु॒वने॑ वसु॒धेय॑स्य वेतु॒ यज॑ ।।

text:
To-day the Sacrificer hath elected, etc., as in verse 23.
 To-day divine Vanaspatî, etc.      .   .   .   .   .   .
 Thee, to-day, O Rishi, etc.         .   .   .   .   .   .
meaning: अ॒ग्निम॒द्य होता॑रमवृणीता॒यं यज॑मानः॒ पच॒न्पक्तीः॒ पच॑न्पुरो॒डाशं॑ ब॒ध्नन्निन्द्रा॑य वयो॒धसे॒ छाग॑म् । सू॑प॒स्था अ॒द्य दे॒वो वन॒स्पति॑रभव॒दिन्द्रा॑य वयो॒धसे॒ छागे॑न । अघ॒त्तं मे॑द॒स्तः प्रति॑ पच॒ताग्र॑भी॒दवी॑वृधत्पुरो॒डाशे॑न । त्वाम॒द्य ऋ॑ष आर्षेय ऋषीणां नपादवृणीताय्ं॒ यज॑मानो ब॒हुभ्य॒ आ संग॑तेभ्य ए॒ष मे॑ दे॒वेषु॒ वसु॒ वार्या॑यक्ष्यत॒ इति॒ ता या दे॒वा दे॑व॒ दाना॒न्यदु॒स्तान्य॑स्मा॒ आ च॒ शास्स्वा च॑ गुरस्वेषि॒तश्च॑ होत॒रसि॑ भद्र॒वाच्या॑य॒ प्रेषि॑तो॒ मानु॑षः सूक्तवा॒काय॑ सू॒क्ता ब्रू॑हि ।।

text:
-NINTH.

DECKING the treasure-house of prayers, O Agni, enkindled,
 pouring forth sweet-tasted butter,
 Swift-moving, bearing curd, O Jâtavedas, bear what they
 love to the Gods’ habitation.
meaning: समि॑द्धो अ॒ञ्जन्कृद॑रंमती॒नां घृ॒तम॑ग्ने॒ मधु॑म॒त्पिन्व॑मानः । वा॒जी वह॑न्वा॒जिनं॑ जातवेदो दे॒वानां॑ वक्षि प्रि॒यमा स॒धस्थ॑म् ।।

text:
Balming the paths that lead to heaven with fatness, let the
 Steed go unto the Gods well-knowing.
 Courser, the Quarters of the sky attend thee! Bestow thou
 food upon this Sacrificer.
meaning: घृ॒तेना॒ञ्जन्त्सं प॒थो दे॑व॒याना॑न्प्रजा॒नन्वा॒ज्यप्ये॑तु दे॒वान् । अनु॑ त्वा सप्ते प्र॒दिशः॑ सचन्ताँ स्व॒धामस्मै॒ यज॑मानाय धेहि ।।

text:
Thou, Steed, art meet for laud and veneration; swift, fit for
 sacrifice art thou, O Courser.
 In concert with the Gods and Vasus Agni Omniscient waft
 thee a contented bearer!
meaning: ईड्य॒श्चासि॒ वन्द्य॑श्च वाजिन्ना॒शुश्चासि॒ मेध्य॑श्च सप्ते । अ॒ग्निष्ट्वा॑ देवै॒र्वसु॑भिः स॒जोषाः॑ प्री॒तं वह्निं॑ वहतु जा॒तवे॑दाः ।।

text:
Pleased with much Sacred Grass which we have scattered
 wide spread upon the earth, a pleasant carpet,
 Joined with the Gods may Aditi, accordant, bestowing bliss
 award it happy fortune.
meaning: स्ती॒र्णं ब॒र्हिः सु॒ष्टरी॑मा जु॒षांओरु पृ॒थु प्रथ॑मानं पृथि॒व्याम् । दे॒वेभि॑र्यु॒क्तमदि॑तिः स॒जोषाः॑ स्यो॒नं कृ॑ण्वा॒न सु॑वि॒ते द॑धातु ।।

text:
May these your Doors divine that wear all colours, auspicious,
 with uplifted leaves unfolding,
 Lofty and closely fitted and sonorous, rich in adornment,
 offer easy passage.
meaning: ए॒ता उ॑ वः सु॒भगा॑ वि॒श्वरू॑पा॒ वि पक्षो॑भिः॒ श्रय॑माणा॒ उदातैः॑ । ऋ॒ष्वाः स॒तीः क॒वषः॒ शुम्भ॑माना॒ द्वारो॑ दे॒वीः सु॑प्राय॒णा भ॑वन्तु ।।

text:
Your two Dawns rich in gold and varied colour, travelling
 on ’twixt Varuna and Mitra,
 Acquainted with the face of sacrifices, I settle here within
 the home of Order.
meaning: अ॑न्त॒रा मि॒त्रावरु॑णा॒ चर॑न्ती॒ मुखं॑ य॒ज्ञाना॑म॒भि सं॑विदा॒ने । उ॒षासा॑ वाँ सुहिर॒ण्ये सु॑शि॒ल्पे ऋ॒तस्य॒ योना॑वि॒ह सा॑दयामि ।।

text:
Your two chief Hotars have I pleased, bright-coloured, borne
 on one car, Gods who behold all creatures,
 Those who prepare your rules and ordinances and make you
 see the light by their direction.
meaning: प्र॑थ॒मा वाँ॑ सर॒थिना॑ सु॒वर्णा॑ देवौ॒ पश्य॑न्तौ॒ भुव॑नानि॒ विश्वा॑ । अपि॑प्रयं॒ चोद॑ना वां॒ मिमा॑ना॒ होता॑रा॒ ज्योतिः॑ प्र॒दिशा॑ दि॒शन्ता॑ ।।

text:
Bhâratî with Âdityas love our worship! Sarasvatî with
 Rudras be our helper,
 And Idâ in accord, invoked with Vasus! Goddesses, place
 our rite among the Immortals.
meaning: आ॑दित्यैर्नो॒ भार॑ती वष्टु य॒ज्ञँ सर॑स्वती स॒ह रुद्रैर्न आवीत् । इडोप॑हूता॒ वसु॑भिः स॒जोषा॑ य॒ज्ञं नो॑ देवीर॒मृते॑षु धत्त ।।

text:
The God-devoted son Tvashtar produces: from Tvashtar
 springs to life your fleet-foot Courser.
 Tvashtar gave being to this All about us. Priest, worship
 here the mighty work's achiever.
meaning: त्वष्टा॑ वी॒रं दे॒वका॑मं जजान॒ त्वष्टु॒रर्वा॑ जायत आ॒शुरश्वः॑ । त्वष्टे॒दं विश्वं॒ भुव॑नं जजान ब॒होः क॒र्तार॑मि॒ह य॑क्षि होतः ।।

text:
Let the Steed seek his home, and balmed with butter go of
 himself unto the Gods in season.
 To the Gods’ world Vanaspatî, well-knowing, bear our oblations
 which the fire has tasted!
meaning: अश्वो॑ घृ॒तेन॒ त्मन्या॒ सम॑क्त॒ उप॑ दे॒वाँ ऋ॑तु॒शः पाथ॑ एतु । वन॒स्पति॑र्देवलो॒कं प्र॑जा॒नन्न॒ग्निना॑ ह॒व्या स्व॑दि॒तानि॑ वक्षत् ।।

text:
Thou, waxing by Prajâpati's strong fervour, born quickly,
 guardest sacrifice, O Agni.
 With consecrated offering go, preceding, and let the Sâdhyas,
 Gods, eat our oblation.
meaning: प्र॒जाप॑ते॒स्तप॑सा वावृधा॒नः स॒द्यो जा॒तो द॑धिषे य॒ज्ञम॑ग्ने । स्वाहा॑कृतेन ह॒विषा॑ पुरोगा या॒हि सा॒ध्या ह॒विर॑दन्तु दे॒वाः ।।

text:
What time, first springing into life, thou neighedst, proceeding
 from the sea or cloudy vapour,
 Limbs of the deer hadst thou, and eagle pinions. O Steed,
 thy birth is high and must be lauded.
meaning: यदक्र॑न्दः प्रथ॒मं जाय॑मान उ॒द्यन्त्स॑मु॒द्रादु॒त वा॒ पुरी॑षात् । श्ये॒नस्य॑ प॒क्षा ह॑रि॒णस्य॑ बा॒हू उ॑प॒स्तुत्यं॒ महि॑ जा॒तं ते॑ अर्वन् ।।

text:
This Steed, bestowed by Yama, Trita harnessed, and Indra
 was the first to mount and ride him.
 His bridle the Gandharva grasped. O Vasus, from out the
 Sun ye fashioned forth the Courser.
meaning: य॒मेन॑ द॒त्तं त्रि॒त ए॑नमायुन॒गिन्द्र॑ एणं प्रथ॒मो अध्य॑तिष्ठत् । ग॑न्ध॒र्वो अ॑स्य रश॒नाम॑गृभ्णा॒त्सूरा॒दश्वं॑ वसवो॒ निर॑तष्ट ।।

text:
Yama art thou, O Horse; thou art Âditya; Trita art thou
 by secret operation.
 From Soma thou art thoroughly divided. They say there
 are three bonds in heaven that hold thee.
meaning: असि॑ य॒मो अस्या॑दि॒त्यो अ॑र्व॒न्नसि॑ त्रि॒तो गुह्ये॑न व्र॒तेन॑ । असि॒ सोमे॑न स॒मया॒ विपृ॑क्त आ॒हुस्ते॒ त्रीणि॑ दि॒वि बन्ध॑नानि ।।

text:
Three bonds, they say, thou hast in heaven to bind thee,
 three in the waters, three within the ocean.

To me thou seemest Varuna, O Courser, there where they
 say is thy sublimest birthplace.
meaning: त्रीणि॑ त आहुर्दि॒वि बन्ध॑नानि॒ त्रीण्य॒प्सु त्रीण्य॒न्तः स॑मु॒द्रे । उ॒तेव॑ मे॒ वरु॑णश्छन्त्स्यर्व॒न्यत्रा॑ त आ॒हुः प॑र॒मं ज॒नित्र॑म् ।।

text:
Here, Courser, are the places where they groomed thee;
 here are the traces of thy hooves as winner.
 Here have I seen the auspicious reins that guide thee, which
 those who guard the holy Law keep safely.
meaning: इ॒मा ते॑ वाजिन्नव॒मार्ज॑नानी॒मा श॒पानाँ॑ सनि॒तुर्नि॒धाना॑ । अत्रा॑ ते भ॒द्रा र॑श॒ना अ॑पश्यमृ॒तस्य॒ या अ॑भि॒रक्ष॑न्ति गो॒पाः ।।

text:
Thyself from far I recognized in spirit, a Bird that from
 below flew through the heaven.
 I saw thy head still soaring, striving upward by paths unsoiled
 by dust, pleasant to travel.
meaning: आ॒त्मानं॑ ते॒ मन॑सा॒राद॑जानाम॒वो दि॒वा प॒तय॑न्तं पतं॒गम् । शिरो॑ अपश्यं प॒थिभिः॑ सु॒गेभि॑ररे॒णुभि॒र्जेह॑मानं पत॒त्रि ।।

text:
Here I beheld thy form matchless in beauty, eager to win
 thee food at the Cow's station.
 Whene’er a man brings thee to thine enjoyment, thou
 swallowest the herbs, most greedy eater.
meaning: अत्रा॑ ते रू॒पमु॑त्त॒मम॑पश्यं॒ जिगी॑षमाणमि॒ष आ प॒दे गोः । य॒दा ते॒ मर्तो॒ अनु॒ भोग॒मान॒डादिद्ग्रसि॑ष्ठ॒ ओष॑धीरजीगः ।।

text:
After thee, Courser, come the car, the bridegroom, the kine
 come after, and the charm of maidens.
 Full companies have followed for thy friendship: the pattern
 of thy vigour Gods have followed.
meaning: अनु॑ त्वा॒ रथो॒ अनु॒ मर्यो॑ अर्व॒न्ननु॒ गावो नु॒ भगः॑ क॒नीना॑म् । अनु॒ व्राता॑स॒स्तव॑ स॒ख्यमी॑यु॒रनु॑ दे॒वा म॑मिरे वी॒र्यं॑ ते ।।

text:
His horns are golden and his feet are iron. Less fleet than
 he, though swift as thought, was Indra.
 The Gods came only to the oblation-banquet of him who
 mounted first of all the Courser.
meaning: हिर॑ण्यशृ॒ङ्गो यो॑ अस्य॒ पादा॒ मनो॑जवा॒ अव॑र॒ इन्द्र॑ आसीत् । दे॒वा इद॑स्य हवि॒रद्य॑माय॒न्यो अर्व॑न्तं प्रथ॒मो अ॒ध्यति॑ष्ठत् ।।

text:
Symmetrical in flank, with rounded haunches, mettled like
 heroes, the celestial Coursers
 Put forth their strength like swans in lengthened order when
 they, the Steeds, have reached the heavenly causeway.
meaning: ई॒र्मान्ता॑सः॒ सिलि॑कमध्यमासः॒ सँ शूर॑णासो दि॒व्यासो॒ अत्याः॑ । हँ॒सा इ॑व श्रेणि॒शो य॑तन्ते॒ यदाक्षि॑षुर्दि॒व्यमज्म॒मश्वाः॑ ।।

text:
A body formed for flight hast thou, O Charger; swift as the
 wind in motion is thy spirit.
 Thy horns are spread abroad in all directions; they move
 with restless beat in wildernesses.
meaning: तव॒ शरी॑रं पतयि॒ष्ण्व॑र्व॒न्तव॑ चि॒त्तं वात॑ इव॒ ध्रजी॑मान् । तव॒ शृङ्गा॑णि॒ विष्ठि॑ता पुरु॒त्रार॑ण्येषु॒ जर्भु॑राणा चरन्ति ।।

text:
The strong Steed hath come forward to the slaughter, pondering
 with a mind directed God-ward.
 The goat who is his kin is led before him: the sages and the
 singers follow after.
meaning: उप॒ प्रागा॒च्छस॑नं वा॒ज्यर्वा॑ देव॒द्रीचा॒ मन॑सा॒ दीध्या॑नः । अ॒जः पु॒रो नी॑यते॒ नाभि॑र॒स्यानु॑ प॒श्चात्क॒वयो॑ यन्ति रे॒भाः ।।

text:
The Steed is come unto the noblest mansion, is come unto
 his Father and his Mother.
 This day shall he approach the Gods, most welcome: then
 he declares good gifts to him who worships.
meaning: उप॒ प्रागा॑त्पर॒मं यत्स॒धस्थ॒मर्वाँ॒ अच्छा॑ पि॒तरं॑ मा॒तरं॑ च । अ॒द्या दे॒वान्जुष्ट॑तमो॒ हि ग॒म्या अथा शा॑स्ते दा॒शुषे॒ वार्या॑णि ।।

text:
Thou in the house of man this day enkindled worshippest
 Gods, a God, O Jâtavedas.
 Wealthy in friends! observant, bring them hither. Thou
 art a sapient envoy, full of wisdom.
meaning: समि॑द्धो अ॒द्य मनु॑षो दुरो॒णे दे॒वो दे॒वान्य॑जसि जातवेदः । आ च॒ वह॑ मित्रमहश्चिकि॒त्वान्त्वं दू॒तः क॒विर॑सि॒ प्रचे॑ताः ।।

text:
Tanûnapât, fair-tongued, with sweet mead balming the
 paths and ways of Order, make them pleasant.
 Convey our sacrifice to heaven, exalting with holy thoughts
 our hymns of praise and worship.
meaning: तनू॑नपात्प॒थ ऋ॒तस्य॒ याना॒न्मध्वा॑ सम॒ञ्जन्त्स्व॑दया सुजिह्व । मन्मा॑नि धी॒भिरु॒त य॒ज्ञमृ॒न्धन्दे॑व॒त्रा च॑ कृणुह्यध्व॒रं नः॑ ।।

text:
With sacrifice to these we with laudations will honour holy
