I drive Corpse-eating Agni to a distance: sin-laden let him
 go to Yama's kingdom.
 Here let this other, Jâtavedas, carry oblation to the Deities,
 foreknowing.
meaning: क्र॒व्याद॑म॒ग्निं प्र हि॑णोमि दू॒रं य॑म॒राज्यं॑ गच्छतु रिप्रवा॒हः । इहै॒वायमित॑रो जा॒तवे॑दा दे॒वेभ्यो॑ ह॒व्यं व॑हतु प्रजा॒नन् ।।

text:
Carry the fat to Fathers, Jâtavedas, where, far away, thou
 knowest, them established.
 Let rivulets of marrow flow to meet them, and let their
 truthful wishes be accomplished. All-hail!
meaning: वह॑ व॒पां जा॑तवेदः पि॒तृभ्यो॒ यत्रै॑ना॒न्वेत्थ॒ निहि॑तान्परा॒के । मेद॑सः कु॒ल्या उप॒ तान्त्स्र॑वन्तु स॒त्या ए॑षामा॒शिषः॒ सं न॑मन्ताँ॒ स्वाहा॑ ।।

text:
Pleasant be thou to us, O Earth, without a thorn, our
 resting-place.
 Vouchsafe us shelter reaching far. May thy light drive
 mishap from us.
meaning: स्यो॒ना पृ॑थिवि नो भवानृक्ष॒रा नि॒वेश॑नी । यच्छा॑ नः॒ शर्म॑ स॒प्रथाः॑ । अप॑ नः॒ शोशु॑चद॒घम् ।।
अ॒स्मात्त्वमधि॑ जा॒तो॑ सि॒ त्वद॒यं जा॑यतां॒ पुनः॑ । असौ स्व॒र्गाय॑ लो॒काय॒ स्वाहा॑ ।।

text:
-SIXTH.

REFUGE I take in Speech as Rich: refuge in Mind as
 Yajus-text; refuge in Breath as Sâma-chant; refuge in
 Hearing and in Sight.
 Speech-energy endowed with strength, inbreath and
 outbreath are in me.
meaning: ऋचं॒ वाचं॒ प्र प॑द्ये॒ मनो॒ यजुः॒ प्र प॑द्ये॒ साम॑ प्रा॒णं प्र प॑द्ये॒ चक्षुः॒ श्रोत्रं॒ प्र प॑द्ये । वागोजः॑ सहौजो॒ मयि॑ प्राणापानौ ।।

text:
Whatever deeply-sunk defect I have of eye, or mind, or
 heart, that way Brihaspati amend!
 Gracious to us be he, Protector of the world.
meaning: यन्मे॑ छि॒द्रं चक्षु॑षो॒ हृद॑यस्य॒ मन॑सो॒ वाति॑तृणं॒ बृह॒स्पति॑र्मे॒ तद्द॑धातु । शं नो॑ भवतु॒ भुव॑नस्य॒ यस्पतिः॑ ।।

text:
Earth! Ether! Heaven! May we attain that excellent, etc.,
 as in III. 33.
 With what help will he come to us etc., as in XXVII. 39.
meaning: भूर्भुवः॒ स्वः॑ । तत्स॑वि॒तुर्वरे॑ण्यं॒ भर्गो॑ दे॒वस्य॑ धीमहि । धियो॒ यो नः॑ प्रचो॒दय॑त् ।।

text: What genuine, etc., as in XXVII. 40.
meaning: कया॑ नश्चि॒त्र आ भु॑वदू॒ती स॒दावृ॑धः॒ सखा॑ । कया॒ शचि॑ष्ठया वृ॒ता ।।

text: Do thou who art, etc., as in XXVII. 41.
meaning: कस्त्वा॑ स॒त्यो मदा॑नां॒ मँहि॑ष्ठो मत्स॒दन्ध॑सः । दृ॒ढा चि॑दा॒रुजे॒ वसु॑ ।।

text:
O Hero, with what aid dost thou delight us, with what
 succour bring
 Riches to those who worship thee?
meaning: अ॒भी षु णः॒ सखी॑नामवि॒ता ज॑रितॄ॒णाम् । श॒तं भ॑वास्यू॒तये॑ ।।

text:
Indra is king of all that is: may weal attend our bipeds and
 our quadrupeds.
meaning: कया॒ त्वम्न॑ ऊ॒त्याभि प्र म॑न्दसे वृषन् । क॒या स्तो॒तृभ्य॒ आ भ॑र ।।

text:
Gracious he Mitra unto us, and Varuna and Aryaman;
 Indra, Brihaspati be kind, and Vishnu of the mighty stride.
meaning: इन्द्रो॒ विश्व॑स्य राजति । शं नो॑ अस्तु द्वि॒पदे॒ शं चतु॑ष्पदे ।।

text:
Pleasantly blow the wind for us, may Sûrya warm us
 pleasantly.
 Pleasantly, with a roar, the God Parjanya send the rain on us.
meaning: शं नो॑ मि॒त्रँ शं वरु॑णः॒ शं नो॑ भवत्वर्य॒मा । शं न॒ इन्द्रो॒ बृह॒स्पतिः॒ शं नो॒ विष्णु॑रुरुक्र॒मः ।।

text:
May days pass pleasantly for us, may nights draw near
 delightfully.
 Befriend us with their aids Indra and Agni, Indra and
 Varuna who taste oblations.
 Indra and Pûshan be our help in battle, Indra and Soma
 give health, strength, and comfort.
meaning: शं नो॒ वातः॑ पवताँ॒ शं न॑स्तपतु॒ सूर्यः॑ । शं नः॒ कनि॑क्रदद्दे॒वः प॒र्जन्यो॑ अ॒भि व॑र्षतु ।।

text:
May the celestial Waters, our helpers, be sweet for us to drink,
 And flow with health and strength to us.
meaning: अहा॑नि॒ शं भव॑न्तु नः॒ शँ रात्रीः॒ प्रति॑ धीयताम् । शं न॑ इन्द्रा॒ग्नी भ॑वता॒मवो॑भिः॒ शं न॒ इन्द्रा॒वरु॑णा रा॒तह॑व्या । शं न॑ इन्द्रापू॒षणा॒ वाज॑सातौ॒ शमिन्द्रा॒सोमा॑ सुवि॒ताय॒ शं योः ।।

text: Pleasant be thou to us, O Earth, etc., as in XXXV. 21.
meaning: शं नो॑ दे॒वीर॒भिष्ट॑य॒ आपो॑ भवन्तु पी॒तये॑ । शं योर॒भि स्र॑वन्तु नः ।।

text: Ye, Waters, are, etc., as in XL 50.
meaning: स्यो॒ना पृ॑थिवि नो भवानृक्ष॒रा नि॒वेश॑नी । यच्छा॑ नः॒ शर्म॑ स॒प्रथाः॑ ।।

text: Give us a portion, etc., as in XI. 51.
meaning: आपो॒ हि ष्ठा म॑यो॒भुव॒स्ता न॑ ऊ॒र्जे द॑धातन । म॒हे रणा॑य॒ चक्ष॑से ।।

text: To you we gladly come, etc., as in XI. 52,
meaning: यो वः॑ शि॒वत॑मो॒ रस॒स्तस्य॑ भाजयते॒ह नः॑ । उ॑श॒तीरि॑व मा॒तरः॑ ।।

text:
Sky alleviation, Air alleviation, Earth alleviation, Plants
 alleviation,
 Trees alleviation, All-Gods alleviation, Brahma alleviation,
 Universe alleviation, just Alleviation alleviation—may
 that alleviation come to me!
meaning: तस्मा॒ अरं॑ गमाम वो॒ यस्य॒ क्षया॑य॒ जिन्व॑थ । आपो॑ ज॒नय॑था च नः ।।

text:
Caldron, strengthen me. May all beings regard me with the
 eye of a friend. May I regard all beings with the eye of
 a friend.
 With the eye of a friend do we regard one another.
meaning: द्यौः॒ शान्ति॑र॒न्तरि॑क्षँ॒ शान्तिः॑ पृथि॒वी शान्ति॒रापः॒ शान्ति॒रोष॑धयः॒ शान्तिः॑ । वन॒स्पत॑यः॒ शान्ति॒र्विश्वे॑ दे॒वाः शान्ति॒र्ब्रह्म॒ शान्तिः॒ सर्वँ॒ शान्तिः॒ शान्ति॑रे॒व शान्तिः॒ सा मा॒ शान्ति॑रेधि ।।

text:
Do thou, O Caldron, strengthen me. Long may I live to
 look on thee. Long may I live to look on thee.
meaning: दृते॒ दृँह॑ मा मि॒त्रस्य॑ मा॒ चक्षु॑षा॒ सर्वा॑णि भू॒तानि॒ समी॑क्षन्ताम् । मि॒त्रस्या॒हं चक्षु॑षा॒ सर्वा॑णि भू॒तानि॒ समी॑क्षे । मि॒त्रस्य॒ चक्षु॑षा॒ समी॑क्षामहे ।।

text: Obeisance to thy wrath and glow, etc., as in XXII. 11.
meaning: दृते॒ दृँह॑ मा । ज्योक्ते॑ सं॒दृशि॑ जीव्यासं॒ ज्योक्ते॑ सं॒दृशि॑ जीव्यासम् ।।

text:
Homage to thee the lightning flash, homage to thee the
 thunder's roar!
 Homage, O Bounteous Lord, to thee whereas thou fain
 wouldst win to heaven!
meaning: नम॑स्ते॒ हर॑से शो॒चिषे॒ नम॑स्ते अस्त्व॒र्चिषे॑ । अ॒न्याँस्ते॑ अ॒स्मत्त॑पन्तु हे॒तयः॑ पाव॒को अ॒स्मभ्यँ॑ शि॒वो भ॑व ।।

text:
From whatsoever trouble thou desirest, give us safety thence.
 Give to our children happiness and to our beasts security.
meaning: नम॑स्ते अस्तु वि॒द्युते॒ नम॑स्ते स्तनयि॒त्नवे॑ । नम॑स्ते भगवन्नस्तु॒ यतः॒ स्वः॑ स॒मीह॑से ।।

text: To us let Waters and let Plants be friendly, etc., as in VI. 23.
meaning: यतो॑यतः स॒मीह॑से॒ ततो॑ नो॒ अभ॑यं कुरु । शं नः॑ कुरु प्र॒जाभ्यो भ॑यं नः प॒शुभ्यः॑ ।।

text:
Through hundred autumns may we see that bright Eye,
 God-appointed, rise,
 A hundred autumns may we live.
 Through hundred autumns may we hear; through hundred
 autumns clearly speak: through hundred autumns live
 content; a hundred autumns, yea, beyond a hundred
 autumns may we see.
meaning: सु॑मित्रि॒या न॒ आप॒ ओष॑धयः सन्तु+ दुर्मित्रि॒यास्तस्मै॑ सन्तु॒ यो॒ स्मान्द्वेष्टि॒ यं च॑ व॒यं द्वि॒ष्मः ।।

text:
-SEVENTH.

By impulse of God Savitar I take thee, etc. Spade art thou.
 Woman art thou, etc., as in XI. 9, 10.
meaning: दे॒वस्य॑ त्वा सवि॒तुः प्र॑स॒वे॒ श्विनो॑र्बा॒हुभ्यां॑ पू॒ष्णो हस्ता॑भ्याम् । आ द॑दे॒ नारि॑रसि ।।

text: The priests of him the lofty Priest, etc., as in V. 14.
meaning: यु॒ञ्जते॒ मन॑ उ॒त यु॑ञ्जते॒ धियो॒ विप्रा॒ विप्र॑स्य बृह॒तो वि॑प॒श्चितः॑ । वि होत्रा॑ दधे वयुना॒विदेक॒ इन्म॒ही दे॒वस्य॑ सवि॒तुः परि॑ष्टुतिः॒ स्वाहा॑ ।।

text:
O Heaven and Earth divine, may I duly prepare for you
 this day the head of Makha on the place of earth where
 the Gods sacrificed.
 For Makha thee, thee for the head of Makha!
meaning: देवी॑ द्यावापृथिवी म॒खस्य॑ वाम॒द्य शिरो॑ राध्यासं देव॒यज॑ने पृथि॒व्याः । म॒खाय॑ त्वा म॒खस्य॑ त्वा शी॒र्ष्णे ।।

text:
Ye who were born the earliest of creation, Ants divine, may
 I duly prepare for you this day the head of Makha on
 the place of earth where the Gods sacrificed.
 For Makha thee, thee for the head of Makha!
meaning: देव्यो॑ वम्र्यो भू॒तस्य॑ प्रथम॒जा म॒खस्य॑ वो॒ द्य शिरो॑ राध्यासं देव॒यज॑ने पृथि॒व्याः । म॒खाय॑ त्वा म॒खस्य॑ त्वा शी॒र्ष्णे ।।

text:
Only so large was it at first. Duly may I prepare for you
 this day the head of Makha on earth's place where the
 Gods sacrificed.
 For Makha thee, thee for the head of Makha!
meaning: इय॒त्यग्रे॑ आसीन्म॒खस्य॑ ते॒ द्य शिरो॑ राध्यासं देव॒यज॑ने पृथि॒व्याः । म॒खाय॑ त्वा म॒खस्य॑ त्वा शी॒र्ष्णे ।।

text:
Indra's effective might are ye. Duly may I prepare for you
 this day the head of Makha on earth's place where the
 Gods sacrificed.
 For Makha thee, thee for the head of Makha! For Makha
 thee, thee for the head of Makha! For Makha thee, thee
 for the head of Makha!
meaning: इन्द्रस्यौज स्थ म॒खस्य॑ वो॒ द्य शिरो॑ राध्यासं देव॒यज॑ने पृथि॒व्याः । म॒खाय॑ त्वा म॒खस्य॑ त्वा शी॒र्ष्णे म॒खाय॑ त्वा म॒खस्य॑ त्वा शी॒र्ष्णे म॒खाय॑ त्वा म॒खस्य॑ त्वा शी॒र्ष्णे ।।

text:
May Brahmanaspati draw nigh, etc., as in XXXIII. 89.
 For Makha thee, thee for the head of Makha, etc., as in
 verse 6.
meaning: प्रै॑तु॒ ब्रह्म॑ण॒स्पतिः॒ प्र दे॒व्ये॑तु सू॒नृता॑ । अच्छा॑ वी॒रं नर्यं॑ प॒ङ्क्तिरा॑धसं दे॒वा य॒ज्ञं न॑यन्तु नः । म॒खाय॑ त्वा म॒खस्य॑ त्वा शी॒र्ष्णे म॒खाय॑ त्वा म॒खस्य॑ त्वा शी॒र्ष्णे म॒खाय॑ त्वा म॒खस्य॑ त्वा शी॒र्ष्णे ।।

text:
Thou art the head of Makha. Thee for Makha, thee for
 Makha's head! Thou art the head of Makha. Thee for
 Makha, thee for Makha's head! Thou art the head of
 Makha, thee for Makha, thee for Makha's head!
 For Makha thee, thee for the head of Makha, etc., as in
 verse 6.
meaning: म॒खस्य॒ शिरो॑ सि । म॒खाय॑ त्वा म॒खस्य॑ त्वा शी॒र्ष्णे । म॒खस्य॒ शिरो॑ सि । म॒खाय॑ त्वा म॒खस्य॑ त्वा शी॒र्ष्णे । म॒खस्य॒ शिरो॑ सि । म॒खाय॑ त्वा म॒खस्य॑ त्वा शी॒र्ष्णे । म॒खाय॑ त्वा म॒खस्य॑ त्वा शी॒र्ष्णे म॒खाय॑ त्वा म॒खस्य॑ त्वा शी॒र्ष्णे म॒खाय॑ त्वा म॒खस्य॑ त्वा शी॒र्ष्णे ।।

text:
Thee on Gods’ sacrificial ground with stallion's dung I
 fumigate.
 For Makha thee, thee for the head of Makha!
 For Makha thee, thee for the head of Makha! For Makha
 thee, thee for the head of Makha! For Makha thee, thee
 for the head of Makha!
meaning: अश्व॑स्य त्वा॒ वृष्णः॑ श॒क्ना धू॑पयामि देव॒यज॑ने पृथि॒व्याः । म॒खाय॑ त्वा म॒खस्य॑ त्वा शी॒र्ष्णे । अश्व॑स्य त्वा॒ वृष्णः॑ श॒क्ना धू॑पयामि देव॒यज॑ने पृथि॒व्याः । म॒खाय॑ त्वा म॒खस्य॑ त्वा शी॒र्ष्णे । अश्व॑स्य त्वा॒ वृष्णः॑ श॒क्ना धू॑पयामि देव॒यज॑ने पृथि॒व्याः । म॒खाय॑ त्वा म॒खस्य॑ त्वा शी॒र्ष्णे । म॒खाय॑ त्वा म॒खस्य॑ त्वा शी॒र्ष्णे म॒खाय॑ त्वा म॒खस्य॑ त्वा शी॒र्ष्णे म॒खाय॑ त्वा म॒खस्य॑ त्वा शी॒र्ष्णे ।।

text:
Thee for the True. Thee for the Good. Thee for the place
 of happy rest.

For Makha thee, thee for the head of Makha! For Makha
 thee, thee for the head of Makha! For Makha thee, thee
 for the head of Makha!
meaning: ऋ॒जवे॑ त्वा । सा॒धवे॑ त्वा । सु॑क्षित्यै त्वा । म॒खाय॑ त्वा म॒खस्य॑ त्वा शी॒र्ष्णे म॒खाय॑ त्वा म॒खस्य॑ त्वा शी॒र्ष्णे म॒खाय॑ त्वा म॒खस्य॑ त्वा शी॒र्ष्णे ।।

text:
For Yama thee. For Makha thee. For Sûrya's fervent
 ardour thee.
 May Savitar the God with balm anoint thee. Guard thou
 the touches of the earth.
 Flame art thou; thou art radiance; thou art heat.
meaning: य॒माय॑ त्वा । म॒खाय॑ त्वा । सूर्य॑स्य त्वा॒ तप॑से । दे॒वस्त्वा॑ सवि॒ता मध्वा॑नक्तु । पृ॑थि॒व्याः सँ॒स्पृश॑स्पाहि । अ॒र्चिर॑सि शो॒चिर॑सि॒ तपो॑ सि ।।

text:
Unconquerable, eastward, in Agni's overlordship, give me life.
 Rich in sons, southward, in Indra's overlordship give me
 offspring.
 Fair-seated, westward, in God. Savitar's overlordship, give
 me sight.
 Range of hearing, northward, in Dhâtar's overlordship, give
 me increase of wealth.
 Arrangement, upward, in Brihaspati's overlordship, give me
 energy.
 From all destructive spirits guard us. Thou art Manu's mare.
meaning: अना॑धृष्टा पु॒रस्ता॑द॒ग्नेराधि॑पत्य॒ आयु॑र्मे दाः । पु॒त्रव॑ती दक्षिण॒त इन्द्र॒स्याधि॑पत्ये प्र॒जां मे॑ दाः । सु॒षदा॑ प॒श्चाद्दे॒वस्य॑ सवि॒तुराधि॑पत्ये॒ चक्षु॑र्मे दाः । आस्रु॑तिरुत्तर॒तो धा॒तुराधि॑पत्ये रा॒यस्पोषं॑ मे दाः । विधृ॑तिरु॒परि॑ष्टा॒द्बृह॒स्पते॒राधि॑पत्ये॒ ओजो॑ मे दाः । विश्वा॑भ्यो मा ना॒ष्ट्राभ्य॑स्पाहि । मनो॒रश्वा॑सि ।।

text:
All-hail! By Maruts be thou compassed round.
 Guard the sky's touches. Mead, mead, mead.
meaning: स्वाहा॑ म॒रुद्भिः॒ परि॑ श्रीयस्व । दि॒वः सँ॒स्पृश॑स्पाहि । मधु॒ मधु॒ मधु॑ ।।

text:
Germ of the Gods, Father of hymns, all living creatures’
 guardian Lord,
 Radiant, with radiant Savitar united, with the Sun he shines.
meaning: गर्भो॑ दे॒वानां॑ पि॒ता म॑ती॒नां पतिः॑ प्र॒जाना॑म् । सं दे॒वो दे॒वेन॑ सवि॒त्रा ग॑त॒ सँ सूर्ये॑ण रोचते ।।

text:
Agni combined with flaming fire, combined with Savitar
 divine, hath shone together with the Sun.
meaning: सम॒ग्निर॒ग्निना॑ गत॒ सं दै॑वेन सवि॒त्रा सँ सूर्ये॑णारोचिष्ट । स्वाहा॒ सम॒ग्निस्तप॑सा गत॒ सं दै॑व्येन सवि॒त्रा सँ सूर्ये॑णारूरुचत ।।

text:
He shines on earth upholder of the sky and heat, the Gods
 upholder, God, immortal, born of heat.
 To him address a speech devoted to the Gods.
meaning: ध॒र्ता दि॒वो वि भा॑ति॒ तप॑सस्पृथि॒व्यां ध॒र्ता दे॒वो दे॒वाना॒मम॑र्त्यस्तपो॒जाः । वाच॑मस्मे॒ नि य॑च्छ देवा॒युव॑म् ।।

text:
I saw the Herdsman, him who never stumbles, approaching
 by his pathways and departing.
 He, clothed with gathered and diffusive splendour, within
 the worlds continually travels.
meaning: अप॑श्यं गो॒पामनि॑पद्यमान॒मा च॒ परा॑ च प॒थिभि॒श्चर॑न्तम् । स स॒ध्रीचीः॒ स विषू॑ची॒र्वसा॑न॒ आ व॑रीवर्त्ति॒ भुव॑नेष्व॒न्तः ।।

text:
Lord of all earths, Lord of all mind, Lord of all speech,
 thou Lord of speech entire.
 Heard by the Gods, Caldron divine, do thou, a God, protect
 the Gods.
 Here, after, let it speed you twain on to the banquet of the
 Gods.
 Sweetness for both the sweetness-lovers! Sweetness for
 those the twain who take delight in sweetness!
meaning: विश्वा॑सां भुवां पते॒ विश्व॑स्य मनसस्पते॒ विश्व॑स्य वचसस्पते॒ सर्व॑स्य वचसस्पते । दे॑व॒श्रुत्त्वं दे॑व घर्म दे॒वो दे॒वान्पा॑हि । अत्र॒ प्रावी॒रनु॑ वां दे॒ववी॑तये । मधु॒ माध्वी॑भ्यां॒ मधु॒ माधू॑चीभ्याम् ।।

text:
Thee for the heart, thee for the mind, thee for the sky, for
 Sûrya thee.
 Standing erect lay thou the sacrifice in heaven among the
 Gods.
meaning: हृ॒दे त्वा॒ मन॑से त्वा दि॒वे त्वा॒ सूर्या॑य त्वा । ऊ॒र्ध्वो अ॑ध्व॒रं दि॒वि दे॒वेषु॑ धेहि ।।

text:
Thou art our Father, father-like regard us. Obeisance be to
 thee. Do not thou harm us.
 May we, accompanied by Tvashtar, win thee. Vouchsafe me
 sons and cattle. Grant us offspring. Safe may I be together
 with my husband.
meaning: पि॒ता नो॑ सि पि॒ता नो॑ बोधि॒ नम॑स्ते अस्तु॒ मा मा॑ हिँसीः । त्वष्टृ॑मन्तस्त्वा सपेम पु॒त्रान्प॒शून्मयि॑ धेहि प्र॒जाम॒स्मासु॑ धे॒ह्यरि॑ष्टा॒हँ स॒हप॑त्या भूयासम् ।।

text:
May Day together with his sheen, pair-lighted with his light,
 accept. All-hail!
 May Night together with her sheen, fair lighted with her.
 light, accept. All-hail!
meaning: अहः॑ के॒तुना॑ जुषताँ सु॒ज्योति॒र्ज्योति॑षा॒ स्वाहा॑ । रात्रिः॑ के॒तुना॑ जुषताँ सु॒ज्योति॒र्ज्योति॑षा॒ स्वाहा॑ ।।

text:
-EIGHTH.

BY impulse of God Savitar I take thee with arms of Asvins,
 with the Hands of Pûshan.
 A zone for Aditi art thou.
meaning: दे॒वस्य॑ त्वा सवि॒तुः प्र॑स॒वे॒ श्विनो॑र्बा॒हुभ्यां॑ पू॒ष्णो हस्ता॑भ्याम् । आ द॒दे दि॑त्यै॒ रास्ना॑सि ।।

text:
Idâ, come hither. Aditi, come hither. Sarasvatî, come
 hither.
 Come hither, So-and-So. Come hither, So-and-So. Come
 hither, So-and-So.
meaning: इड॒ एहि॑ । अदि॑त॒ एहि॑ । सर॑स्व॒त्त्येहि॑ । असा॒वेहि॑ । असा॒वेहि॑ । असा॒वेहि॑ ।।

text:
Thou art a zone for Aditi, a diadem for Indrânî. Pûshan art
 thou. Spare some for the Gharma.
meaning: अदि॑त्यै॒ रास्ना॑सीन्द्रा॒ण्या उ॒ष्णीषः॑ । पू॒षासि॑ । घ॒र्माय॑ दीष्व ।।

text:
Overflow for the Asvins. Overflow for Sarasvatî. Overflow
 for Indra
 All-hail, what belongs to Indra! All-hail, what belongs to
 Indra! All-hail, what belongs to Indra!
meaning: अ॒श्विभ्यां॑ पिन्वस्व । सर॑स्वत्पिन्वस्व । इन्द्रा॑य पिन्वस्व । स्वाहेन्द्र॑वत् । स्वाहेन्द्र॑वत् । स्वाहेन्द्र॑वत् ।।

text:
That breast of thine, exhaustless, fount of pleasure, wealth-giver,
 treasure-finder, free-bestower,
 Wherewith thou rearest all things that are choicest,—bring
 that, Sarasvatî, that we may drain it.
 Throughout the spacious middle air I travel.
meaning: यस्ते॒ स्तनः॑ शश॒यो यो म॑यो॒भूर्यो र॑त्न॒धा व॑सु॒विद्यः सु॒दत्रः॑ । येन॒ विश्वा॒ पुष्य॑सि॒ वार्या॑णि॒ सर॑स्व॒त्तमि॒ह धात॑वे कः । उ॒र्व॒न्तरि॑क्ष॒मन्वे॑मि ।।

text:
Thou art Gâyatra metre. Thou art Trishtup metre. With
 Heaven and Earth I grasp thee. With the Firmament I
 raise thee up.
 Indra and Asvins, drink ye the hot draught of sweet honey:
 sacrifice, ye Vasus. Vât! All-hail to the rain-winning
 beam of the Sun!
meaning: गा॑य॒त्रं छन्दो॑ सि । त्रै॑ष्टुभं॒ छन्दो॑ सि । द्यावा॑पृथि॒वीभ्यां॑ त्वा॒ परि॑ गृह्णामि । अ॒न्तरि॑क्षे॒णोप॑ यच्छामि । इन्द्रा॑श्विना । मधु॑नः सार॒घस्य॑ घ॒र्मं पा॑त॒ वस॑वो॒ यज॑त॒ वाट् । स्वाहा॒ सूर्य॑स्य र॒श्मये॑ वृष्टि॒वन॑ये ।।

text:
Thee with Svâhâ to Vâta the sea. Thee with Svâhâ to Vâta
 the flood.
 Thee with Svâhâ to Vâta the unconquerable. Thee with
 Svâhâ to Vâta the irresistible.
 Thee with Svâhâ to Vâta the protection-seeker. Thee with
 Svâhâ to Vâta the non-destructive.
meaning: स॑मु॒द्राय॑ त्वा॒ वाता॑य॒ स्वाहा॑ । स॑रि॒राय॑ त्वा॒ वाता॑य॒ स्वाहा॑ । अ॑नाधृ॒ष्याय॑ त्वा॒ वाता॑य॒ स्वाहा॑ । अ॑प्रतिधृ॒ष्याय॑ त्वा॒ वाता॑य॒ स्वाहा॑ । अ॑व॒स्यवे॑ त्वा॒ वाता॑य॒ स्वाहा॑ । अ॑शिमि॒दाय॑ त्वा॒ वाता॑य॒ स्वाहा॑ ।।

text:
Thee with Svâhâ to Indra Lord of Vasus. Thee with Svâhâ
 to Indra Lord of Rudras.
 Thee with Svâhâ to Indra killer of foes. Thee with Svâhâ
 to Savitar attended by Ribhu, Vibhu, and Vâja. Thee
 with Svâhâ to Brihaspati beloved of all the Gods.
meaning: इन्द्रा॑य त्वा॒ वसु॑मते रु॒द्रव॑ते॒ स्वाहा॑ । इन्द्रा॑य त्वादि॒त्यव॑ते॒ स्वाहा॑ । इन्द्रा॑य त्वाभिमाति॒घ्ने स्वाहा॑ । स॑वि॒त्रे त्व॑ ऋभु॒मते॑ विभु॒मते॒ वाज॑वते॒ स्वाहा॑ । बृह॒स्पत॑ये त्वा वि॒श्वदे॑व्यावते॒ स्वाहा॑ ।।

text:
Svâhâ to Yama attended by the Angirases, attended by the
 Fathers!
 Svâhâ to the Gharma! The Gharma for the Father!
meaning: य॒माय॒ त्वाङ्गि॑रस्वते पितृ॒मते॒ स्वाहा॑ । स्वाहा॑ घ॒र्माय॑ । स्वाहा॑ घ॒र्मः पि॒त्रे ।।

text:
Here hath he worshipped, seated south, all the sky-regions,
 all the Gods.
 Drink, Asvins, of the heated draught, the Svâhâ-consecrated
 mead.
meaning: विश्वा॒ आशा॑ दक्षिण॒सद्विश्वा॑न्दे॒वानया॑डि॒ह । स्वाहा॑कृतस्य घ॒र्मस्य॒ मधोः॑ पिबतमश्विना ।।

text:
In heaven lay thou this sacrifice; lay thou this sacrifice in
 heaven.
 To sacrificial Agni hail! May bliss be ours from Yajus texts.
meaning: दि॒वि धा॑ इ॒मं य॒ज्ञमि॒मम्य॒ज्ञं दि॒वि धाः॑ । स्वाहा॒ग्नये॑ य॒ज्ञिया॑य॒ शं यजु॑र्भ्यः ।।

text:
Drink, Asvins, with your daily helps, the Gharma, strengthener
 of hearts.
 To him who draweth out the thread be homage, and to
 Heaven and Earth.
meaning: अश्वि॑ना घ॒र्मं पा॑तँ॒ हार्द्वा॑न॒मह॑र्दि॒वाभि॑रू॒तिभिः॑ । त॑न्त्रा॒यिणो॒ नमो॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वीभ्या॑म् ।।

text:
The Gharma have the Asvins drunk: with Heaven and
 Earth have they agreed.
 Here, verily, be their boons bestowed.
meaning: अपा॑ताम॒श्विना॑ घ॒र्ममनु॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी अ॑मँसाताम् । इहै॒व रा॒तयः॑ सन्तु ।।

text:
Overflow for food. Overflow for energy. Overflow for the
 Priesthood. Overflow for the Nobility. Overflow for
 Heaven and Earth. Thou, O duteous one, art Duty.
 Innocent one, in us establish manly powers; establish the
 People.
meaning: इ॒षे पि॑न्वस्व । ऊ॒र्जे पि॑न्वस्व । ब्रह्म॑णे पिन्वस्व । क्ष॒त्राय॑ पिन्वस्व । द्यावा॑पृथि॒वीभ्यां॑ पिन्वस्व । धर्मा॑सि सु॒धर्म॑ । अमे॑न्य॒स्मे नृ॒म्णानि॑ धारय॒ ब्रह्म॑ धारय क्ष॒त्रम्धा॑रय॒ विषं॑ धारय ।।

text:
All-hail to Pûshan, to the milk's skin! All-hail to the
 press-stones!
 All-hail to their echoes! All-hail to the Fathers who are
 above the grass, who drink the Gharma! All-hail to
 Heaven and Earth! All-hail to the All-Gods!
meaning: स्वाहा॑ पू॒ष्णे शर॑से । स्वाहा॒ ग्राव॑भ्यः । स्वाहा॑ प्रतिर॒वेभ्यः॑ । स्वाहा॑ पि॒तृभ्य॑ ऊ॒र्ध्वब॑र्हिर्भ्यो घर्म॒पाव॑भ्यः । स्वाहा॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वीभ्या॑म् । स्वाहा॒ विश्वे॑भ्यः दे॒वेभ्यः॑ ।।

text:
All-hail to Rudra invoked by worshippers! All-hail! Let
 light combine with light.
 May Day together with his sheen, fair-lighted with his light,
 accept. All hail!
 May Night together with her sheen, fair-lighted with her
 light, accept. All-hail!
 May we enjoy the mead offered in most Indra-like Agni.
 Homage to thee, divine Gharma! Do not thou injure me.
meaning: स्वाहा॑ रु॒द्राय॑ रु॒द्रहू॑तये । स्वाहा॒ सं ज्योति॑षा॒ ज्योतिः॑ । अहः॑ के॒तुना॑ जुषताँ सु॒ज्योति॒र्ज्योति॑षा॒ स्वाहा॑ । रात्रिः॑ के॒तुना॑ जुषताँ सु॒ज्योति॒र्ज्योति॑षा॒ स्वाहा॑ । मधु॑ हु॒तमिन्द्र॑तमे अ॒ग्नाव॒श्याम॑ ते देव॒ घर्म॒ नम॑स्ते अस्तु॒ मा मा॑ हिँसीः ।।

text:
Thy far-spread majesty, instinct with wisdom, hath
 surpassed this heaven,
 And, with its glorious fame, the earth.
 Seat thee, for thou art mighty: shine, best entertainer of
 the Gods.
 Worthy of sacred food, praised Agni! loose the smoke ruddy
 and beautiful to see.
meaning: अ॒भी॒मं म॑हि॒मा दिवं॒ विप्रो॑ बभूव स॒प्रथाः॑ । उ॒त श्रव॑सा पृथि॒वीँ सँ सी॑दस्व म॒हाँ अ॑सि॒ रोच॑स्व देव॒वीत॑मः ।।

text:
Gharma, that heavenly light of thine in Gâyatrî, in the
 Soma-store,—
 May it increase and be confirmed for thee, that light.
 Gharma, that light of thine in air, in Trishtup, in the sacred
 hearth,—
 May it increase and be confirmed for thee, that light.
 Gharma, that light of thine on earth, in Jagatî, of the priest's
 shed,—
 May that increase and be confirmed for thee, that light.
meaning: या ते॑ घर्म दि॒व्या शुग्या गा॑य॒त्र्याँ ह॑वि॒र्धाने॑ । सा त॒ आ प्या॑यतां॒ निष्प्या॑यतां॒ तस्यै॑ ते॒ स्वाहा॑ । या ते॑ घर्मा॒न्तरि॑क्षे॒ शुग्या त्रि॒ष्टुभ्याग्नी॑ध्रे । सा त॒ आ प्या॑यतां॒ निष्प्या॑यतां॒ तस्यै॑ ते॒ स्वाहा॑ । या ते॑ घर्म पृथि॒व्याँ शुग्या जग॑त्याँ सद॒स्या॑ । सा त॒ आ प्या॑यतां॒ निष्प्या॑यतां॒ तस्यै॑ ते॒ स्वाहा॑ ।।

text:
Thee for the sure protection of the Nobles. Guard thou
 from injury the Brahman's body.
 We follow thee in interest of the People, for the renewal of
 our peace and comfort.
meaning: क्ष॒त्रस्य॑ त्वा प॒रस्पा॑य॒ ब्रह्म॑णस्त॒न्वं॑ पाहि । विश॑स्त्वा॒ धर्म॑णा व॒यमनु॑ क्रामाम सुवि॒ताय॒ नव्य॑से ।।

text:
Square, far-spread is the sacrifice's navel: it spreads for us
 wide, full of all existence, spreads wide for us full of
 complete existence.
 We turn against the hate and guiles of him who keeps an
 alien law.
meaning: चतुः॑स्रक्ति॒र्नाभि॑रृ॒तस्य॑ स॒प्रथाः॒ स नो॑ वि॒श्वायुः॑ स॒प्रथाः॒ स नः॑ स॒र्वायुः॑ स॒प्रथाः॑ । अप॒ द्वेषो॒ अप॒ ह्वरो॒ न्यव्र॑तस्य सश्चिम ।।

text:
This, Gharma! is thy liquid store. Swell out and wax in
 strength thereby.
 May we too grow in strength and wax to greatness.
meaning: घर्मै॒तत्ते॒ पुरी॑षं॒ तेन॒ वर्ध॑स्व॒ चा च॑ प्यायस्व । व॑र्धिषी॒महि॑ च व॒यमा च॑ प्यासिषीमहि ।।

text:
Loudly the tawny Stallion neighed, mighty, like Mitra fair to see.
 Together with the Sun the sea, the store shone out with
 flashing light.
meaning: अचि॑क्रद॒द्वृषा॒ हरि॑र्म॒हान्मि॒त्रो न॑ दर्श॒तः । सँ सूर्ये॑ण दिद्युतदुद॒धिर्नि॒धिः ।।

text:
To us let Waters and let Plants be friendly; to him who
 hates us, whom we hate, unfriendly.
meaning: सु॑मित्रि॒या न॒ आप॒ ओष॑धयः सन्तु+ दुर्मित्रि॒यास्तस्मै॑ सन्तु॒ यो॒ स्मान्द्वेष्टि॒ यं च॑ व॒यं द्वि॒ष्मः ।।

text:
Looking upon the loftier light above the darkness we have come
 To Sûrya, God among the Gods, the light that is most excellent.
meaning: उद्व॒यं तम॑स॒स्परि॒ स्वः॒ पश्य॑न्त॒ उत्त॑रम् । दे॒वं दे॑व॒त्रा सूर्य॒मग॑न्म॒ ज्योति॑रुत्त॒मम् ।।

text:
A brand art thou, fain would we thrive, Fuel art thou, and
 splendour: Give me splendour,
meaning: एधो॑ स्येधिषी॒महि॑ । स॒मिद॑सि॒ तेजो॑ सि॒ तेजो॒ मयि॑ धेहि ।।

text:
Far as the heaven and earth are spread in compass, far as
 the Seven Rivers are extended,
 So vast thy cup which I with strength am taking, Indra,
 unharmed in me, uninjured ever.
meaning: याव॑तो॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी याव॑च्च स॒प्त सिन्ध॑वो वितस्थि॒रे । तव॑न्तमिन्द्र ते॒ ग्रह॑मू॒र्जा गृ॑ह्णा॒म्यक्षि॑तं॒ मयि॑ गृह्णा॒म्यक्षि॑तम् ।।

text:
In me be that great hero power, in me be strength and
 mental force:
 The Gharma shines with triple light, with lustre fulgent
 far away, with holy lore, with brilliancy.
meaning: मयि॒ त्यदि॑न्द्रि॒यं बृ॒हन्मयि॒ दक्षो॒ मयि॒ क्रतुः॑ । घ॒र्मस्त्रि॒शुग्वि रा॑जति वि॒राजा॒ ज्योति॑षा स॒ह ब्रह्म॑णा॒ तेज॑सा स॒ह ।।

text:
Brought hither is the seed of milk. Through each succeeding
 year may we enjoy the bliss of draining it.
 Invited, I enjoy a share of that which hath been offered me,
 the savoury draught by Indra drunk and tasted by Prajâpati.
meaning: पय॑सो॒ रेत॒ आभृ॑तं॒ तस्य॒ दोह॑मशीम॒ह्युत्त॑राम्ुत्तराँ॒ समा॑म् । त्विषः॑ सं॒वृक्क्रत्वे॒ दक्ष॑स्य ते सुषुवा॒णस्य॑ ते सुषुम्णाग्निहु॒तः । इन्द्र॑पीतस्य प्र॒जाप॑तिभक्षितस्य॒ मधु॑मत॒ उप॑हूत॒ उप॑हूतस्य भक्षयामि ।।

text:
-NINTH.

SVÂHÂ to the Vital Breathings with their Controlling Lord!
 To Earth Svâhâ! To Agni Svâhâ! To Firmament, Svâhâ!
 To Vâyu Svâhâ! To Sky Svâhâ! To Sûrya Svâhâ!
meaning: स्वाहा॑प्रा॒णेभ्यः॒ साधि॑पतिकेभ्यः । पृ॑थिव्यै॒ स्वाहा॑ । अ॒ग्नये॒ स्वाहा॑ । अ॒न्तरि॑क्षे॒ स्वाहा॑ । वा॒यवे॒ स्वाहा॑ । दि॒वे स्वाहा॑ । सूर्या॑य॒ स्वाहा॑ ।।

text:
To the Quarters Svâhâ! To the Moon Svâhâ! To the Stars
 Svâhâ! To the Waters Svâhâ! To Varuna Svâhâ! To
 the Navel Svâhâ! To the Purified Svâhâ!
meaning: दि॒ग्भ्यः स्वाहा॑ । च॒न्द्राय॒ स्वाहा॑ । नक्ष॑त्रेभ्यः॒ स्वाहा॑ । अ॒द्भ्यः स्वाहा॑ । वरु॑णाय॒ स्वाहा॑ । नाभ्यै॒ स्वाहा॑ । पू॒ताय॒ स्वाहा॑ ।।

text:
To Speech Svâhâ! To Breath Svâhâ! To Breath Svâhâ!
 To Sight Svâhâ! To Sight Svâhâ! To Hearing Svâhâ!
 To Hearing Svâhâ!
meaning: वा॒चे स्वाहा॑ । प्रा॒णाय॒ स्वाहा॑ । प्रा॒णाय॒ स्वाहा॑ । चक्षु॑षे॒ स्वाहा॑ । चक्षु॑षे॒ स्वाहा॑ । श्रोत्रा॑य॒ स्वाहा॑ । श्रोत्रा॑य॒ स्वाहा॑ ।।

text:
The wish and purpose of the mind and truth of speech may
 I obtain.
 Bestowed on me be cattle's form, swept taste of food, and
 fame and grace. Svâhâ!
meaning: मन॑सः॒ काम॒माकू॑तिं वा॒चः स॒त्यम॑शीय । प॑शू॒नाँ रू॒पमन्न॑स्य॒ रसो॒ यशः॒ श्रीः श्र॑यतां॒ मयि॒ स्वाहा॑ ।।

प्र॒जाप॑तिः संभ्रि॒यमा॑णः स॒म्राट्संभृ॑तो वैश्वदे॒वः सँ॑स॒न्नो घ॒र्मः प्रवृ॑क्त॒स्तेज॒ उद्य॑त आश्वि॒नः पय॑स्यानी॒यमा॑ने पौ॒ष्णो विष्प॒न्दमा॑ने मारु॒तः क्लथ॑न् । मै॒त्रः शर॑सि संता॒य्यमा॑ने वाय॒व्यो॑ ह्रि॒यमा॑ण आग्ने॒यो हू॒यमा॑नो॒ वाग्घु॒तः ।।

text:
Savitar on the first day; Agni on the second; Vâyu on the
 third; Âditya (the Sun) on the fourth; Chandramâs (the
 Moon) on the fifth; Ritu on the sixth; the Maruts on
 the seventh; Brihaspati on the eighth; Mitra on the
 ninth; Varuna on the tenth; Indra on the eleventh;
 the All-Gods on the twelfth.
meaning: स॑वि॒ता प्र॑थ॒मे ह॑न्न॒ग्निर्द्वि॒तीये॑ वा॒युस्तृ॒तीय॑ आदि॒त्यश्च॑तु॒र्थे च॒न्द्रमाः॑ पञ्च॒म ऋ॒तुः ष॒ष्ठे म॒रुतः॑ सप्त॒मे बृह॒स्पति॑रष्ट॒मे । मि॒त्रो न॑व॒मे वरु॑णो दश॒म इन्द्र॑ एकाद॒शे विश्वे॑ दे॒वा द्वा॑द॒शे ।।

text:
Fierce; Terrible; The Resonant; The Roarer; Victorious;
 Assailant; and Dispeller. Svâhâ.
meaning: उ॒ग्रश्च॑ भी॒मश्च॒ ध्वा॑न्तश्च॒ धुनि॑श्च । सा॑स॒ह्वाँश्चा॑भियु॒ग्वा च॑ वि॒क्षिपः॒ स्वाहा॑ ।।

The Fierce with blood; Mitra with obedience, Rudra with
 disobedience; Indra with pastime; the Maruts with
 strength; the Sâdhyas with enjoyment.
 Bhava's is what is on the throat; Rudra's what is between
 the ribs; Mahâdeva's is the liver; Sarva's the rectum;
 Pasupati's the pericardium.

text:
ENVELOPED by the Lord must be This All—each thing that
 moves on earth.
 With that renounced enjoy thyself. Covet no wealth of
 any man.

One, only doing Karma here, should wish to live a hundred
 years.
 No way is there for thee but this. So Karma cleaveth not
 to man.

Aye, to the Asuras belong those worlds enwrapt in blinding
 gloom.
 To them, when life on earth is done, depart the men who
 kill the Self.

Motionless, one, swifter than Mind—the Devas failed to
 o’ertake it speeding on before them.
 It, standing still, outstrips the others running. Herein Both
 Mâtarisvan stablish Action.

It moveth; it is motionless. It is far distant; it is near.
 It is within This All; and it surrounds This All externally.

The man who in his Self beholds all creatures and all things
 that be,
 And in all beings sees his Self, thence doubts no longer,
 ponders not.

When, in the man who clearly knows, Self hath become all
 things that are,

What wilderment, what grief is there in him who sees the
 One alone?

He hath attained unto the Bright, Bodiless, Woundless,
 Sinewless, the Pure which evil hath not pierced.
 Far-sighted, wise, encompassing, he self-existent hath
 prescribed aims, as propriety demands, unto the
 everlasting Years.

Deep into shade of blinding gloom fall Asambhûti's
 worshippers.
 They sink to darkness deeper yet who on Sambhûti are
 intent.

One fruit, they say, from Sambhava, another from Asambhava.
 Thus from the sages have we heard who have declared this
 lore to us.

The man who knows Sambhûti and Vinâsa simultaneously,
 He, by Vinâsa passing death, gains by Sambhûti endless life.

To blinding darkness go the men who make a cult of
 Nescience.
 The devotees of Science enter darkness that is darker still.

Different is the fruit, they say, of Science and of Nescience.
 Thus from the sages have we heard who have declared this
 lore to us.

The man who knoweth well these two, Science and Nescience,
 combined,
 O’ercoming death by Nescience by Science gaineth endless
 life.

By goodly path lead us to riches, Agni, thou God who
 knowest all our works and wisdom.
 Remove the sin that makes us stray and wander: most
 ample adoration will we bring thee.

The Real's face is hidden by a vessel formed of golden light.
 The Spirit yonder in the Sun, the Spirit dwelling there am I.
 OM! Heaven! Brahma!
